Text

﻿THE [COUNTESS OF ALBANY]190-countess of albany

BY [VERNON LEE]191-vernon lee

TO THE MEMORY OF [[MY]0-i FRIEND]516-my friend

[MADAME JOHN MEYER]192-madame john meyer ,

[I]0-i DEDICATE THIS VOLUME , SO OFTEN AND SO LATELY TALKED OVER TOGETHER , IN GRATEFUL AND AFFECTIONATE REGRET .

PREFACE

In preparing this volume on [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]196-alfieri which [I]0-i consider as a kind of completion of [my]0-i previous studies of [eighteenth - century [Italy]3-italy]517-eighteenth - century italy , [I]0-i have availed [myself]0-i largely of [Baron Alfred von Reumont]193-baron von reumont 's large work [Die Gräfin von Albany]194-die gräfin von albany published in 1862 ; and of the monograph , itself partially founded on the foregoing , of [M. St. René Taillandier]195-m. st. rené taillandier , entitled La Comtesse d'Albany , published in [Paris]4-paris in 1862 . [Baron von Reumont]193-baron von reumont 's two volumes , written twenty years ago and when the generation which had come into personal contact with [the Countess of Albany]196-alfieri had not yet entirely died out ; and [M. St. René Taillandier]195-m. st. rené taillandier 's volume , which embodied the result of [his]518-his researches into [the archives of the Musée Fabre at [Montpellier]5-montpellier]519-the archives of the musée fabre at montpellier ; might naturally be expected to have exhausted all the information obtainable about the subject of [their]520-their and [my]0-i studies . This has proved to be the case very much less than might have been anticipated . The publication , by [Jacopo Bernardi]197-jacopo bernardi and [Carlo Milanesi]198-carlo milanesi , of a number of letters of [Alfieri]196-alfieri to [Sienese friends]521-sienese friends , has afforded [me]0-i an insight into [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's character and [his]196-alfieri relations with [the Countess of Albany]196-alfieri such as was unattainable to [Baron von Reumont]193-baron von reumont and to [M. St. René Taillandier]195-m. st. rené taillandier . The examination , by [myself]0-i and [[my]0-i friend]516-my friend [Signor Mario Pratesi]199-signor mario pratesi , of several hundreds of MS . letters of [the Countess of Albany]196-alfieri existing in public and private archives at [Siena]6-siena and at [Milan]7-milan , has added an important amount of what [I]0-i may call psychological detail , overlooked by [Baron von Reumont]193-baron von reumont and unguessed by [M. St. René Taillandier]195-m. st. rené taillandier . [I]0-i have , therefore , [I]0-i trust , been able to reconstruct [the Countess of Albany]196-alfieri 's spiritual likeness during the period - that of [her]523-her early connection with [Alfieri]196-alfieri - which [[my]0-i predecessors]524-my predecessors have been satisfied to despatch in comparatively few pages , counterbalancing the thinness of this portion of [their]524-my predecessors biographies by a degree of detail concerning [the Countess]196-alfieri 's latter years , and [the friends with whom [she]523-her then corresponded]525-the friends with whom she then corresponded , which , however interesting , can not be considered as vital to the real subject of [their]524-my predecessors works .

Besides the volumes of [Baron von Reumont]193-baron von reumont and [M. St. René Taillandier]195-m. st. rené taillandier , [I]0-i have depended mainly upon [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's autobiography , edited by [Professor Teza]200-professor teza , and supplemented by [Bernardi]197-jacopo bernardi 's and [Milanesi]198-carlo milanesi 's Lettere di [Vittorio Alfieri]196-alfieri , published by [Le Monnier]202-le monnier in 1862 . Among English books that [I]0-i have put under contribution , [I]0-i may mention [Klose]203-klose 's Memoirs of [Prince Charles Edward Stuart Colburn]204-charles edward , 1845 , [Ewald]205-ewald 's Life and Times of [Prince Charles Stuart Chapman and Hall]206-prince charles stuart chapman and hall , 1875 , and [Sir Horace Mann]207-sir horace mann 's Letters to [Walpole]257-walpole , edited by [Dr. Doran]208-dr. doran . A review , variously attributed to [Lockhart]209-lockhart and to [Dennistoun]210-dennistoun , in the Quarterly for 1847 , has been all the more useful to [me]0-i as [I]0-i have been unable to procure , writing in [Italy]3-italy , the Tales of the Century , of which that paper gives a masterly account .

For various details [I]0-i must refer to [Charles Dutens]211-charles dutens ' Mémoires d'un Voyageur qui se repose [Paris]4-paris , 1806 ; to [Silvagni]212-silvagni 's La Corte e la Societ Romana nel secolo XVIII . ; to [Foscolo]213-foscolo 's Correspondence , [Gino Capponi]214-gino capponi 's Ricordi and those of [d'Azeglio]526-d'azeglio ; to [Giordani]215-giordani 's works and [Benass Montanari]216-benass montanari 's Life of [Ippolito Pindemonti]217-ippolito pindemonti , besides the books quoted by [Baron Reumont]193-baron von reumont ; and for what [I]0-i may call the general pervading historical colouring if indeed [I]0-i have succeeded in giving any of the background against which [I]0-i have tried to sketch [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany , [Charles Edward]204-charles edward and [Alfieri]196-alfieri , [I]0-i can only refer generally to what is now a vague mass of detail accumulated by [myself]0-i during the years of preparation for [my]0-i Studies of the Eighteenth Century in [Italy]3-italy .

[My]0-i debt to the kindness of persons who have put unpublished matter at [my]0-i disposal , or helped [me]0-i to collect various information , is a large one . In the first category , [I]0-i wish to express [my]0-i best thanks to [the Director of [the Public Library at [Siena]6-siena]529-the public library at siena]528-the director of the public library at siena ; to [Cavaliere Guiseppe Porri]218-cavaliere guiseppe porri , a great collector of autographs , in [the same city]530-the same city ; to [the Countess Baldelli]219-the countess baldelli and [Cavaliere Emilio Santarelli of [Florence]9-florence , who possess some most curious portraits and other relics of [the Countess of Albany]196-alfieri , [Prince Charles Edward]204-charles edward , and [Alfieri]196-alfieri]531-cavaliere emilio santarelli of florence , who possess some most curious portraits and other relics of the countess of albany , prince charles edward , and alfieri ; and also to [[[my]0-i friend]516-my friend [Count Pierre Boutourline]220-count pierre boutourline , whose grandfather and great - aunt were among [[Madame d'Albany]534-madame d'albany 's friends]535-madame d'albany 's friends]533-my friend count pierre boutourline , whose grandfather and great - aunt were among madame d'albany 's friends . Among those who have kindly given [me]0-i the benefit of [their]536-their advice and assistance , [I]0-i must mention foremost [[my]0-i friend]516-my friend [Signor Mario Pratesi]199-signor mario pratesi , [the eminent novelist]538-the eminent novelist ; and next to [him]516-my friend [the learned Director of [the State Archives of [Florence]9-florence]540-the state archives of florence , [Cavaliere Gaetano Milanese]221-cavaliere gaetano milanese , and [Doctor Guido Biagi]222-doctor guido biagi , of [the Biblioteca Vittorio Emanuel of [Rome]10-rome]223-the biblioteca vittorio emanuel of rome , without whose kindness [my]0-i work would have been quite impossible .

[Florence]9-florence]539-the learned director of the state archives of florence , cavaliere gaetano milanese , and doctor guido biagi , of the biblioteca vittorio emanuel of rome , without whose kindness my work would have been quite impossible . florence , March 15 , 1884 .

CHAPTER I.

[THE BRIDE]541-the bride .

On the Wednesday or Thursday of Holy Week of the year 1772 [the inhabitants of [the squalid and dilapidated little mountain towns between [Ancona]11-ancona and [Loreto]12-loreto]543-the squalid and dilapidated little mountain towns between ancona and loreto]542-the inhabitants of the squalid and dilapidated little mountain towns between ancona and loreto were thrown into great excitement by the passage of a travelling equipage , doubtless followed by two or three dependent chaises , of more than usual magnificence .

[The people of those parts]544-the people of those parts have little to do now - a - days , and must have had still less during the Pontificate of [His]516-my friend Holiness [Pope Clement XIV]224-clement xiv . ; and [we]545-we can imagine how all the windows of [the unplastered houses]546-the unplastered houses , all the black and oozy doorways , must have been lined with heads of [women]547-women and [children]548-children ; how [the principal square of [each town]550-each town , where the horses were changed]549-the principal square of each town , where the horses were changed , must have been crowded with [inquisitive townsfolk]551-inquisitive townsfolk and [peasants]552-peasants , whispering , as [they]551-inquisitive townsfolk hung about [the carriages]553-the carriages , that [the great traveller]554-the great traveller was [the young Queen of [England]13-england]555-the young queen of england going to meet [[her]555-the young queen of england bridegroom]556-her bridegroom ; a thing to be remembered in [such world - forgotten places]557-such world - forgotten places as these , and which must have furnished the subject of conversation for months and years , till that Queen of [England]13-england and [[her]555-the young queen of england bridegroom]556-her bridegroom had become part and parcel of the tales of the " Three Golden Oranges , "[3879-the " king of portugal 's cowherd] of [the " King of [Portugal]14-portugal 's Cowherd]3879-the " king of portugal 's cowherd , "[561-the queen of england] of the " Wonderful Little Blue Bird , "[3879-the " king of portugal 's cowherd] and such - like stories in the minds of [the children of [those Apennine cities]560-those apennine cities]559-the children of those apennine cities . [The Queen of [England]13-england]561-the queen of england going to meet [[her]555-the young queen of england bridegroom]556-her bridegroom at [the Holy House of Loreto]563-the holy house of loreto . The notion , even to [us]564-us , does savour strangely of the fairy tale .

What were , meanwhile , the thoughts of [the beautiful little fairy princess , with laughing dark eyes and shining golden hair , and brilliant fair skin]565-the beautiful little fairy princess , with laughing dark eyes and shining golden hair , and brilliant fair skin , more brilliant for the mysterious patches of rouge upon the cheeks , and vermilion upon the lips , whom [the more audacious or fortunate of [the townsfolk]567-the townsfolk]566-the more audacious or fortunate of the townsfolk caught a glimpse of seated in [her]561-the queen of england gorgeous travelling dress for the eighteenth century was still in its stage of pre - revolutionary brocade and gold lace and powder and spangles behind the curtains of [the coach]568-the coach ? [Louise]225-louise , [Princess of [Stolberg]15-stolberg - [Gedern]16-gedern , and ex - Canoness of [Mons]17-mons]226-princess of stolberg - gedern , and ex - canoness of mons , was , if [we]564-us may judge by the crayon portrait and the miniature done about that time , much more of [a child]569-a child than [most women of nineteen]570-most women of nineteen . [A clever and accomplished young lady]571-a clever and accomplished young lady , but , one would say , with , as yet , more intelligence and acquired pretty little habits and ideas than character ; [a childish woman of [the world]573-the world]572-a childish woman of the world , [a bright , light handful of thistle - bloom]574-a bright , light handful of thistle - bloom . And thus , besides the confusion , the unreality due to precipitation of events and change of scene , the sense that [she]561-the queen of england had how long ago - days , weeks , or years ? in such a state time becomes a great muddle and mystery been actually married by proxy , that [she]561-the queen of england had come the whole way from [Paris]4-paris , through [Venice]18-venice and across [the sea]575-the sea , besides being in this dream - like , phantasmagoric condition , which must have made all things seem light - it is probable that [the young lady]576-the young lady had scarcely sufficient consciousness of [herself]576-the young lady as [a grown - up , independent , independently feeling and thinking creature]577-a grown - up , independent , independently feeling and thinking creature , to feel or think very strongly over [her]576-the young lady situation . It was the regular thing for [girls of [Louise]225-louise of [Stolberg]15-stolberg 's]578-girls of louise of stolberg 's rank to be put through a certain amount of rather vague convent education , as [she]561-the queen of england had been at [Mons]17-mons ; to be put through a certain amount of balls and parties ; to be put through the formality of betrothal and marriage ; all this was the half - conscious dream - then would come the great waking up . And [[Louise]225-louise of [Stolberg]15-stolberg]579-louise of stolberg was , most likely , in a state of feeling like that which comes to [us]580-us with the earliest light through the blinds : pleasant , or unpleasant ? [We]580-us know not which ; still drowsing , dreaming , but yet strongly conscious that in a moment [we]580-us shall be awake to reality .

There was , nevertheless , in the position of [this girl]581-this girl something which , even in these circumstances , must have compelled [her]581-this girl to think , or , at all events , to meditate , however confusedly , upon the present and the future . If [she]581-this girl had in [her]581-this girl the smallest spark of imagination [she]581-this girl must have felt , to an acute degree , the sort of continuous surprise , recurring like the tick of a clock , which haunts [us]580-us sometimes with the fact that it really does just happen to be [ourselves]580-us to whom some curious lot , some rare combination of the numbers in life 's lottery , has come . For [the man whom [she]581-this girl was going to marry]582-the man whom she was going to marry - nay , to whom , in a sense , [she]581-this girl was married already - the unknown whom [she]581-this girl [would see for the first time that evening]583-would see for the first time that evening , was not [the mere typical bridegroom]584-the mere typical bridegroom , [the mere man of rank and fortune]585-the mere man of rank and fortune , to whom , whatever [his]582-the man whom she was going to marry particular individual shape and name , [the daughter of [a high - born but impoverished house]587-a high - born but impoverished house had known [herself]581-this girl , since [her]581-this girl childhood , to be devoted .

[Louise Maximilienne Caroline Emanuele]225-louise , daughter of [the late Prince Gustavus Adolphus of [Stolberg]15-stolberg]588-the late prince gustavus adolphus of stolberg - [Gedern]16-gedern , [Prince of [the Empire]590-the empire]589-prince of the empire , who had died , [a Colonel of [Maria Theresa]227-maria theresa , in the battle of [Leuthen]19-leuthen]591-a colonel of maria theresa , in the battle of leuthen]586-the daughter of a high - born but impoverished house had known herself , since her childhood , to be devoted . louise maximilienne caroline emanuele , daughter of the late prince gustavus adolphus of stolberg - gedern , prince of the empire , who had died , a colonel of maria theresa , in the battle of leuthen ; and of [Elisabeth Philippine]228-elisabeth philippine , [Countess of [Horn]20-horn]592-countess of horn , born at [Mons]17-mons in [Hainaut]21-hainaut , the 20th September 1752 , educated [there]593-there in [a convent]594-a convent , and subsequently admitted to the half - ecclesiastic , half - worldly dignity of Canoness of [Ste]22-ste . Wandru in [that town]595-that town : [Louise]225-louise , [Princess of [Stolberg]15-stolberg]596-princess of stolberg , now in [her]225-louise twentieth year , had been betrothed , and , a few weeks ago , married by proxy in [Paris]4-paris to [Charles Edward Stuart]204-charles edward , known to history as [the Younger Pretender]597-the younger pretender , to popular imagination as [Bonnie Prince Charlie]229-bonnie prince charlie , and to society in the second half of the eighteenth century as [the Count of]598-the count of [Albany]196-alfieri . The match had been made up hurriedly - most probably without consulting , or dreaming of consulting , [the girl]599-the girl - by [[her]599-the girl mother]600-her mother , [the dowager [Princess Stolberg]226-princess of stolberg - gedern , and ex - canoness of mons]601-the dowager princess stolberg , and [the Duke of Fitz - James]602-the duke of fitz - james , [[Charles Edward]204-charles edward 's cousin]603-charles edward 's cousin . [The French Minister]604-the french minister , [Duc d'Aiguillon]230-duc d'aiguillon , in one of those fits of preparing [Charles Edward]204-charles edward as a weapon against [England]13-england , which had more than once cost [the Pretender]605-the pretender so much bitterness , and [the Court of [Versailles]23-versailles]606-the court of versailles so much brazenly endured shame , had intimated to [the Count of [Albany]196-alfieri]607-the count of albany that [he]204-charles edward had better take unto [himself]204-charles edward [a wife]608-a wife . [Charles Edward]204-charles edward had more than once refused ; this time [he]204-charles edward accepted , and [[his]204-charles edward cousin]609-his cousin [Fitz - James]231-fitz - james looked around for [a possible future Queen of [England]13-england]610-a possible future queen of england . Now it happened that [the eldest son of [Fitz - James]231-fitz - james]611-the eldest son of fitz - james , [the Marquis of [Jamaica]24-jamaica and Duke of [Berwick]25-berwick]612-the marquis of jamaica and duke of berwick , had just married [Caroline]225-louise , [the second daughter of the widow of [Prince Gustavus Adolphus of [Stolberg - Gedern]26-stolberg - gedern]232-prince gustavus adolphus of stolberg - gedern]613-the second daughter of the widow of prince gustavus adolphus of stolberg - gedern ; so that the choice naturally fell upon [[this lady]614-this lady 's elder sister]615-this lady 's elder sister , [Louise of Stolberg]233-louise , [the young Canoness of [Ste]22-ste . Wandru of [Mons]17-mons]616-the young canoness of ste . wandru of mons .

The alliance , short of royal birth , was , in the matter of dignity , all that could be wished ; [the Stolbergs]234-the stolbergs were [one of [the most illustrious families of [the Holy Roman Empire]619-the holy roman empire]618-the most illustrious families of the holy roman empire , in whose service [they]620-they had discharged many high offices]617-one of the most illustrious families of the holy roman empire , in whose service they had discharged many high offices ; [the Horns]235-the horns , on the other hand , were among [the most brilliant of [the Flemish aristocracy]622-the flemish aristocracy , allied to [the Gonzagas of [Mantua]27-mantua]623-the gonzagas of mantua , [the Colonna]236-the colonna , [Orsinis]28-orsinis , [the Medina Celis]237-the medina celis , [Croys]29-croys , Lignes , [Hohenzollerns]30-hohenzollerns , and [the house of [Lorraine]31-lorraine]624-the house of lorraine , reigning or [quasi - reigning families]625-quasi - reigning families]621-the most brilliant of the flemish aristocracy , allied to the gonzagas of mantua , the colonna , orsinis , the medina celis , croys , lignes , hohenzollerns , and the house of lorraine , reigning or quasi - reigning families ; and [[Louise of Stolberg]233-louise 's mother]626-louise of stolberg 's mother was , moreover , on the maternal side , [the grand - daughter of [the Earl of]628-the earl of [Elgin]32-elgin and [Ailesbury]33-ailesbury]627-the grand - daughter of the earl of elgin and ailesbury , [a Bruce]629-a bruce , and [a staunch follower of [King James II]238-james ii]630-a staunch follower of king james ii . Such had been the inducements in the eyes of [the Duke of Fitz - James]231-fitz - james ; and therefore in the eyes of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward , for whom [he]204-charles edward was commissioned to select [a wife]608-a wife . The inducements to [the Princess of [Stolberg]15-stolberg]632-the princess of stolberg had been even greater . Foremost among [them]633-them was probably the mere desire of ridding [herself]632-the princess of stolberg , poor and living as [she]632-the princess of stolberg was on the charity of [the Empress - Queen]634-the empress - queen , of [another of [the four girls with whom [she]632-the princess of stolberg had been left [a widow at twenty - five]637-a widow at twenty - five]636-the four girls with whom she had been left a widow at twenty - five]635-another of the four girls with whom she had been left a widow at twenty - five . It had been a great blessing to get [the two eldest girls]638-the two eldest girls , [Louise]233-louise and [Caroline]225-louise , educated , housed for a time , and momentarily settled in [the world]573-the world by [their]638-the two eldest girls admission to [the rich and noble chapter of [Ste]22-ste . [Wandru]243-wandru]640-the rich and noble chapter of ste . wandru : it must have been a great blessing to see [the second girl]641-the second girl married to [the son of [Fitz - James]231-fitz - james]642-the son of fitz - james ; it would be a still greater one to get [Louise]225-louise safely off [her]632-the princess of stolberg hands , now that [the third and fourth daughters]643-the third and fourth daughters required to be thought of . So far for the desirability of any marriage . This particular marriage with [Prince Charles Edward]204-charles edward was , moreover , such as to tempt the vanity and ambition of [a lady like [the widowed Princess of [Stolberg]15-stolberg]645-the widowed princess of stolberg]644-a lady like the widowed princess of stolberg , conscious of [her]645-the widowed princess of stolberg high rank , and conscious , perhaps painfully conscious of the difficulty of living up to its requirements . [The Count of [[Albany]196-alfieri 's grandfather]647-albany 's grandfather]646-the count of albany 's grandfather had been [King of [England]13-england]648-king of england ; [[his]204-charles edward father]649-his father , [the Pretender James]239-the pretender james , had lived with royal state in [his]649-his father exile at [Rome]10-rome , recognised as reigning Sovereign by [the Pope]650-the pope , and even , every now and then , by [France]35-france and [Spain]36-spain . [No Government]651-no government had recognised [Charles Edward]204-charles edward as [King of [England]13-england]648-king of england ; but , on the other hand , [Charles Edward]204-charles edward had virtually been [King of [Scotland]37-scotland]653-king of scotland during the ' 45 ; [he]204-charles edward had been promised the help of [France]35-france to restore [him]204-charles edward to [his]204-charles edward rights ; and although that help had never been satisfactorily given in the past , who could tell whether it might not be given at any moment in the future ? The ups and downs of politics brought all sorts of unexpected necessities ; and why should the French Government , which had ignominiously kidnapped and bundled off [Charles Edward]204-charles edward in 1748 , have sent for [him]204-charles edward again only a year ago , have urged [him]204-charles edward to marry , unless it had some scheme for reinstating [him]204-charles edward in [England]13-england ? [The Duke of Fitz - James]231-fitz - james had doubtless urged these considerations ; [he]204-charles edward had not laid much weight on the fact that [Charles Edward]204-charles edward was thirty - two years older than [[his]204-charles edward proposed wife]654-his proposed wife ; still less is it probable that [he]204-charles edward had bade [the Princess of [Stolberg]15-stolberg]632-the princess of stolberg consider that [[his]204-charles edward royal kinsman]656-his royal kinsman was said to be neither of very good health , nor of very agreeable disposition , nor of very temperate habits ; or , if such ideas were presented to [the Princess Stolberg]233-louise , [she]632-the princess of stolberg put them behind [her]632-the princess of stolberg . Be it as it may , these were matters for the judicious consideration of [a mother]657-a mother ; not , certainly , for the thoughts of [a daughter]658-a daughter . [The judicious mother]659-the judicious mother decided that such a match was a good one ; perhaps , in [her]659-the judicious mother heart , [she]659-the judicious mother was even overwhelmed by the glory which [this daughter of hers]660-this daughter of hers was permitted by Heaven to add to all the glories of the illustrious [Stolbergs]234-the stolbergs and [Horns]235-the horns . Anyhow , [she]632-the princess of stolberg accepted eagerly ; so eagerly as to forget both gratitude and prudence : for so far from consulting [[her]632-the princess of stolberg benefactress]661-her benefactress , [Maria Theresa]227-maria theresa , about the advisability of this marriage , or asking [her]227-maria theresa sovereign permission for a step which might draw upon [the Empress - Queen]634-the empress - queen some disagreeable diplomatic correspondence with [England]13-england , [the Princess of Stolberg]233-louise kept the matter close , and did not even announce the marriage to [the Court of [Vienna]39-vienna]663-the court of vienna ; yet [she]233-louise must have foreseen what occurred , namely , that [Maria Theresa]227-maria theresa , mortified not merely in [her]227-maria theresa dignity as [a sovereign]664-a sovereign , but also , and perhaps more , in [her]227-maria theresa ruling passion of benevolent meddlesomeness , would suspend the pension which formed a large portion of [the Princess]665-the princess 's income , and compel [her]233-louise to the abject apology before restoring it . The marriage with [Charles Edward Stuart]204-charles edward was worth all that !

[Louise of Stolberg]233-louise was probably well aware of the extreme glory of the marriage for which [she]233-louise had been reserved . [The Fitz - Jameses]240-the fitz - jameses , in virtue of [their]240-the fitz - jameses illegitimate descent from [James II .]666-james ii . , considered [themselves]240-the fitz - jameses and were considered as a sort of [Princes of the Blood]667-princes of the blood ; and as such [they]240-the fitz - jameses doubtless impressed [Louise]233-louise with a great notion of the glory of [the Stuarts]241-the stuarts , and the absolute legitimacy of [their]240-the fitz - jameses claims . On [his]204-charles edward marriage [Charles Edward]204-charles edward assumed the title , and attempted to assume the position , of [King of [England]13-england]648-king of england ; so [[his]204-charles edward bride]669-his bride must have considered [herself]669-his bride as [the wife not merely of [the Count of [Albany]196-alfieri]607-the count of albany , but of [Charles III]242-charles iii . , [King of [Great Britain]40-great britain]672-king of great britain , [France]35-france , and [Ireland]41-ireland]670-the wife not merely of the count of albany , but of charles iii . , king of great britain , france , and ireland . [She]669-his bride was going to be [a Queen]673-a queen ! [We]674-we must try , [we]674-we democratic creatures of a time when [kings]675-kings and [queens]676-queens may perfectly be [adventurers and adventuresses]677-adventurers and adventuresses , to put [ourselves]674-we in the place of [this young lady of a century ago , brought up as a dignitary of a chapter into which admission depended entirely upon the number and quality of quarterings of the candidate]678-this young lady of a century ago , brought up as a dignitary of a chapter into which admission depended entirely upon the number and quality of quarterings of the candidate 's escutcheon , under [a superior]679-a superior - [the Abbess of [Ste]22-ste . [Wandru]243-wandru - who was [the sister of [the late Emperor Francis]682-the late emperor francis]681-the sister of the late emperor francis , [the sister - in - law of [Maria Theresa]227-maria theresa]683-the sister - in - law of maria theresa]680-the abbess of ste . wandru - who was the sister of the late emperor francis , the sister - in - law of maria theresa ; [we]674-we must try and conceive an institution something between [a school]684-a school , a sisterhood , and [a club , in which the ruling idea , the source of all dignity , jealousy , envy , and triumph , was greatness of birth and connection]685-a club , in which the ruling idea , the source of all dignity , jealousy , envy , and triumph , was greatness of birth and connection ; [we]674-we must try and do this in order to understand what , to [Louise of Stolberg]233-louise , was the full value of the fact of becoming [the wife of [Charles Edward Stuart]204-charles edward]686-the wife of charles edward stuart . One hundred and twelve years ago , and seventeen years before the great revolution which yawns , an almost impassable gulf , between [us]674-we and [the men]687-the men and [women of the past]688-women of the past , [a woman]689-a woman , [a girl of nineteen]690-a girl of nineteen , and [a Canoness of Ste]691-a canoness of ste . [Wandru of Mons]243-wandru , need have been of no base temper if , on the eve of such a wedding as this one , [her]233-louise mind had been full of only one idea : the idea , monotonous and drowningly loud like some big cathedral bell , " [I]233-louise shall be [a Queen]673-a queen . "[233-louise] But if [Louise of Stolberg]233-louise was , as is most probable , in some such a state of vague exultation , [we]674-we must remember also that there may well have entered into such exultation an element with which even [we]674-we , and even the most austerely or snobbishly democratic among [us]674-we , might fully have sympathised . [[Her]233-louise mother]600-her mother , [[her]233-louise sister]693-her sister , [[her]233-louise brother - in - law]694-her brother - in - law , and [the old Duke of [Fitz - James]231-fitz - james , who had made up [her]233-louise marriage and married [her]233-louise by proxy]695-the old duke of fitz - james , who had made up her marriage and married her by proxy , and [every other person who had approached [her]233-louise during the last month]696-every other person who had approached her during the last month , must have been filling the mind of [Louise]233-louise of [Stolberg]15-stolberg with tales of the ' 45 and of the heroism of [Prince Charlie]204-charles edward . And [her]233-louise mind , which , as afterwards appeared , was romantic , fascinated by eccentricity and genius , may easily have become enamoured of [the bridegroom who awaited [her]233-louise]697-the bridegroom who awaited her , the last of [so brilliant and ill - fated a race]698-so brilliant and ill - fated a race , [the hero of [Gladsmuir]42-gladsmuir and [Falkirk]43-falkirk]699-the hero of gladsmuir and falkirk , at whose approach [the Londoners]700-the londoners had shut [[their]700-the londoners shops]701-their shops in terror , and [the Hanoverian usurper]702-the hanoverian usurper ordered [[his]702-the hanoverian usurper yacht]703-his yacht to lie ready moored at [the Tower steps]704-the tower steps ; [the more than royal young man whom as [the Jacobites]706-the jacobites doubtless told [her]233-louise only the foolish and traitorous obstinacy of [[his]702-the hanoverian usurper followers]707-his followers had prevented from reinstating [[his]702-the hanoverian usurper father]649-his father on [the throne of [England]13-england]709-the throne of england]705-the more than royal young man whom as the jacobites doubtless told her only the foolish and traitorous obstinacy of his followers had prevented from reinstating his father on the throne of england . Historical figures , especially [those of a heroic sort]710-those of a heroic sort , remain pictured in [men]711-men 's minds at [their]711-men moment of glory ; and this was the case particularly with [the Young Pretender , who had disappeared into well - nigh complete mystery after [his]712-the young pretender , who had disappeared into well - nigh complete mystery after his wonderful exploits and hairbreadth escapes of the ' 45 wonderful exploits and hairbreadth escapes of the ' 45]712-the young pretender , who had disappeared into well - nigh complete mystery after his wonderful exploits and hairbreadth escapes of the ' 45 ; so that in the eyes of [Louise of Stolberg]233-louise [the man [she]233-louise was about to marry]713-the man she was about to marry appeared most probably but little changed from [the brilliant youth who had marched on foot at the head of [his]712-the young pretender , who had disappeared into well - nigh complete mystery after his wonderful exploits and hairbreadth escapes of the ' 45 army]714-the brilliant youth who had marched on foot at the head of his army towards [London]44-london , who had held court at [Holyrood]45-holyrood and roamed in disguise about [the Hebrides]46-the hebrides .

Still , it is difficult to imagine that as the hours of meeting drew nearer , [the little Princess]715-the little princess , as [[her]715-the little princess travelling carriage]716-her travelling carriage toiled up [the Apennine valleys]717-the apennine valleys , did not feel some terror of the future and the unknown . The spring comes late to [those regions]718-those regions ; in the middle of April the blackthorn is scarcely budding on [the rocks]719-the rocks , the violets are still plentiful underneath the leafless roadside hedges ; scarcely a faint yellow , more like autumn that spring , is beginning to tinge the scraggy outlines of the poplars , which rise in spectral regiments out of [the river beds]720-the river beds . Wherever [the valley]721-the valley widens , or [the road]722-the road gains [some hill - crest]723-some hill - crest , [a huge peak white with newly - fallen snow]724-a huge peak white with newly - fallen snow confronts [you]725-you , closes in the view , bringing bleakness and bitterness curiously home to the feelings . [These valleys]726-these valleys , torrent - tracks between the steep rocks of livid basalt or bright red sandstone , bare as a bone or thinly clothed with ilex and juniper scrub , are inexpressibly lonely and sad , especially at this time of year . [You]725-you feel imprisoned among the rocks in a sort of catacomb open to the sky , where the shadows gather in the early afternoon , and only the light on [the snow - peaks]727-the snow - peaks and on the high - sailing clouds tells [you]725-you that the sun is still in the heavens . [Villages]47-villages there seem none ; and [you]725-you may drive for an hour without meeting more than [a stray peasant]728-a stray peasant cutting scrub or quarrying gravel on [the hill - side]729-the hill - side , a train of mules carrying charcoal or faggots ; [the towns]730-the towns are far between , bleak , black , filthy , and such as only to make [you]725-you feel all the more poignantly the utter desolateness of [these mountains]731-these mountains . No sadder way of entering [Italy]3-italy can well be imagined than landing at [Ancona]11-ancona and crossing through [the Apennines]48-the apennines to [Rome]10-rome in the early spring . To [a girl accustomed to [the fat flatness of [Flanders]49-flanders]733-the fat flatness of flanders]732-a girl accustomed to the fat flatness of flanders , to [the market - bustle of [a Flemish provincial town]735-a flemish provincial town]734-the market - bustle of a flemish provincial town , this journey must have been overwhelmingly dreary and dismal . During those long hours dragging up [these Apennine valleys]736-these apennine valleys , did a shadow fall across the mind of [the pretty , fair - haired , brilliant - complexioned little Canoness of [Mons]17-mons]737-the pretty , fair - haired , brilliant - complexioned little canoness of mons , a shadow like the cold melancholy blue which filled [the valleys between the sun - smitten peaks]738-the valleys between the sun - smitten peaks ? And did it ever occur to [her]732-a girl accustomed to the fat flatness of flanders , as the horses were changed in [the little post - towns]739-the little post - towns , that it was in honour of [Holy Week]50-holy week that [the savage - looking bearded men]740-the savage - looking bearded men , [the big , brawny , madonna - like women]741-the big , brawny , madonna - like women had got on [their]741-the big , brawny , madonna - like women best clothes ? Did it strike [her]732-a girl accustomed to the fat flatness of flanders that the unplastered church - fronts were draped with black , [the streets]742-the streets strewn with laurel and box , as for a funeral , that the bells were silent in [[their]741-the big , brawny , madonna - like women towers]743-their towers ? Perhaps not ; and yet when , a few years later , [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany was already wo nt to say that [her]527-the countess of albany married life had been just such as befitted [a woman who had gone to the altar on Good Friday]745-a woman who had gone to the altar on good friday , [she]527-the countess of albany must have remembered , and the remembrance must have seemed fraught with ill omen , that last day of [her]527-the countess of albany girlhood , travelling through [the black deserted valleys of [the March]51-the march]746-the black deserted valleys of the march , through [the world - forgotten mountain - towns]747-the world - forgotten mountain - towns with [their]747-the world - forgotten mountain - towns hushed bells and black - draped churches and [funereally strewn streets]748-funereally strewn streets .

At [Loreto]12-loreto - where , as [a good Catholic]749-a good catholic , [the Princess Louise of [Stolberg]15-stolberg]233-louise doubtless prayed for a blessing on [her]233-louise marriage , in the great sanctuary which encloses with silver and carved marble [the little house of the Virgin]750-the little house of the virgin - at [Loreto]12-loreto [the bride]541-the bride was met by [a Jacobite dignitary]752-a jacobite dignitary , [Lord Carlyle]244-lord carlyle , and [five servants in the crimson liveries of [England]13-england]753-five servants in the crimson liveries of england . At [Macerata]52-macerata , [one of [the larger towns of the March of]755-the larger towns of the march of [Ancona]11-ancona]754-one of the larger towns of the march of ancona , [she]541-the bride was awaited by [[her]541-the bride bridegroom]556-her bridegroom . [A noble family of [the province]758-the province]757-a noble family of the province , [the Compagnoni - Marefoschis]759-the compagnoni - marefoschis , one of whom , [a cardinal]760-a cardinal , was [an old friend of [the Stuarts]241-the stuarts]761-an old friend of the stuarts , had placed [[their]757-a noble family of the province palace]762-their palace at the disposal of [the royal pair]763-the royal pair . [We]764-we most of [us]764-we know what [such palaces]765-such palaces , in [small Italian provincial towns south of [the Apennines]48-the apennines]766-small italian provincial towns south of the apennines , are apt to be ; huge , gloomy , shapeless masses of brickwork and mouldering plaster , something between [a mediæval fortress]767-a mediæval fortress and [a convent]594-a convent ; great black archways , where the refuse of [the house]769-the house , the filth of [the town]770-the town , has peaceably accumulated and how much more in those days ; magnificent statued staircases given over to [the few servants who have replaced [the armed bravos of two centuries ago]772-the armed bravos of two centuries ago]771-the few servants who have replaced the armed bravos of two centuries ago ; [long suites of rooms]773-long suites of rooms , vast , resounding like [so many churches]774-so many churches , glazed in the last century with tiny squares of bad glass , through which the light comes green and thick as through [sea - water]775-sea - water ; carpets still despised as a new - fangled luxury from [France]35-france ; the walls , not cheerful with eighteenth - century French panel and hangings , but covered with [big naked frescoed men]776-big naked frescoed men and [women]547-women , or faded arras ; few fire - places , but those few enormous , looking like a huge red cavern in [the room]778-the room . [The Marefoschis]245-the marefoschis had got together all [their]245-the marefoschis best furniture and plate , and [the palace]779-the palace was filled with torches and wax lights ; a funereal illumination in [a funereal place]780-a funereal place , it must have seemed to [the little Princess of [Stolberg]15-stolberg]781-the little princess of stolberg , fresh from the brilliant nattiness of [the Parisian houses of the time of [Louis XV]246-louis xv]782-the parisian houses of the time of louis xv .

[The bride]541-the bride alighted ; [a small , plump , well - proportioned , rather childish creature , with still half - formed childish features]784-a small , plump , well - proportioned , rather childish creature , with still half - formed childish features , a trifle snub , a trifle soulless , very pretty , tender , light - hearted ; a charming little creature , very well made to steal [folk]785-folk 's hearts unconscious to [themselves]785-folk and to [herself]541-the bride .

[The bridegroom]786-the bridegroom met [her]541-the bride . A faded , but extremely characteristic crayon portrait , the companion of the one of which [I]0-i have already spoken , now in the possession of [Cavaliere Emilio Santarelli]247-cavaliere emilio santarelli [the only man still living who can remember that same [Louise]233-louise d'Albany]787-the only man still living who can remember that same louise d'albany , a portrait evidently taken at this time , has shown [me]0-i what [that bridegroom]788-that bridegroom must have been . [The man who met [Louise]233-louise of [Stolberg]15-stolberg at [Macerata]52-macerata as [[her]233-louise husband]790-her husband and [master]791-master , [the man who had once been [Bonnie Prince Charlie]229-bonnie prince charlie]792-the man who had once been bonnie prince charlie , was tall , big - boned , gaunt , and prematurely bowed for [his]792-the man who had once been bonnie prince charlie age of fifty - two ; dressed usually , and doubtless on this occasion , with the blue ribbon and star , in a suit of crimson watered silk , which threw up a red reflection into [his]792-the man who had once been bonnie prince charlie red and bloated face]789-the man who met louise of stolberg at macerata as her husband and master , the man who had once been bonnie prince charlie , was tall , big - boned , gaunt , and prematurely bowed for his age of fifty - two ; dressed usually , and doubtless on this occasion , with the blue ribbon and star , in a suit of crimson watered silk , which threw up a red reflection into his red and bloated face . A red face , but of a livid , purplish red suffused all over the heavy furrowed forehead to where it met the white wig , all over the flabby cheeks , hanging in big loose folds upon the short , loose - folded red neck ; massive features , but coarsened and drawn ; and dull , thick , silent - looking lips , of purplish red scarce redder than the red skin ; pale blue eyes tending to a watery greyness , leaden , vague , sad , but with angry streakings of red ; something inexpressibly sad , gloomy , helpless , vacant and debased in the whole face : such was [the man who awaited Louise of [Stolberg]15-stolberg in [the Compagnoni - Marefoschi palace at [Macerata]52-macerata]794-the compagnoni - marefoschi palace at macerata]793-the man who awaited louise of stolberg in the compagnoni - marefoschi palace at macerata , and who , on Good Friday the 17th of April 1772 , wedded [her]233-louise in [the palace chapel]795-the palace chapel and signed [his]792-the man who had once been bonnie prince charlie name in the register as [Charles III]242-charles iii . , King of [Great Britain]40-great britain , [France]35-france , and [Ireland]41-ireland .

CHAPTER II .

[THE BRIDEGROOM]786-the bridegroom .

On the Wednesday after Easter [the bride]541-the bride and [bridegroom]798-bridegroom made [their]799-their solemn entry into [Rome]10-rome ; the two travelling carriages of [the Prince]800-the prince and of [the Princess]665-the princess were drawn by six horses ; [four gala coaches]802-four gala coaches , carrying [the attendants of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward and of [[his]204-charles edward brother]804-his brother [the Cardinal Duke of [York]53-york]805-the cardinal duke of york]803-the attendants of charles edward and of his brother the cardinal duke of york , followed behind , and [the streets]742-the streets were cleared by [four outriders dressed in scarlet with the white Stuart cockade]807-four outriders dressed in scarlet with the white stuart cockade . [The house to which [Louise]233-louise of [Stolberg]15-stolberg]808-the house to which louise of stolberg , now [Louise]233-louise d'Albany , or rather , as [she]233-louise signed [herself]233-louise at this time , [Louise R.]248-louise r. , was conducted after [her]233-louise five days ' wedding journey , has passed through several hands since belonging to [the Sacchettis]249-the sacchettis , [the Muti Papazzurris]250-the muti papazzurris , and now - a - days to [the family of About 's charming and unhappy Tolla Ferraldi]809-the family of about 's charming and unhappy tolla ferraldi . [Clement XI]251-clement xi . had given or lent it to [the Elder Pretender]810-the elder pretender : [James III]252-james iii . , as [he]252-james iii was styled in [Italy]3-italy , had settled in [it]811-it about 1719 with [[his]252-james iii beautiful bride [Maria Clementina Sobieska]253-maria clementina sobieska , romantically filched by [her]253-maria clementina sobieska Jacobites from [the convent at [Innsbruck]54-innsbruck]813-the convent at innsbruck , where [the Emperor Charles VI]254-the emperor charles vi . had hoped to restrain [her]253-maria clementina sobieska from so compromising a match]812-his beautiful bride maria clementina sobieska , romantically filched by her jacobites from the convent at innsbruck , where the emperor charles vi . had hoped to restrain her from so compromising a match ; here , in the year 1720 , [Charles Edward]204-charles edward had been born and had [his]204-charles edward baby fingers kissed by [the whole sacred college]814-the whole sacred college ; and here [the so - called King of]815-the so - called king of [England]13-england had died at last , a melancholy hypochondriac , in 1766 . [The palace]779-the palace closes in the narrow end of [the square of the Santissimi Apostoli]817-the square of the santissimi apostoli , stately and quiet with [[its]779-the palace various palaces]818-its various palaces , [Colonna]236-the colonna , [Odescalchi]56-odescalchi , and whatever else [their]818-its various palaces names , and [[its]779-the palace pillared church front]819-its pillared church front . There is a certain aristocratic serenity about [that square]820-that square , separated , like [a big palace yard]821-a big palace yard , from the bustling Corso in front ; yet to [me]0-i there remains , a tradition of [my]0-i childhood , a sort of grotesque and horrid suggestiveness connected with [this peaceful and princely corner of [Rome]10-rome]822-this peaceful and princely corner of rome . For , many years ago , when [the square of [the Santissimi Apostoli]824-the santissimi apostoli]817-the square of the santissimi apostoli was still periodically strewn with sand that [the Pope]650-the pope might not be jolted when [[his]650-the pope golden coach]826-his golden coach drove up to [the church]827-the church , and when the names of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward and [[his]204-charles edward Countess]828-his countess were curiously mixed up in [my]0-i brain with those of [Charles]204-charles edward the First and [Mary Queen of Scots]255-mary queen of scots , there used to be in [a little street]829-a little street leading out of [the square]830-the square towards [the Colonna Gardens]831-the colonna gardens , a dark recess in the blank church - wall , an embrasure , sheltered by a pent - house roof and raised like a stage a few steep steps above [the pavement]832-the pavement ; and in it loomed , strapped to a chair , dark in the shadow , a creature in a long black robe and a skull cap drawn close over [his]833-his head ; a vague , contorted , writhing and gibbering horror , of whose St. Vitus twistings and mouthings [[we]834-we children]835-we children scarcely ventured to catch a glimpse as [we]834-we hurried up [the narrow street]836-the narrow street , followed by the bestial cries and moans of [the solitary maniac]837-the solitary maniac . This weird and grotesque sight , more weird and more grotesque seen through a muddled childish fancy and through the haze of years , has remained associated in [my]0-i mind with [that particular corner of [Rome]10-rome]838-that particular corner of rome , where , with windows looking down upon [that street]839-that street , upon [that blank church - wall with [its]840-that blank church - wall with its little black recess little black recess]840-that blank church - wall with its little black recess , [the palace of [the Stuarts]241-the stuarts]841-the palace of the stuarts closes in [the narrow end of [the square of the Santissimi Apostoli]817-the square of the santissimi apostoli]842-the narrow end of the square of the santissimi apostoli . And now , [I]0-i can not help seeing a certain strange appropriateness in the fact that the image of [that mouthing and gesticulating half - witted creature]844-that mouthing and gesticulating half - witted creature should be connected in [my]0-i mind with [the house to which , with pomp of [six - horse coaches]846-six - horse coaches and [scarlet outriders]847-scarlet outriders]845-the house to which , with pomp of six - horse coaches and scarlet outriders , [Charles Edward Stuart]204-charles edward conducted [[his]204-charles edward bride]669-his bride .

Illustration : [CHARLES EDWARD STUART]204-charles edward From a pastel , painter unknown , once in the possession of [the heir of [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri 's heir]850-the countess of albany 's heir [Fabre]256-fabre]849-the heir of the countess of albany 's heir fabre . Now in the possession of [Mrs. Horace Walpole]257-walpole , of [Heckfield Place]57-heckfield place , [Winchfield]58-winchfield , [Hants]59-hants .

For [the beautiful and brilliant youth who had secretly left [that palace]852-that palace twenty - four years before to re - conquer [[his]851-the beautiful and brilliant youth who had secretly left that palace twenty - four years before to re - conquer his father 's kingdom father 's kingdom]853-his father 's kingdom]851-the beautiful and brilliant youth who had secretly left that palace twenty - four years before to re - conquer his father 's kingdom , [the gentle and gallant and chivalric young prince of whose irresistible manner and voice [the canny chieftains]855-the canny chieftains]854-the gentle and gallant and chivalric young prince of whose irresistible manner and voice the canny chieftains had vainly bid each other beware when [he]851-the beautiful and brilliant youth who had secretly left that palace twenty - four years before to re - conquer his father 's kingdom landed with [[his]851-the beautiful and brilliant youth who had secretly left that palace twenty - four years before to re - conquer his father 's kingdom handful of [friends]857-friends]856-his handful of friends and called [the Highlanders]858-the highlanders to arms ; [the patient and heroic exile , singing to [[his]851-the beautiful and brilliant youth who had secretly left that palace twenty - four years before to re - conquer his father 's kingdom friends]860-his friends when [the sea]575-the sea washed over [[their]860-his friends boat]862-their boat and [the Hanoverian soldiers]863-the hanoverian soldiers surrounded [[their]860-his friends cavern]864-their cavern or hovel , who had silently given [Miss Macdonald]258-miss macdonald that solemn kiss which [she]258-miss macdonald treasured for more than fifty years in [her]258-miss macdonald strong heart]859-the patient and heroic exile , singing to his friends when the sea washed over their boat and the hanoverian soldiers surrounded their cavern or hovel , who had silently given miss macdonald that solemn kiss which she treasured for more than fifty years in her strong heart - that [Charles Edward Stuart]204-charles edward was now [a creature not much worthier and not much less repulsive than [the poor idiot whom [I]0-i still see , flinging about [his]204-charles edward palsied hands and gobbling with [his]204-charles edward speechless mouth , beneath the windows of [the Stuart palace]867-the stuart palace]866-the poor idiot whom i still see , flinging about his palsied hands and gobbling with his speechless mouth , beneath the windows of the stuart palace]865-a creature not much worthier and not much less repulsive than the poor idiot whom i still see , flinging about his palsied hands and gobbling with his speechless mouth , beneath the windows of the stuart palace . The taste for drinking , so strange in [a man brought up to the age of twenty - three among the proverbially sober Italians]868-a man brought up to the age of twenty - three among the proverbially sober italians , had arisen in [Charles Edward]204-charles edward , a most excusable ill habit in [one continually exposed to wet and cold]869-one continually exposed to wet and cold , frequently sleeping on [the damp ground]870-the damp ground , ill - fed , anxious , worn out by over - exertion in flying before [[his]204-charles edward enemies]871-his enemies , during those frightful months after the defeat at [Culloden]60-culloden , when , with a price of thirty thousand pounds upon [his]204-charles edward head , [he]204-charles edward had lurked in [the fastnesses of [the Hebrides]46-the hebrides]872-the fastnesses of the hebrides . [We]873-we hear that on the eve of [his]204-charles edward final escape from [Scotland]37-scotland , [[his]204-charles edward host]874-his host , [Macdonald of Kingsburgh]259-macdonald of kingsburgh , prevented the possible miscarriage of all [their]875-their perilous plans only by smashing the punch - bowl over which [the Pretender , already more than half drunk]876-the pretender , already more than half drunk , had insisted upon spending the night . Still more significant is the fact , recorded by [Hugh Macdonald of Balshair]260-hugh macdonald of balshair , that when [Charles Edward]204-charles edward was concealed in a hovel in [the isle of [South Uist]61-south uist]877-the isle of south uist , [the prince]800-the prince and [[his]800-the prince faithful followers]879-his faithful followers continued drinking the words are [Balshair]260-hugh macdonald of balshair 's own " for three days and three nights . "[260-hugh macdonald of balshair] Hard drinking was , [we]873-we all know , a necessary accomplishment in the [Scotland]37-scotland of those days ; and hard drinking , [we]873-we must [all of [us]873-we]880-all of us admit , may well have been the one comfort and resource of [a man undergoing the frightful mental and bodily miseries of those months of lying at bay]881-a man undergoing the frightful mental and bodily miseries of those months of lying at bay . But [Charles Edward]204-charles edward did not relinquish the habit when [he]204-charles edward was back again in safety and luxury . Strangely compounded of [an Englishman]882-an englishman and [a Pole]883-a pole , [the Polish element]884-the polish element , the brilliant and light - hearted chivalry , the cheerful and youthfully wayward heroism which [he]204-charles edward had inherited from [the Sobieskis]261-the sobieskis , seemed to constitute the whole of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward 's nature when [he]204-charles edward was young and , for all [his]204-charles edward reverses , still hopeful ; as [he]204-charles edward grew older , as deferred and disappointed hopes , and endured ignominy , made [him]204-charles edward [a middle - aged man]885-a middle - aged man before [his]204-charles edward time , then also did the other hereditary strain , the morose obstinacy , the gloomy brutality of [James II]238-james ii . and of [[his]204-charles edward father]649-his father begin to appear , and gradually obliterated every trace of what had been the splendour and charm of [the Prince Charlie of the ' 45]887-the prince charlie of the ' 45 . Disappointed of the assistance of [France]35-france , which had egged [him]204-charles edward to this great enterprise only to leave [him]204-charles edward shamefully in the lurch , [Charles Edward]204-charles edward had , immediately upon the peace of [Aix la Chapelle]62-aix la chapelle , become [an embarrassing guest of [Louis XV]246-louis xv]888-an embarrassing guest of louis xv . , and [a guest of whom the victorious English]889-a guest of whom the victorious english were continually requiring the ignominious dismissal ; until , wearied by the indifference to all hints and orders to free [France]35-france from [his]204-charles edward compromising presence , [the Court of [Versailles]23-versailles]606-the court of versailles had descended to the incredible baseness of having [the Prince]800-the prince kidnapped as [he]800-the prince was going to the opera , bound hand and foot , carried like [a thief]892-a thief to [the fortress of [Vincennes]63-vincennes]893-the fortress of vincennes , and then conducted to [the frontier]894-the frontier like [a suspected though unconvicted swindler]895-a suspected though unconvicted swindler , or other public nuisance .

This indignity , coming close upon the irreparable blow dealt to the Jacobite cause by the stupid selfishness which impelled [[Charles Edward]204-charles edward 's younger brother]896-charles edward 's younger brother to become [a Romish priest]897-a romish priest and [a cardinal]760-a cardinal , appears to have definitively decided the extraordinary change in the character of [the Young Pretender]899-the young pretender . During the many years of skulking , often completely lost to the sight both of [Jacobite adherents]900-jacobite adherents and of [Hanoverian spies]901-hanoverian spies , which followed upon that outrage of the year 1748 , the few glimpses which [we]902-we obtain of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward show [us]902-we only [a precociously aged , brutish and brutal sot]903-a precociously aged , brutish and brutal sot , obstinate in disregarding all efforts to restore [him]204-charles edward to a worthier life , yet not obstinate enough to refuse unnecessary pecuniary aid from [the very government and persons by whom [he]204-charles edward had been so cruelly outraged]904-the very government and persons by whom he had been so cruelly outraged . [We]902-we hear that [[Charles Edward]204-charles edward 's confessor , with whom , despite [his]204-charles edward secret abjuration of [Catholicism]262-catholicism , [he]204-charles edward continued to associate]905-charles edward 's confessor , with whom , despite his secret abjuration of catholicism , he continued to associate , was [a notorious drunkard]906-a notorious drunkard ; and that [the mistress with whom [he]204-charles edward lived for many years , and whom [he]204-charles edward even passed off as [[his]204-charles edward wife]908-his wife]907-the mistress with whom he lived for many years , and whom he even passed off as his wife , was also addicted to drinking ; nay , [Lord Elcho]263-lord elcho is said to have witnessed a tipsy squabble between [the Young Pretender]899-the young pretender and [Miss Walkenshaw]264-miss walkenshaw , [the lady in question]910-the lady in question , across the table of [a low [Paris]4-paris tavern]911-a low paris tavern . The reports of [the many spies whom [the English Government]913-the english government set everywhere on [his]204-charles edward traces]912-the many spies whom the english government set everywhere on his traces are constant and unanimous in one item of information : [the Prince]800-the prince began to drink early in the morning , and was invariably dead drunk by the evening ; nay , some letters of [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york , addressed to [an unknown Jacobite]915-an unknown jacobite , speak of the " nasty bottle , that goes on but too much , and certainly must at last kill [him]204-charles edward . "[265-cardinal york] But , although drunkenness undoubtedly did much to obliterate whatever still remained of [the hero of the ' 45]916-the hero of the ' 45 , it was itself only one of the proofs of the strange metamorphosis which had taken place in [his]204-charles edward character . [We]917-we can not admit the plea of [some of [[his]204-charles edward biographers]919-his biographers , who would save [his]204-charles edward honour at the price of [his]204-charles edward reason]918-some of his biographers , who would save his honour at the price of his reason . [Charles Edward]204-charles edward was [the victim neither of an hereditary vice nor of a mental disease]920-the victim neither of an hereditary vice nor of a mental disease ; drink was in [his]204-charles edward case not a form of madness , but merely the ruling passion of a broken - spirited and degraded nature . [He]204-charles edward had the power when [he]204-charles edward married , and even much later in life , when [he]204-charles edward sent for [[his]204-charles edward illegitimate daughter]921-his illegitimate daughter , of refraining from [his]204-charles edward usual excesses ; [his]204-charles edward will , impaired though it was , still existed , and what was wanting in the sad second half of [his]204-charles edward career was not resolution , but conscience , pride , an ideal , anything which might beget the desire of reform . The curious mixture of brow - beating moroseness with a brazen readiness to accept and even extort favours , [he]204-charles edward would appear , as [he]204-charles edward ceased to be young , to have gradually inherited from [[his]204-charles edward father]649-his father ; [he]204-charles edward was ready to live on the alms of [the French Court]923-the french court , while never losing an opportunity of declaiming against the ignoble treatment which [that same Court]924-that same court had inflicted on [him]204-charles edward . [He]204-charles edward became sordid and grasping in money matters , basely begging for money , which [he]204-charles edward did not require , from [those who , like [Gustavus III]266-gustavus iii . of [Sweden]64-sweden]925-those who , like gustavus iii . of sweden , discovered only too late that [he]204-charles edward was demeaning [himself]204-charles edward from avarice and not from necessity . While keeping a certain maudlin sentiment about [his]204-charles edward exploits and those of [[his]204-charles edward followers]707-his followers , which manifested itself in cruelly pathetic scenes when , as in [his]204-charles edward old age , [people]927-people talked to [him]204-charles edward of the Highlands and the Rebellion ; [he]204-charles edward was wholly without any sense of [his]204-charles edward obligation towards men who had exposed [their]925-those who , like gustavus iii . of sweden life and happiness for [him]204-charles edward , of the duty which bound [him]204-charles edward to repay [their]925-those who , like gustavus iii . of sweden devotion by docility to [their]925-those who , like gustavus iii . of sweden advice , by sacrifice of [his]204-charles edward inclinations , or even by such mere decency of behaviour as would spare [them]925-those who , like gustavus iii . of sweden the bitterness of allegiance to [a disreputable and foul - mouthed sot]928-a disreputable and foul - mouthed sot . But , until the moment when old and dying , [he]204-charles edward placed [himself]204-charles edward in the strong hands of [[his]204-charles edward natural daughter]929-his natural daughter , [Charles Edward]204-charles edward seems to have been , however obstinate in [his]204-charles edward favouritism , incapable of any real affection . When [[his]204-charles edward brother]804-his brother [Henry]267-henry became [a priest]931-a priest [Charles]204-charles edward held aloof for long years both from [him]204-charles edward and from [[his]204-charles edward father]649-his father ; and this resentment of what was after all a mere piece of bigoted folly , may be partially excused by the fact that the identification of [[his]204-charles edward family]933-his family with [Popery]268-popery had seriously damaged the prospects of Jacobitism . But the lack of all lovingness in [his]204-charles edward nature is proved beyond possibility of doubt by the brutal manner in which , while obstinately refusing to part with [[his]204-charles edward mistress]934-his mistress at the earnest entreaty of [[his]204-charles edward adherents]935-his adherents , [he]204-charles edward explained to [[their]935-his adherents envoy]936-their envoy [Macnamara]269-macnamara that [his]204-charles edward refusal was due merely to resentment at any attempted interference in [his]204-charles edward concerns ; but that , for the rest , [he]204-charles edward had not the smallest affection or consideration remaining for [the woman [they]935-his adherents wished to make [him]204-charles edward relinquish]937-the woman they wished to make him relinquish . As if all the stupid selfishness bred of centuries of [royalty]938-royalty had accumulated in [this man who might be [king]940-king only through [his]204-charles edward own and [his]204-charles edward adherents]939-this man who might be king only through his own and his adherents ' magnanimity , [Charles Edward]204-charles edward seemed , in the second period of [his]204-charles edward life , to feel as if [he]204-charles edward had a right over everything , and [nobody else]941-nobody else had a right over anything ; all sense of reciprocity was gone ; [he]204-charles edward would accept devotion , self - sacrifice , generosity , charity - nay , [he]204-charles edward would even insist upon them ; but [he]204-charles edward would give not one tittle in return ; so that , forgetful of the heroism and clemency and high spirit of [his]204-charles edward earlier days , one might almost think that [his]204-charles edward indignant answer to [Cardinal de Tenein]270-cardinal de tenein , who offered [him]204-charles edward [England]13-england and [Scotland]37-scotland if [he]204-charles edward would cede [Ireland]41-ireland to [France]35-france , " Everything or nothing , [Monsieur le Cardinal]271-monsieur le cardinal ! "[204-charles edward] was dictated less by the indignation of [an Englishman]882-an englishman than by the stubborn graspingness of [a Stuart]943-a stuart . [His]204-charles edward further behaviour towards [Miss Walkenshaw]264-miss walkenshaw shows the same indifference to everything except what [he]204-charles edward considered [his]204-charles edward own rights . [He]204-charles edward had crudely admitted that [he]204-charles edward cared nothing for [her]264-miss walkenshaw , that it was only because [[his]204-charles edward adherents]935-his adherents wished [her]264-miss walkenshaw dismissal that [he]204-charles edward did not pack [her]264-miss walkenshaw off ; and subsequently [he]204-charles edward seems to have given [himself]204-charles edward so little thought either for [[his]204-charles edward mistress]934-his mistress or for [[his]204-charles edward child]946-his child by [her]264-miss walkenshaw , that , without the benevolence of [[his]204-charles edward brother]804-his brother [the Cardinal]948-the cardinal , [they]949-they might have starved . But when , after long endurance of [his]204-charles edward jealousy and brutality , after being watched like [a prisoner]950-a prisoner and beaten like [a slave]951-a slave , [the wretched woman]952-the wretched woman at length took refuge in [a convent]594-a convent , [Charles Edward]204-charles edward 's rage knew no bounds ; and [he]204-charles edward summoned [the French Government]65-the french government , despite [his]204-charles edward old quarrel with [it]65-the french government , to kidnap and send back [the woman over whom [he]204-charles edward had no legal rights]954-the woman over whom he had no legal rights , and certainly [no moral ones]955-no moral ones , with the obstinacy and violence of [a drunken navvy clamouring for [the wife whom [he]204-charles edward has well - nigh done to death]957-the wife whom he has well - nigh done to death]956-a drunken navvy clamouring for the wife whom he has well - nigh done to death . Beyond the mere intemperance and the violence born of intemperance which made [Charles Edward]204-charles edward 's name a byword and served [the Hanoverian dynasty]958-the hanoverian dynasty better than [all the Duke of Cumberland]959-all the duke of cumberland 's gibbets , there was at the bottom of [the Pretender]605-the pretender 's character - [his]204-charles edward second character at least , [his]204-charles edward character after the year 1750 - heartlessness and selfishness , an absence of all ideal and all gratitude , much more morally repulsive than any mere vice , and of which the vice which publicly degraded [him]204-charles edward was the result much more than the cause . The curse of kingship in an age when [royalty]938-royalty had lost all utility , the habit of irresponsibility , of indifference , the habit of always claiming and never giving justice , love , self - sacrifice , all the good things of [this world]962-this world , this curse had lurked , an evil strain , in the nature of [this king]963-this king without [a kingdom]964-a kingdom , and had gradually blighted and made hideous what had seemed an almost heroic character . Royal - souled [Charles Edward Stuart]204-charles edward had certainly been in [his]204-charles edward youth ; brilliant with all those virtues of endurance , clemency , and affability which the earlier eighteenth century still fondly associated with the divine right of [kings]675-kings ; and royal - souled , hard and weak with all the hardness and weakness , the self - indulgence , obstinacy , and thoughtlessness for [others of effete races of kings]966-others of effete races of kings , [he]204-charles edward had become no less certainly , in the second part of [his]204-charles edward life ; branded with [God]272-god 's own brand of unworthiness , which signifies that [a people]967-a people , or [a class]968-a class , or [a family]969-a family , is doomed to extinction .

Such was [the man to whom the easy - going habit of]970-the man to whom the easy - going habit of [the world]573-the world , the perfectly self - righteous indifference to [a woman]689-a woman 's happiness or honour of [the well - bred people of that day]973-the well - bred people of that day , gave over as a partner for life [a half - educated , worldly - ignorant and absolutely will - less young girl of nineteen and a half , who doubtless considered [herself]974-a half - educated , worldly - ignorant and absolutely will - less young girl of nineteen and a half , who doubtless considered herself extremely fortunate in being chosen for so brilliant a match extremely fortunate in being chosen for so brilliant a match]974-a half - educated , worldly - ignorant and absolutely will - less young girl of nineteen and a half , who doubtless considered herself extremely fortunate in being chosen for so brilliant a match .

There is a glamour , even for [us]975-we , connected with the name of [Charles Edward Stuart]204-charles edward ; in [his]204-charles edward youth [he]204-charles edward forms a brilliant speck of romantic light in that dull eighteenth century , a spot of light surrounded by the halo of glory of the devotion which [he]204-charles edward inspired and the enthusiasm which [he]204-charles edward left behind [him]204-charles edward . [We]975-we feel , in a way , grateful to [him]204-charles edward almost as [we]975-we might feel grateful to [a clever talker]976-a clever talker , [a beautiful woman]977-a beautiful woman , a bright day , as to something pleasing and enlivening to [our]975-we fancy . But the brilliant effect which has pleased [us]975-we is like some gorgeous pageant connected with the worship of [a stupid and ferocious divinity]978-a stupid and ferocious divinity ; nay , rather , if [we]975-we let [our]975-we thoughts dwell upon the matter , if [we]975-we remember how , while the prisons and [ship - holds]979-ship - holds were pestilent with [the Jacobite men]980-the jacobite men and [women]547-women penned up like cattle in obscene promiscuity , while the mutilated corpses were lying still green , piled up under [the bog turf of [Culloden]60-culloden]982-the bog turf of culloden , while so many of [the bravest men of [Scotland]37-scotland , who had supplicated [the Young Pretender]899-the young pretender not to tempt [them]899-the young pretender to a hopeless enterprise]983-the bravest men of scotland , who had supplicated the young pretender not to tempt them to a hopeless enterprise , were cheerfully mounting the scaffold " for so sweet [a prince]3881-a prince , "[204-charles edward] [Charles Edward]204-charles edward was dancing at [Versailles]23-versailles in [his]204-charles edward crimson silk dress and diamonds , with [his]204-charles edward black - eyed boast [the eldest - born Princess of [France]35-france]985-the eldest - born princess of france . Nay , worse , if [we]975-we remember how [the man , for whose love and whose right so much needless agony had been expended]986-the man , for whose love and whose right so much needless agony had been expended , let [himself]986-the man , for whose love and whose right so much needless agony had been expended become a disgrace to the very memory of [the men who had died for [him]986-the man , for whose love and whose right so much needless agony had been expended]987-the men who had died for him : if [we]975-we bear all this in mind , [Charles Edward]204-charles edward seems to become [a mere irresponsible and fated representative of some evil creed]988-a mere irresponsible and fated representative of some evil creed ; the idol , at first fair - shapen and smiling , then hideous and loathsome , to which human sacrifices are brought in solemnity ; a glittering idol of silver , or a foul idol of rotten wood , but without nerves and mind to perceive the weeping all around , the sop of blood at its feet . And now , after the sacrifice of so many hundreds of [brave men]989-brave men to [this one man]990-this one man , comes the less tragic , less heroic , perfectly legitimate and correct sacrifice to [him]990-this one man of [a pretty young woman]991-a pretty young woman , not brave and not magnanimous , but very fit for innocent enjoyment and very fit for honourable love .

CHAPTER III .

REGINA APOSTOLORUM .

[Charles Edward]204-charles edward had refrained from drink , or at least refrained from any excesses , in honour of [his]204-charles edward marriage . Perhaps the notion that [France]35-france was again taking [him]204-charles edward up , a notion well - founded since [France]35-france had bid [him]204-charles edward marry and have [an heir]992-an heir , and the recollection of the near miscarriage of all [his]204-charles edward projects , thanks to having presented [himself]204-charles edward , a year before , to the French Minister so drunk that [he]204-charles edward could neither speak nor be spoken to , perhaps the old hope of becoming after all [a real king]993-a real king , had turned [the Pretender]605-the pretender into a temporarily - reformed character . Or , perhaps , weary of the life of melancholy solitude , of [debauched squalor]995-debauched squalor , of the moral pig - stye in which [he]204-charles edward had been rotting so many years , the idea of decency , of dignity , of [society]996-society , of [a wife]608-a wife and [children]548-children and [friends]857-friends , may have made [him]204-charles edward capable of a strong resolution . Perhaps , also , the unfamiliar , wonderful presence of [a beautiful and refined young woman , of something to adore , or at least to be jealous and vain of]1000-a beautiful and refined young woman , of something to adore , or at least to be jealous and vain of , may have wakened whatever still remained of [the gallant and high - spirited Polish nature]1001-the gallant and high - spirited polish nature in [this morose and besotten old Stuart]1002-this morose and besotten old stuart . Be this as it may , [Charles Edward]204-charles edward , however degraded , was able to command [himself]204-charles edward when [he]204-charles edward chose , and , for one reason or another , [he]204-charles edward did choose to command [himself]204-charles edward and behave like [a tolerably decent man]1003-a tolerably decent man and [husband]1004-husband during the first few months following on [his]204-charles edward marriage . Besides the redness of [his]204-charles edward face , the leaden suffused look of [his]204-charles edward eyes , the vague air of degradation all about [him]204-charles edward , there was perhaps nothing , at first , that revealed to [Louise]248-louise r. , [Queen of [Great Britain]1006-great britain]1005-queen of great britain , [France]35-france , and [Ireland]41-ireland , that [[her]248-louise r. husband]790-her husband was [a drunkard]1008-a drunkard and well - nigh [a maniac]1009-a maniac . Engaging [he]204-charles edward certainly could not have been , however much [he]204-charles edward tried and [we]1010-we know [he]204-charles edward tried hard to show [his]204-charles edward full delight at having got so charming [a little wife]1011-a little wife ; indeed , it is easy to imagine that if anything might inspire even [a properly educated and high - born young Flemish or German lady of the eighteenth century]1012-a properly educated and high - born young flemish or german lady of the eighteenth century with somewhat of a sense of loathing , it must have been the assiduities and endearments of [a man such as [Charles Edward]204-charles edward]1013-a man such as charles edward .
