But [he]196-alfieri was [himself]196-alfieri the subject of [the little military despotism of [Piedmont]100-piedmont , whose nobles]1977-the little military despotism of piedmont , whose nobles required , every time [they]1978-they wished to travel or live abroad , to beg civilly for leave of absence , which was usually most uncivilly granted ; and one of whose laws threatened [any person who should print books in [foreign countries]1980-foreign countries , and without the permission of [the Sardinian censor]1981-the sardinian censor]1979-any person who should print books in foreign countries , and without the permission of the sardinian censor , with a heavy fine , and , if necessary , with corporal chastisement .

In order to become [a poet]1727-a poet , [Alfieri]196-alfieri required to become [a free agent]1983-a free agent ; and the only way to become [a free agent]1983-a free agent , to break through the bars of what [he]196-alfieri called [[his]196-alfieri " abominable native cage]3930-his " abominable native cage , "[1983-a free agent] the only way to obtain the power of writing what [he]196-alfieri wished to write , was to give up all [his]196-alfieri fortune , and live upon the charity of [the relatives whom [he]196-alfieri had enriched]1985-the relatives whom he had enriched . So , during the past months , [he]196-alfieri had been in constant correspondence with [[his]196-alfieri sister]1968-his sister , [[his]196-alfieri brother - in - law]1987-his brother - in - law , and [[his]196-alfieri lawyer]1988-his lawyer ; and now [he]196-alfieri had succeeded in ridding [himself]196-alfieri of all [[his]196-alfieri estates]1989-his estates and all [his]196-alfieri capital . [The Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany knew [Alfieri]196-alfieri sufficiently well by this time to understand that this alienation of all [his]196-alfieri property was a real sacrifice . [Alfieri]196-alfieri was [the vainest and most ostentatious of [men]711-men]1991-the vainest and most ostentatious of men ; young , handsome , showy and eccentric , accustomed to cut a grand figure wherever [he]196-alfieri went , it must have cost [him]196-alfieri a twinge to be obliged to reduce [[his]196-alfieri hitherto brilliant establishment]1993-his hitherto brilliant establishment , to dismiss nearly all [[his]196-alfieri servants]1490-his servants , to sell most of [his]196-alfieri horses , to exchange [his]196-alfieri embroidered velvets and satins for a plain black coat for the evening , and a plain blue coat for the afternoon . The worst sacrifice of all [he]196-alfieri doubtless confided , with savage bitterness , to [the Countess]1995-the countess , as [he]196-alfieri confided it to [the readers of [his]196-alfieri autobiography]1996-the readers of his autobiography , it was to resign the nominal service of [Piedmont]100-piedmont - to put aside , for good and all , that brilliant Sardinian uniform in which [he]196-alfieri looked to such advantage . [We]1997-we can imagine how this subject was talked over - how [Alfieri]196-alfieri , with that savage pleasure of [his]196-alfieri in the self - infliction of pain and humiliation , exposed to [the Countess]1995-the countess all the little , mean motives which had deterred [him]196-alfieri or which had encouraged [him]196-alfieri in [his]196-alfieri liberation from political servitude ; [we]1997-we can imagine how [she]1995-the countess chid [him]196-alfieri for [his]196-alfieri rash step , and how , at the same time , [she]1995-the countess felt a delicious pride in the meanness which [he]196-alfieri so frankly revealed , in the rashness which [she]1995-the countess so severely reproved ; [we]1997-we can imagine how the thought of [Alfieri]196-alfieri , who had thus sacrificed fortune , luxury , vanity , to the desire to be free , met in [the Countess of [Albany]310-albany]310-albany 's mind the thought of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward , living [the pensioner of a sovereign who had insulted [him]204-charles edward and of [a sovereign whom [he]204-charles edward had cheated , spending in liquor the money which [France]35-france had paid [him]196-alfieri to get [himself]196-alfieri [an heir]992-an heir and [the Stuarts]1306-the stuarts [another king]2003-another king]2000-a sovereign whom he had cheated , spending in liquor the money which france had paid him to get himself an heir and the stuarts another king]1999-the pensioner of a sovereign who had insulted him and of a sovereign whom he had cheated , spending in liquor the money which france had paid him to get himself an heir and the stuarts another king .

A strange and dangerous situation , but one whose danger was completely neutralised . Of all [the various persons who speak of the extraordinary friendship between [Vittorio Alfieri]196-alfieri and [Louise d'Albany]233-louise which existed at this time]2004-the various persons who speak of the extraordinary friendship between vittorio alfieri and louise d'albany which existed at this time , not one even ventures to hint that the relations between [them]2005-them exceeded in the slightest degree the limits of mere passionate friendship ; and the solemn words of [Alfieri]196-alfieri , in whom truthfulness was not merely an essential part of [his]196-alfieri natural character , but an even more essential part of [his]196-alfieri self - idealised personality , merely confirm the words of [all contemporary writers]2006-all contemporary writers . Now , if there was [a country]2007-a country where an intrigue between [a woman noted for [her]2009-her virtue and [a poet noted for [his]2010-a poet noted for his eccentricity eccentricity]2010-a poet noted for his eccentricity would , had it existed , have been joyfully laid hold of by gossip , it was certainly [this utterly - demoralised [Italy]3-italy [of cavalieri serventi]2012-of cavalieri serventi]2011-this utterly - demoralised italy of cavalieri serventi]2008-a woman noted for her virtue and a poet noted for his eccentricity would , had it existed , have been joyfully laid hold of by gossip , it was certainly this utterly - demoralised italy of cavalieri serventi : [every fashionable woman]2013-every fashionable woman and [every fast man]2014-every fast man would have felt a personal satisfaction in tearing to pieces the reputation of [a lady whose whole character and life had been a censure upon [theirs]2016-them]2015-a lady whose whole character and life had been a censure upon theirs . But , as there are [women the intensity of whose pure - mindedness , felt in every feature and gesture and word]2017-women the intensity of whose pure - mindedness , felt in every feature and gesture and word , paralyses even the most ribald wish to shock or outrage , and momentarily drags up towards [themselves]2016-them [the very people who would dearly love to drag [them]2016-them down even for a second]2018-the very people who would dearly love to drag them down even for a second ; so also it would appear that there are situations so strange , meetings of [individuals so exceptional]2019-individuals so exceptional , that calumny itself is unable to attack [them]2016-them . [No one]1470-no one said a word against [Alfieri]196-alfieri and [the Countess]1995-the countess ; and [Charles Edward]204-charles edward [himself]204-charles edward , jealous as [he]204-charles edward was of any kind of interference in [his]204-charles edward concerns , appears never to have attempted to rid [himself]204-charles edward of [[his]204-charles edward wife 's new friend]2022-his wife 's new friend .

Much , of course , must be set down to the very madness of [the Pretender]605-the pretender 's jealousy , to [his]204-charles edward more than Oriental systematic guarding and watching of [[his]204-charles edward wife]908-his wife . [Mann]207-sir horace mann , [we]2025-we must remember , had written , long before [Alfieri]196-alfieri appeared upon the scene , that [Charles Edward]204-charles edward never went out without [[his]204-charles edward wife]908-his wife and never let [her]908-his wife go out without [him]204-charles edward ; [he]204-charles edward barricaded [[her]908-his wife apartment]2027-her apartment , and was never further off than [the next room]1536-the next room . [Charles Edward]204-charles edward undoubtedly conferred upon [two people]2029-two people , living in a day of excessive looseness of manners , the inestimable advantage of confining [their]2029-two people love within the bounds of friendship , of crushing all that might have been base , of liberating all that could be noble , of turning what might have been merely a passion after the pattern of [Rousseau]342-rousseau into a passion after the pattern of [Dante]343-dante . But what [Charles Edward]204-charles edward could not do , what [no human being]2030-no human being or accidental circumstances could bring about , was due to the special nature of [Alfieri]196-alfieri and of [the Countess]1995-the countess ; namely , that this strange platonic passion , instead of dying out after a very brief time , merely intensified , became long - lived , inextinguishable , nay continued , in its absolute austerity and purity , long after every obstacle and restraint had been removed , except the obstacles and restraints which , from the very ideality of its own nature , increased for itself . And , if [we]2025-we look facts calmly in the face , and , letting alone all poetical jargon , ask [ourselves]2025-we the plain psychological explanation , [we]2025-we see that such things not only could , but , considering the character of [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri and of [Alfieri]196-alfieri]196-alfieri , must have been . [The Countess]1995-the countess had found in [Alfieri]196-alfieri the satisfaction of those intellectual and ideal cravings which in a nature like [hers]1995-the countess , and in a situation like [hers]1995-the countess , must have been the strongest and most durable necessities . [Alfieri]196-alfieri , on the other hand , sick of [his]196-alfieri past life , mortally afraid of falling once more under the tyranny of [his]196-alfieri baser nature , seeking on all sides assistance in that terrible struggle of the winged intellect out of the caterpillar cocoon in which it had lain torpid so long , was wrought up , if ever [a man]1698-a man was , to the pitch of enjoying , of desiring a mere intellectual passion just in proportion as it was absolutely and completely intellectual .

[A poet]1727-a poet especially in [his]1727-a poet conception of [his]1727-a poet own personality , [an artist who manipulated [his]1727-a poet own nature]2035-an artist who manipulated his own nature , [a poseur whose pose was [his]1727-a poet concentrated self cleared of all things which recalled the vulgar herd]2036-a poseur whose pose was his concentrated self cleared of all things which recalled the vulgar herd ; moreover , a furiously literary temper with a mad devotion to [Dante]343-dante and [Petrarch]340-petrarch : [Alfieri]196-alfieri must have found in this love , which fate in [[the Pretender]605-the pretender 's person]2038-the pretender 's person ordained to be platonic , the crowning characteristic of [his]196-alfieri present personality , the almost miraculous confirmation of [his]196-alfieri mystic relationship to [the lover of [Beatrice]344-beatrice]2039-the lover of beatrice and [the lover of [Laura]345-alfieri]2040-the lover of laura . And , in the knowledge of what [he]196-alfieri was to [this poor , tormented young wife]2041-this poor , tormented young wife ; in the consciousness of being the only ray of light in this close - shuttered prison - nay , rather bedlam - like existence ; in the sense of how completely the happiness of [Louise d'Albany]233-louise depended upon [him]196-alfieri , whatever there was of generous and dutiful in the selfish and self - willed nature of [Alfieri]345-alfieri must have become paramount , and enjoined upon [him]196-alfieri never to vacillate or grow weary in this strange mixture of love and of friendship .

CHAPTER IX .

[ROME]10-rome .

This strange intellectual passion , the meeting , as it were , of two long - repressed , long solitary intellectual lives , austerely satisfied with itself and contemptuous of all baser loves , might have sufficed for the happiness of two such over - wrought natures as were at that moment [Vittorio Alfieri]196-alfieri and [Louise d'Albany]233-louise .

But there could be no happiness for [the wife of [the Pretender]605-the pretender]2042-the wife of the pretender , and no happiness , therefore , for [the man who saw [her]2042-the wife of the pretender the daily victim of the cantankerousness , the grossness and the violence of [[her]2042-the wife of the pretender drunken husband]2045-her drunken husband]2044-the man who saw her the daily victim of the cantankerousness , the grossness and the violence of her drunken husband . To an imaginative mind , loving in things rather the ideal than the reality , striving for ever after some poetical or heroic model of love and of life , trying to be at once [a patriot out of [Plutarch]346-plutarch and [a lover after the fashion of the Vita Nuova]2047-a lover after the fashion of the vita nuova]2046-a patriot out of plutarch and a lover after the fashion of the vita nuova , there are few trials more exasperating than to have to see [the real creature who for the moment embodies one 's ideal]2048-the real creature who for the moment embodies one 's ideal , the creature whom [one carefully garlands with flowers and hangs round with lamps , raised above all vulgar things in the niche in one]2049-one carefully garlands with flowers and hangs round with lamps , raised above all vulgar things in the niche in one 's imagination , elbowed by brutish reality , bespattered with ignoble miseries . And this [Alfieri]196-alfieri had constantly to bear . Perhaps the very knowledge of the actual suffering , of the unjust recriminations , the cruel violence , the absolute fear of death , among which [Louise d'Albany]233-louise spent [her]233-louise life , was not so difficult for [[her]233-louise lover]2050-her lover to bear as to see [her]2042-the wife of the pretender , [the beautiful and high - minded lady of [his]2050-her lover heart]2051-the beautiful and high - minded lady of his heart , seated in [her]2042-the wife of the pretender opera box near the sofa where [the red and tumid - faced Pretender]2052-the red and tumid - faced pretender lay snoring , waking up , as [Mann]207-sir horace mann describes [him]2050-her lover , only to summon [his]2050-her lover lacqueys to assist [him]2050-her lover in a fit of drunken sickness , or to be carried , like a dead swine , with hanging bloated head and powerless arms , down - stairs to [[his]2050-her lover carriage]2053-his carriage ; not so difficult to bear as to hear [her]2042-the wife of the pretender , [[his]2050-her lover [Beatrice]344-beatrice]2054-his beatrice , [[his]2050-her lover Laura]2055-his laura , made the continual victim of [[her]2042-the wife of the pretender bullying husband]2056-her bullying husband 's childish bad - temper , of [his]2050-her lover foul - mouthed abuse , to hear it and have to sit by in silence , dependent upon the good graces of [a besotted ruffian against whom [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's hands must have continually itched]2057-a besotted ruffian against whom alfieri 's hands must have continually itched .

A little poem , poor , like all [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's lyrics , written about this time , and complaining of having to see a beautiful pure rose dragged through ignoble filth , shows that [Alfieri]196-alfieri , like [most poetical minds]2058-most poetical minds , resented the vulgar and the disgusting much more than [he]196-alfieri would have resented what [one]1590-one may call clean tragedy . But things got worse and worse , and the real tragedy threatened . [Charles Edward]204-charles edward had outraged and beaten [[his]204-charles edward mistress]934-his mistress ; older and much more profoundly degraded , [he]204-charles edward now outraged and beat [[his]204-charles edward wife]908-his wife . In 1780 [Sir Horace Mann]207-sir horace mann reports upon the " cruel and indecent behaviour "[204-charles edward] of which [Mme . d'Albany]347-mme was [the victim]2062-the victim . Ill - treatment and terror were beginning to undermine [her]347-mme health , and there can be no doubt , [I]0-i think , that the symptoms of a nervous disorder , of which [she]347-mme complained a couple of years later to [[Alfieri]196-alfieri 's bosom friend]2063-alfieri 's bosom friend [Gori]325-gori , must originally have been produced in [this unusually robust young woman]2064-this unusually robust young woman by the horrible treatment to which [she]347-mme was at this time subjected . [Mme]347-mme . d'Albany , who had astonished [the world]573-the world by [her]347-mme resignation , appears to have fairly taken fright ; [she]347-mme wrote to [[her]347-mme brother - in - law]694-her brother - in - law [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york , entreating [him]265-cardinal york to protect [her]347-mme from [[her]347-mme husband]790-her husband . [The weak - minded , conscientious cardinal]2068-the weak - minded , conscientious cardinal was not [the man to take any bold step]2069-the man to take any bold step ; [he]2068-the weak - minded , conscientious cardinal promised [[his]2068-the weak - minded , conscientious cardinal sister - in - law]2070-his sister - in - law all possible assistance if [she]347-mme were driven to extremities , but begged [her]347-mme to endure a little longer and save [him]2068-the weak - minded , conscientious cardinal the pain of a scandal . So [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri , long since abandoned by [her]347-mme own kith and kin , abandoned also by [[her]347-mme brother - in - law]694-her brother - in - law]2071-the countess of albany , long since abandoned by her own kith and kin , abandoned also by her brother - in - law , alone in [the world]573-the world between [a husband who was daily becoming more and more of a wild beast]2074-a husband who was daily becoming more and more of a wild beast , and [a lover who was fearful of giving any advice which might compromise [her]347-mme reputation or separate [them]2076-them for ever]2075-a lover who was fearful of giving any advice which might compromise her reputation or separate them for ever , went on suffering .

But the moment came when [she]347-mme could suffer no more . At the beginning of the winter of 1780 , the celebration of [St. Andrew]288-st. andrew 's day by [Charles Edward]204-charles edward and [[his]204-charles edward drinking companions]2077-his drinking companions , was followed by a scene over which [Alfieri]196-alfieri drops a modest veil , calling it vaguely a violent bacchanal which endangered the life of [[his]196-alfieri lady]1719-his lady . From the biographers of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward [we]2079-we learn that [the Pretender]605-the pretender roused [[his]605-the pretender wife]908-his wife in the middle of the night with a torrent of insulting language which provoked [her]908-his wife to vehement recriminations ; that [he]605-the pretender beat [her]908-his wife , committed foul acts upon [her]908-his wife , and finished off with attempting to choke [her]908-his wife in [her]908-his wife bed , in which [he]605-the pretender would probably have succeeded had [the servants]2082-the servants not been waked by [the Countess]1995-the countess 's screams and dragged [Charles Edward]204-charles edward away . 1

[Alfieri]196-alfieri , partly from an honourable reluctance to see [[his]196-alfieri lady]1719-his lady made [the heroine of a public scandal]2085-the heroine of a public scandal , and partly , no doubt , from the more selfish fear lest a separation from [[her]908-his wife husband]790-her husband might imply a separation also from [[her]908-his wife lover]2050-her lover , had long persisted in advising [the Countess]1995-the countess against any extreme measure . [Alfieri]196-alfieri tells [us]2089-us that with the desire for freedom of speech and writing at the bottom of [his]196-alfieri act of self - spoliation in [[his]196-alfieri sister]1968-his sister 's favour , there had mingled a sense also that by breaking all connections with [Piedmont]100-piedmont , and liberating [himself]196-alfieri from all temptation of marrying for the sake of [[his]196-alfieri family]933-his family , [he]196-alfieri was , in a manner , securing the continuation of [his]196-alfieri relations with [Mme]347-mme . d'Albany . [The Countess]196-alfieri 's flight from [[her]908-his wife husband]790-her husband , [they]2093-they both well knew , would in all probability put an end to these relations ; [the Catholic Church]114-the catholic church could grant no divorce , and [Charles Edward]204-charles edward would probably refuse a separation ; so that the honour , nay , the life of [the fugitive wife]2094-the fugitive wife would be safe only in [a convent]594-a convent , whence [Alfieri]196-alfieri would be excluded together with [Charles Edward]204-charles edward . The choice was a hard one to make ; the choice between a life of peace and safety , but separated from all that made life dear to [her]908-his wife , and a life consoled by the presence of [Alfieri]196-alfieri , but made wretched and absolutely endangered by the violence of [a drunken maniac]2096-a drunken maniac . But after that frightful night of [St. Andrew]288-st. andrew no choice remained ; to remain under [the Pretender]605-the pretender 's roof was equivalent for [[his]605-the pretender wife]908-his wife either to a violent death in another such fit of madness , or to a lingering death from sheer misery and daily terror . [The Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany must leave [[her]527-the countess of albany husband]790-her husband .

To effectuate this was the work of [Alfieri]196-alfieri - of Alfieri , who , of [all men]2101-all men , was most interested to keep [Mme]347-mme . d'Albany in [[[her]347-mme husband]790-her husband 's house]2103-her husband 's house ; of [Alfieri]196-alfieri , who , of [all men]2101-all men , was the least fitted for any kind of underhand practices . The actual plot for escape was the least part of the business ; the conspiracy would have utterly miscarried , and [Mme]347-mme . d'Albany have been condemned to a life of much worse agony , had not provision been made against [the Pretender]605-the pretender 's certain efforts to get [[his]605-the pretender wife]908-his wife back . [Mme]347-mme . d'Albany may have remembered how [[her]347-mme mother - in - law]2107-her mother - in - law [Clementina Sobieska]253-maria clementina sobieska , although protected by [the Pope]650-the pope , had been eventually got out of [the convent]1018-the convent whither [she]347-mme had escaped , and had been restored to [[her]347-mme husband]790-her husband [the Pretender [James]238-james ii]2111-the pretender james ; [she]347-mme was probably aware , also , how [Charles Edward]204-charles edward had stormed at [the French Government]65-the french government to have [Miss Walkenshaw]264-miss walkenshaw sent back to [him]204-charles edward from [the convent]1018-the convent at [Meaux]115-meaux . [No Government]65-the french government could give [a man]1698-a man back [[his]1698-a man mistress]934-his mistress , but it was different with [a wife]608-a wife ; and both [Alfieri]196-alfieri and [the Countess]1995-the countess must have known full well that however lax [the Grand Ducal Court]2117-the grand ducal court might be on the subject of conjugal infidelity , when quietly carried on under the domestic roof and dignified by the name of serventismo , [no court]2118-no court , [no society]2119-no society , could do otherwise than virtuously resent so great a turpitude as [a wife]608-a wife publicly running away by [herself]608-a wife from [[[her]608-a wife husband]790-her husband 's house]2103-her husband 's house . It became necessary to win over the sympathies of [those in power]2123-those in power , to secure [their]2123-those in power connivance , or at all events [their]2123-those in power neutrality ; and this task of talking , flattering , wheedling , imploring , fell to [Alfieri]196-alfieri , whose sense of self - debasement appears to have been mitigated only by the knowledge that [he]196-alfieri was working for the good of [a guiltless and miserable woman]2124-a guiltless and miserable woman , of [the woman whom [he]196-alfieri loved more than [the whole world]2126-the whole world]2125-the woman whom he loved more than the whole world ; by the bitter knowledge that the success of [his]196-alfieri efforts , the liberation of [[his]196-alfieri beloved]2127-his beloved , meant also the sacrifice of that intercourse which made the happiness of [his]196-alfieri life .

[Alfieri]196-alfieri succeeded ; [the Grand Duke]1459-the grand duke and [the Grand Duchess]2129-the grand duchess were won over . The actual flight alone remained to be accomplished .

2 In the first days of December 1780 a certain [Mme . Orlandini]347-mme , [a half Irish lady connected with [the Jacobite Ormonds]348-the jacobite ormonds]2130-a half irish lady connected with the jacobite ormonds , was invited to breakfast at [the palace]779-the palace in [the Via San Sebastiano]96-via san sebastiano . [She]347-mme skilfully led the conversation into a discussion on needle - work , and suggested that [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany should go and see the last embroidery produced at [the convent of Bianchette]2133-the convent of bianchette , [a now long - suppressed establishment in [the adjoining Via del Mandorlo]2135-the adjoining via del mandorlo]2134-a now long - suppressed establishment in the adjoining via del mandorlo . [The Countess of Albany]196-alfieri ordered [[her]527-the countess of albany carriage]1246-her carriage for immediately after breakfast , and [the two ladies]2137-the two ladies drove off , accompanied , of course , by [Charles Edward]204-charles edward , who never permitted [[his]204-charles edward wife]908-his wife to go out without [him]204-charles edward . Near [the convent]1018-the convent - gate [they]2137-the two ladies met [a Mr. Gahagan]349-gahagan , [an Irish Jacobite]2140-an irish jacobite and [the official cavaliere servente of Mme]2141-the official cavaliere servente of mme . Orlandini , who , hearing that [they]2137-the two ladies were going to pay a visit to [the nuns]2142-the nuns , offered to accompany [them]2137-the two ladies . [Gahagan]349-gahagan helped out [the Countess]1995-the countess and [Mme]347-mme . Orlandini , who rapidly ran up the flight of steps leading to [the convent]1018-the convent door ; [he]349-gahagan then offered [his]349-gahagan arm to [Charles Edward]204-charles edward , whose legs were disabled by dropsy . Leaning on [Gahagan]349-gahagan 's arm , [the Pretender]605-the pretender was slowly making [his]605-the pretender way up the steps when [[his]605-the pretender companion]2146-his companion , looking up , suddenly exclaimed that [the two ladies]2137-the two ladies had already entered [the convent]1018-the convent and that [the nuns]2142-the nuns had stupidly and rudely shut the door in [his]204-charles edward and [the Count of [Albany]196-alfieri]607-the count of albany 's face . " [They]2137-the two ladies will soon have to open , "[204-charles edward] answered [Charles Edward]204-charles edward , and began to knock violently . [Mr. Gahagan]349-gahagan doubtless knocked also . But no answer came . At length the door opened , and there appeared behind a grating no less a person than [the Lady Abbess]2151-the lady abbess , who ceremoniously informed [the Count]1121-the count that [she]2151-the lady abbess was unable to let [him]1121-the count in , as [[his]1121-the count wife]908-his wife had sought an asylum in [[her]908-his wife convent]2154-her convent under the protection of [[Her]908-his wife Highness [the Grand Duchess of [Tuscany]80-tuscany]350-the grand duchess of tuscany]2155-her highness the grand duchess of tuscany .

[Sir Horace Mann]207-sir horace mann says that [Alfieri]196-alfieri , who is not mentioned in the very circumstantial narrative of [Dutens]211-charles dutens , was hanging about [the convent]1018-the convent , in order to prevent [the Pretender]605-the pretender , who always carried pistols in [his]605-the pretender pockets , from committing any violence . This seems extremely unlikely , as the first use to which [Charles Edward]204-charles edward would naturally have put [his]204-charles edward pistols would have been shooting [Alfieri]196-alfieri , for whose murder [he]204-charles edward immediately offered a thousand sequins . At any rate , raging like [a maniac]1009-a maniac , [the discomfited husband]2159-the discomfited husband went back to [[his]2159-the discomfited husband empty house]2160-his empty house .

It would be pretty and pathetic to insert in this part of [my]0-i narrative a page of half - condemnatory condolence with [Charles Edward]204-charles edward . But this [I]0-i find it perfectly impossible to do . Of course , if [we]2161-we call to mind [Falkirk]43-falkirk and [Skye]351-skye , if [we]2161-we conjure up in [our]2161-we fancy [the Prince Charlie who still lived in the thoughts of [Flora MacDonald]318-florence]318-florence , there is something very frightful in this tragi - comic flight of [the Countess of Albany]196-alfieri : the slamming of that convent door in [his]318-florence face is the worst injury , the worst injustice , the worst ignominy reserved by fate for [the last of [the unhappy Stuarts]2163-the unhappy stuarts]2162-the last of the unhappy stuarts .

But of [the Charles Edward of the Forty - five]2164-the charles edward of the forty - five there remained so little in [this Count of Albany]2165-this count of albany that [we]2161-we have no right to consider [them]2166-them any longer as [one individual]2167-one individual , to condone the brutishness of [the Count of [Albany]196-alfieri]607-the count of albany for the sake of the chivalry of [Prince Charles]318-florence , to degrade [our]2161-we conception of [the young man]2169-the young man by tacking on to it the just ignominy inflicted upon [the old man]2170-the old man , [the man who had inherited [his]2170-the old man name and position , but scarcely [his]2170-the old man personality]2171-the man who had inherited his name and position , but scarcely his personality . Above all , [we]2161-we have no right to add to whatever reproaches [we]2161-we may think fit to shower upon [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany and on [Alfieri]196-alfieri , the imaginary reproach that [the husband whose rights [they]2174-they were violating]2173-the husband whose rights they were violating was [the victor of [Gladsmuir]42-gladsmuir and [Falkirk]43-falkirk]2175-the victor of gladsmuir and falkirk .

There must always be something which shocks [us]2161-we in the behaviour , however otherwise innocent and decorous , of [a woman who runs away from [[her]2176-a woman who runs away from her husband with the assistance of her lover husband]790-her husband with the assistance of [[her]2176-a woman who runs away from her husband with the assistance of her lover lover]2050-her lover]2176-a woman who runs away from her husband with the assistance of her lover ; but this quality of offensiveness is not , in such a case as the present one , a fault of [the woman]1874-the woman : it is one of [her]1874-the woman undeserved misfortunes , as much as is the bad treatment , the solitude , the temptation , to which [she]1874-the woman has been subjected . The evil practice of [the world]573-the world , its folly and wickedness in permitting that [a girl like [Louise]233-louise of [Stolberg]15-stolberg]2181-a girl like louise of stolberg should be married to [a man like [Charles Edward]204-charles edward]2182-a man like charles edward , its injustice and cruelty in forbidding the legal breaking of such an unrighteous contract ; the evil practice of [the world]573-the world which condemned [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany to be for so much of [her]527-the countess of albany life [an unhappy woman]2185-an unhappy woman , also condemned [her]527-the countess of albany to be in some of [her]527-the countess of albany actions [a woman deserving of blame]2186-a woman deserving of blame . [We]2187-we shall see further on how , in the attempt to work out [their]2188-their happiness in despite of the evil world in which [they]2188-their lived , [the Countess]1995-the countess and [Alfieri]196-alfieri , infinitely intellectually and morally superior to many of [us]2187-we [whom circumstances permit to live blameless and comfortable]2190-whom circumstances permit to live blameless and comfortable , were splashed with the mud of unrighteousness , which was foreign to [their]2188-their nature , and remained spotted in the eyes of [posterity]2191-posterity .

[Charles Edward]204-charles edward did what [he]204-charles edward had done once before in [his]204-charles edward life : [he]204-charles edward applied to [the Government]1472-the government to put [him]204-charles edward again in possession of [the woman whom [he]204-charles edward had victimised]2193-the woman whom he had victimised ; but as [the French Government]65-the french government had refused to recognise [his]204-charles edward claims over [[his]204-charles edward fugitive mistress]2194-his fugitive mistress , so [the Government of [the Grand Duke of [Tuscany]80-tuscany]2196-the grand duke of tuscany]2195-the government of the grand duke of tuscany now refused to give [him]204-charles edward back [[his]204-charles edward fugitive wife]2197-his fugitive wife . [The Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]196-alfieri had naturally taken no clothes with [her]2197-his fugitive wife in [her]2197-his fugitive wife flight ; and [she]2197-his fugitive wife presently sent [a maid]2198-a maid to [the palace]779-the palace in [Via San Sebastiano]96-via san sebastiano to fetch such things as [she]2197-his fugitive wife might require . But [Charles Edward]204-charles edward would not permit a single one of [her]2197-his fugitive wife effects to be touched ; if [she]2197-his fugitive wife wanted [her]2197-his fugitive wife clothes and trinkets , [she]2197-his fugitive wife might come and fetch them [herself]2197-his fugitive wife . However , after a few days , a message came from [the Pope]650-the pope , ordering [the Pretender]605-the pretender to supply [[his]605-the pretender wife]908-his wife with whatever [she]2197-his fugitive wife might require ; a threat to suspend the pension was probably expressed or implied , for [Charles Edward]204-charles edward immediately obeyed .

Meanwhile , [the Countess of Albany]196-alfieri was anxiously awaiting at [the convent of the Bianchette]2203-the convent of the bianchette a decision from [[her]2197-his fugitive wife brother - in - law]694-her brother - in - law , to whom [she]2197-his fugitive wife had written immediately after [her]2197-his fugitive wife flight . Those first days must have been painfully unquiet . What if [the Tuscan Court]1481-the tuscan court should listen to [the Count of]598-the count of [Albany]196-alfieri 's entreaties ? What if [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york should take part with [[his]265-cardinal york brother]804-his brother ? Return to [the house of [[her]2197-his fugitive wife husband]790-her husband]2208-the house of her husband would be death or worse than death . [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york answered immediately : a long , kind , rather weak - minded letter , the ideal letter of [a well - intentioned , rather silly priest]2210-a well - intentioned , rather silly priest , in curious [Anglo - Roman French]2211-anglo - roman french . [He]265-cardinal york informed [her]2197-his fugitive wife that for some time past [he]265-cardinal york had expected to hear of [her]2197-his fugitive wife flight from [[her]2197-his fugitive wife husband]790-her husband ; [he]265-cardinal york protested that [he]265-cardinal york had had no hand in [her]2197-his fugitive wife unhappy marriage , and begged [her]2197-his fugitive wife to believe that it had been out of [his]265-cardinal york power to protect [her]2197-his fugitive wife . [He]265-cardinal york had informed [the Pope]650-the pope of the whole affair , and with [[His]265-cardinal york Holiness]2214-his holiness ' approval had prepared for [[his]265-cardinal york sister]1968-his sister - in - law [a temporary asylum in [the Ursuline convent in [Rome]10-rome]2217-the ursuline convent in rome]2216-a temporary asylum in the ursuline convent in rome , whither [he]265-cardinal york invited [her]2197-his fugitive wife to remove as soon as possible . In January 1781 [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany , accompanied by [a Mme . de Marzan]353-a mme . de marzan , who appears to have formed part of [[her]2197-his fugitive wife household]2219-her household , and [two maids]2220-two maids , started for [Rome]10-rome ; but such had been the threats of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward , and [his]265-cardinal york ravings to get [[his]265-cardinal york wife]908-his wife back , that [Alfieri]196-alfieri and [Gahagan]349-gahagan , armed and dressed as [servants]2222-servants , accompanied [the carriage]1250-the carriage a considerable part of [its]1250-the carriage way . [The Pretender]605-the pretender , [we]2225-we must remember , had offered a thousand sequins to anyone who would kill [Alfieri]196-alfieri ; and even in that humdrum late eighteenth century [a man of position]2226-a man of position might easily hire a couple of ruffians to waylay [a carriage]2227-a carriage and kidnap [a woman]689-a woman .

[The Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany was installed in [the Ursuline convent]2230-the ursuline convent in [Via Vittoria]118-via vittoria , [a street near [the Piazza di Spagna]119-the piazza di spagna]2231-a street near the piazza di spagna . A gloomy family memory hung about [the place]1614-the place : it had been [the asylum of [Clementina Sobieska]253-maria clementina sobieska]2233-the asylum of clementina sobieska when [she]253-maria clementina sobieska had fled from [the elder Pretender]810-the elder pretender as [Louise d'Albany]233-louise had fled from [the younger]1322-the younger . But [the wife of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward]1967-the wife of charles edward was in a very different mood from [the wife of [James III]252-james iii]2237-the wife of james iii . ; and it is probable that , despite the many charms of [the convent]1018-the convent , and the excellent manners of [[its]1018-the convent aristocratic inmates]2239-its aristocratic inmates , upon which [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york had laid great store , [the Countess]1995-the countess , with [her]1995-the countess heart full of the thought of [Alfieri]196-alfieri , was not at all inclined to give [[her]1995-the countess pious brother - in - law]2241-her pious brother - in - law the satisfaction , which [he]2241-her pious brother - in - law apparently expected , of developing a sudden vocation for Heaven .

[She]1995-the countess had left [Florence]9-florence at the end of the year ; in the spring [she]1995-the countess saw [Alfieri]196-alfieri again . The quiet work which had seemed so natural and easy while [he]2241-her pious brother - in - law was sure of seeing [[his]2241-her pious brother - in - law lady]1719-his lady every day , had become quite impossible to [him]2241-her pious brother - in - law . [He]2241-her pious brother - in - law felt that [he]2241-her pious brother - in - law ought to remain in [Florence]9-florence , that [he]2241-her pious brother - in - law ought not to follow [her]1995-the countess to [Rome]10-rome . But [Florence]9-florence had become insufferable to [him]2241-her pious brother - in - law ; and [he]2241-her pious brother - in - law determined to remove to [Naples]67-naples , because to get to [Naples]67-naples it was necessary to pass through [Rome]10-rome . The melancholy barren approach to [the Eternal City]1444-the eternal city , which , three years before , had inspired [Alfieri]196-alfieri with nothing but melancholy and disgust , now seemed to [him]2241-her pious brother - in - law a sort of earthly paradise ; and [Rome]10-rome , which [he]2241-her pious brother - in - law hated , as the most delightful of places . [He]2241-her pious brother - in - law hurried to [the Ursuline convent]2230-the ursuline convent , and was admitted to speak to [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany . " [I]2241-her pious brother - in - law saw [her]1995-the countess , "[2241-her pious brother - in - law] [he]2241-her pious brother - in - law wrote many years later , " but [O God]272-god ! [my]2241-her pious brother - in - law heart seems to break at the mere recollection [I]2241-her pious brother - in - law saw [her]1995-the countess [a prisoner behind a grating]3931-a prisoner behind a grating ; less tormented than in [Florence]9-florence , but yet not less unhappy . [We]3932-we were separated , and who could tell how long [our]3932-we separation might not last ? But , while crying , [I]2241-her pious brother - in - law tried to console [myself]2241-her pious brother - in - law with the thought that [she]1995-the countess might at least recover [her]1995-the countess health , that [she]1995-the countess would breathe freely , and sleep peacefully , no longer trembling at every moment before the indivisible shadow of [[her]1995-the countess drunken husband]2045-her drunken husband ; that [she]1995-the countess might , in short , live . "[2241-her pious brother - in - law]

CHAPTER X.

ANTIGONE .

About three months after [the Countess of Albany]196-alfieri 's flight from [[her]2246-her husband]790-her husband , [the Pope]650-the pope granted [her]2246-her permission to leave [the Ursuline convent]2230-the ursuline convent ; and [[her]2246-her brother - in - law]694-her brother - in - law , [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york , offered [her]2246-her hospitality in [[his]265-cardinal york magnificent palace of [the Cancelleria]125-the cancelleria]2251-his magnificent palace of the cancelleria . [Alfieri]196-alfieri was at [Naples]67-naples when [he]196-alfieri received this news , riding gloomily along [the sea - shore]2252-the sea - shore , weeping profusely for [we]2253-we must remember that to [an Italian , especially of the eighteenth century]2254-an italian , especially of the eighteenth century , there is no incongruity in [a would - be ancient Roman]2255-a would - be ancient roman shedding love - sick tears , unable to give [his]196-alfieri attention to work , living , as [he]196-alfieri expresses it , on the coming in and going out of the post . " [I]196-alfieri wished to return to [Rome]10-rome , "[196-alfieri] [he]196-alfieri writes , " and at the same time [I]196-alfieri felt very keenly that [I]196-alfieri ought not to do it yet . The struggles between love and duty which take place in an honourable and tender heart , are the most terrible and mortal pain that [a man]1698-a man can suffer . [I]196-alfieri delayed throughout April , and [I]196-alfieri determined to drag on through May ; but on the 12th May [I]196-alfieri found [myself]196-alfieri , [I]196-alfieri scarcely know how , back in [Rome]10-rome . "[196-alfieri]

[Alfieri]196-alfieri found [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany established in [the palace of [the Cancelleria]125-the cancelleria]2257-the palace of the cancelleria , [the mistress of the establishment]2258-the mistress of the establishment , for [[her]527-the countess of albany brother - in - law]694-her brother - in - law was living in [[his]694-her brother - in - law episcopal town of [Frascati]121-frascati]2260-his episcopal town of frascati . [They]2261-they were free to see [each other]2262-each other as much as [they]2261-they chose , to love [each other]2262-each other as much as [they]2261-they would ; for [the Cardinal and the priestly circles]2264-the cardinal and the priestly circles seem to have gone completely to sleep in the presence of this critical situation ; and the habits of Roman society , which were even a shade worse than those of [Florence]9-florence , were not such as to give umbrage to [the lovers]2265-the lovers . But those years during which [they]2261-they had loved under the vigilant jealousy of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward , had apparently fostered a love which was accustomed and satisfied with being only a more passionate kind of friendship ; the indomitable power of resistance to [himself]694-her brother - in - law , the passion for realising in [himself]694-her brother - in - law some heroic attitude which [he]694-her brother - in - law admired , and the almost furious desire to reverse completely [his]694-her brother - in - law former habits of life , kept [Alfieri]196-alfieri up to the point of a platonic connexion ; and [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany , intellectual , cold , passive , easily moulded by a more vehement nature , loved [Alfieri]196-alfieri much more with the head than with the heart , and loved in [him]196-alfieri just that which made [him]196-alfieri prefer that [they]2261-they should meet and love as austerely as [Petrarch]340-petrarch and [Laura]345-alfieri . The fact was , [I]0-i believe , that [the Countess of Albany]196-alfieri had much more mind than personality , and that [she]527-the countess of albany was therefore mere wax in the hands of [a man who had become so exclusively and violently intellectual]2267-a man who had become so exclusively and violently intellectual as [Alfieri]196-alfieri : [she]527-the countess of albany had seen too much of the coarse realities of life , of the brutal giving way to sensual impulse : the heroic , the ideal , nay the deliberately made up , the artificial , had a charm for [her]527-the countess of albany . Be this as it may , [the Countess]1995-the countess and [Alfieri]196-alfieri continued , in the opinion of [all contemporaries]2269-all contemporaries , and according to the assurance of [Alfieri]196-alfieri [himself]196-alfieri , whose cynicism and truthfulness are equal , on the same footing as in [Florence]9-florence .

And these months in [Rome]10-rome seem to have been the happiest months of [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's life , the happiest , probably , of the life of [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany . [Alfieri]196-alfieri hired [the villa Strozzi]2271-the villa strozzi , on [the Esquiline]122-the esquiline , [a small palace built by one of [[Michel Angelo]354-michel angelo 's pupils]2273-michel angelo 's pupils]2272-a small palace built by one of michel angelo 's pupils [, and for which , including the use of furniture , [stables , and garden]2275-stables , and garden , [he]196-alfieri paid the now incredibly small sum of ten scudi a month , about two pounds of [our]2276-our money]2274-, and for which , including the use of furniture , stables , and garden , he paid the now incredibly small sum of ten scudi a month , about two pounds of our money . Permitting [himself]196-alfieri only two coats , the black one for the evening , and the famous blue one for ordinary occasions , and limiting [his]196-alfieri dinner to one dish of meat and vegetables , without wine or coffee , [Alfieri]196-alfieri contrived to make the comparatively small pension paid to [him]196-alfieri by [[his]196-alfieri sister]1968-his sister , go almost as far as had the fine fortune of which [he]196-alfieri had despoiled [himself]196-alfieri . [He]196-alfieri spent lavishly on books , and more lavishly on horses , on horses which , according to [his]196-alfieri own account , were [his]196-alfieri third passion , coming only after [his]196-alfieri love for Mme . d'Albany , and sometimes usurping the place of [his]196-alfieri love of literary glory .

The mania for systematic division of [his]196-alfieri time , the invincible tendency to routine , which follows in most Italians after the disorder and wastefulness of youth , had already got the better of [Alfieri]196-alfieri . [He]196-alfieri had , almost at the moment when the passion for literature first disclosed itself , made up [his]196-alfieri mind to write a definite number of tragedies , first twelve , then fourteen , and no more ; and to devote a certain number of years to the elaborate process of first constructing them mentally , then of writing them full length in prose , and finally of turning this prose into verse ; and [he]196-alfieri was later to devise a corresponding plan of writing an equally fixed number of comedies and satires in an equally fixed number of years , after which , as [we]2276-our have seen , [he]196-alfieri was to give up [his]196-alfieri thoughts , having attained the age of forty - five , to preparing for death .

This routine is a national characteristic , and absorbs many an Italian , turning all the poetry of [his]196-alfieri nature to prose , with a kind of dreadful inevitableness ; but [Alfieri]196-alfieri did not merely submit to routine , [he]196-alfieri enjoyed it , [he]196-alfieri devised and carried it out with all the ferocity of [his]196-alfieri nature . To [this man]2278-this man , who cared so much for the figure [he]196-alfieri cut , and so little for all the things which surrounded [him]196-alfieri , a life reduced to absolute monotony of grinding work was almost an object of æsthetic pleasure , almost an object of sensual delight : [he]196-alfieri enjoyed a dead level , an endless white - washed wall , as much as [other men]1642-other men , and especially [other poets]2280-other poets , enjoy the ups and downs , the irregularities and mottled colours of existence . So [Alfieri]196-alfieri arranged for [himself]196-alfieri , in [[his]196-alfieri house near [Santa Maria Maggiore]123-santa maria maggiore]2281-his house near santa maria maggiore , what to [him]196-alfieri was a life of exquisite delightfulness .

[He]196-alfieri spent the whole early morning reading the Latin and Italian classics , and grinding away at [his]196-alfieri tragedies , which , after repeated sketching out , repeated writing out in prose , were now going through the most elaborate process of writing , re - writing , revising , and re - revising in verse . Then , before resuming [his]196-alfieri solitary studies in the afternoon , [he]196-alfieri would have one of [his]196-alfieri many horses saddled , and ride about in [the desolate tracts of [the town]770-the town]2282-the desolate tracts of the town , which in papal times extended from [Santa Maria Maggiore]123-santa maria maggiore to [the Porta Pia]2284-the porta pia , [the Porta San Lorenzo]2285-the porta san lorenzo , and [St. John Lateran]355-st. john lateran : [miles of [former villa gardens]2287-former villa gardens , with quincunxes and flower - beds , cut up for cabbage - growing , wide open spaces where the wall of [a temple]2288-a temple , the arch of [an aqueduct]2289-an aqueduct]2286-miles of former villa gardens , with quincunxes and flower - beds , cut up for cabbage - growing , wide open spaces where the wall of a temple , the arch of an aqueduct , rose crowned with wall - flower and weeds out of the rank grass , the briars and nettles , the heaps of broken masonry and plaster , among which shone beneath the darting lizards , scraps of vermilion wall - fresco , the chips of purple porphyry or dark - green serpentine ; long avenues of trees early sere , closed in by arum - fringed walls , or by [ditches where the withered reeds creaked beneath the festoons of clematis and wild vine]2290-ditches where the withered reeds creaked beneath the festoons of clematis and wild vine ; solemn and solitary wildernesses within [the city]2291-the city walls , where the silence was broken only by the lowing of the herds driven along by [the shaggy herdsman on [his]196-alfieri shaggy horse]2292-the shaggy herdsman on his shaggy horse , by the long - drawn , guttural chant of the carter stretched on the top of [[his]196-alfieri cart]2293-his cart , and the jingle of [his]196-alfieri horse 's bells ; places inaccessible to the present , [a border - land of the past]2294-a border - land of the past , and which , as [Alfieri]196-alfieri says , thinking of those many times when [he]196-alfieri must have reined in [his]196-alfieri horse , and vaguely and wistfully looked out on to the green desolation islanded with ruins and traversed by [the vast procession of [the aqueducts]2296-the aqueducts]2295-the vast procession of the aqueducts , invited [one]1590-one to meditate , and cry , and be [a poet]1727-a poet . And sometimes - [we]2299-we know it from the sonnets to [his]196-alfieri horse [Fido]356-fido , who had , [Alfieri]196-alfieri tells [us]2299-we , carried the beloved burden of [[his]196-alfieri lady]1719-his lady - [Alfieri]196-alfieri did not ride out alone . [One of the horses of [the villa Strozzi]2271-the villa strozzi was saddled for [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany]2301-one of the horses of the villa strozzi was saddled for the countess of albany ; and [this strange pair of platonic lovers]2304-this strange pair of platonic lovers rode forth together among [the ruins]2305-the ruins , [the wife of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward]1967-the wife of charles edward listening , with something more than mere abstract interest , to [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's fiercest contemptuous tirades against the tyranny of [soldiers]2307-soldiers and [priests]1050-priests , the tyranny of sloth and lust which had turned [these spots]2309-these spots into [a wilderness]2310-a wilderness , and which had left [the world]573-the world , as [Alfieri]196-alfieri always felt , and [a man not unlike [Alfieri]196-alfieri]2312-a man not unlike alfieri in savage and destructive austerity , [St. Just]355-st. john lateran , was later to say , empty since the days of [the Romans]357-the romans .

Towards dusk [Alfieri]196-alfieri put by [his]196-alfieri books , and descended through [the twilit streets of [the upper city]2314-the upper city]2313-the twilit streets of the upper city - where [the troops of red and yellow and blue seminarists]2315-the troops of red and yellow and blue seminarists , and [black and brown monks]2316-black and brown monks , passed by like ants , homeward bound after [their]2315-the troops of red and yellow and blue seminarists evening walk - into [the busier parts of [Rome]10-rome]2317-the busier parts of rome , and crossing [the Corso]2318-the corso filled with [painted and gilded coaches]2319-painted and gilded coaches , and making [his]196-alfieri way through [the many squares]2320-the many squares where [the people]2321-the people gathered round the lemonade - booth near the fountain or [the obelisk]2322-the obelisk , through [the tortuous black streets]2323-the tortuous black streets [filled with the noise of the anvils and hammers of the locksmiths]2324-filled with the noise of the anvils and hammers of the locksmiths and [nailors]2325-nailors behind [the Pantheon]2326-the pantheon , made [his]196-alfieri way towards [the palace]779-the palace , grand and prim in [its]779-the palace architecture of [Bramants]124-bramants , of [the Cancelleria]125-the cancelleria , perhaps not without thinking that in [the big square before [its]779-the palace windows]2328-the big square before its windows , where the vegetable carts were unloaded every morning , and [the quacks and dentists]2329-the quacks and dentists and [pedlars]2330-pedlars bawled all day , [a man as strange , as wayward and impatient of tyranny as [himself]2331-a man as strange , as wayward and impatient of tyranny as himself]2331-a man as strange , as wayward and impatient of tyranny as himself , [Giordano Bruno]358-giordano bruno , had been burned two centuries before by [[Cardinal York]265-cardinal york 's predecessor]2332-cardinal york 's predecessor in [that big palace of [the Cancelleria]125-the cancelleria]2333-that big palace of the cancelleria . Fortunately there was no [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york in [the Cancelleria]125-the cancelleria , or at least only rarely ; but instead only [the beautiful blonde woman with the dark hazel eyes]2334-the beautiful blonde woman with the dark hazel eyes , whom [Alfieri]196-alfieri spoke of as [[his]196-alfieri " lady]3935-his " lady , "[196-alfieri] and , somewhat later , " as the sweet half of [himself]196-alfieri , "[196-alfieri] and in whose speech [Alfieri]196-alfieri was never [Alfieri]196-alfieri , or [Vittorio]196-alfieri , or [the Count]1121-the count , but merely " [the poet]3936-the poet , "[196-alfieri] so completely had [these strange , self - modelling , unconsciously - attitudinising lovers]2336-these strange , self - modelling , unconsciously - attitudinising lovers , arrayed [themselves]2336-these strange , self - modelling , unconsciously - attitudinising lovers and [their]2336-these strange , self - modelling , unconsciously - attitudinising lovers love according to the pattern of [Dante]343-dante and [Petrarch]340-petrarch .

To [the Countess]1995-the countess , [we]2338-we may be sure , [Alfieri]196-alfieri never failed to give a most elaborate account of [his]196-alfieri day 's work , nor to read to [her]1995-the countess whatever scenes of [his]196-alfieri plays [he]196-alfieri had blocked out , in prose , or worked up in verse . By 11 o'clock , [he]196-alfieri tells [us]2338-we , [he]196-alfieri was always back in [[his]196-alfieri solitary little villa on [the Esquiline]122-the esquiline]2339-his solitary little villa on the esquiline .

But this , although it is probably correct with regard to [his]196-alfieri visits to [Mme .]353-a mme . de marzan [d'Albany , with whom consideration for gossip]2340-d'albany , with whom consideration for gossip prevented [his]196-alfieri staying much after ten at night , must not be taken as the invariable rule ; for [Alfieri]196-alfieri , devoted as [he]196-alfieri was to [[his]196-alfieri lady]1719-his lady , by no means neglected other society . [He]196-alfieri was finishing [his]196-alfieri allotted number of tragedies , and , as the solemn moment of publication approached , [he]196-alfieri began to be tormented with that same desire to display [his]196-alfieri work to [others]1434-others , to hear [their]1434-others praises even if false , to understand [their]1434-others opinion even if unfavourable , which came , by gusts , as one of the passions of [his]196-alfieri life . [Rome]10-rome was at that time , like [every Italian town]2343-every italian town , full of [literary academies]2344-literary academies , [conventicles of very small intellectual fry]2345-conventicles of very small intellectual fry meeting in [private drawing - rooms]2346-private drawing - rooms or at [coffee - houses]2347-coffee - houses , and swayed by the overlordship of the famous Arcadia , which had now sunk into being a huge club to which every creature who scribbled , or daubed , or strummed , or had a coach - and - pair , or a bad tongue , or a pretty face , or a title , belonged without further claims . There were also [several houses of [women who affected intelligence or culture , having no claims to beauty or fashion]2349-women who affected intelligence or culture , having no claims to beauty or fashion]2348-several houses of women who affected intelligence or culture , having no claims to beauty or fashion ; and foremost among these , but differing from [them]2348-several houses of women who affected intelligence or culture , having no claims to beauty or fashion by the real originality and culture of [the lady of the house]2350-the lady of the house , the charm of [[her]2350-the lady of the house young daughter]2351-her young daughter , and the superior quality of the conversation and music to be enjoyed [there]593-there , was [the house of [a Signora Maria Pizzelli]359-a signora maria pizzelli]2353-the house of a signora maria pizzelli , of all women in [Rome]10-rome the one to whom , after [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany , [Alfieri]196-alfieri showed [himself]196-alfieri most assiduous . In [[her]2350-the lady of the house house]1717-her house and in many others [Alfieri]196-alfieri began to give almost public readings of [his]196-alfieri plays ; trying to persuade [himself]196-alfieri that [his]196-alfieri object in so doing was to judge , from the expression of face and even more from the restlessness or quiescence of [[his]196-alfieri listeners]2356-his listeners on [their]2356-his listeners chairs , how [his]196-alfieri work might affect the mixed audience of [a theatre]1132-a theatre ; but admitting in [his]196-alfieri heart of hearts that the old desire to be remarked had as much to do with these exhibitions as with the six - horse gallops which used to astonish [the people of [Turin]97-turin and [Florence]9-florence]2358-the people of turin and florence .

But something better soon offered itself . [The Duke Grimaldi]360-the duke grimaldi had had [a small theatre]2359-a small theatre constructed in [the Spanish palace]2360-the spanish palace , [his]360-the duke grimaldi residence as Ambassador from [the Catholic King]2361-the catholic king , and [a small company of [high - born amateurs]2363-high - born amateurs]2362-a small company of high - born amateurs had been playing in [it]2359-a small theatre translations of French comedies and tragedies . To [these ladies]2364-these ladies and [gentlemen Alfieri]2365-gentlemen alfieri offered [his]196-alfieri Antigone , which was accepted with fervour . [The beautiful and majestic Duchess of [Zagarolo]127-zagarolo]2366-the beautiful and majestic duchess of zagarolo was to act the part of [the heroine]2367-the heroine ; [[her]2366-the beautiful and majestic duchess of zagarolo brother and sister - in - law]2368-her brother and sister - in - law , [the Duke]2369-the duke and [Duchess of Ceri]2370-duchess of ceri , respectively the parts of [Hæmon]128-hæmon and of [Argia]129-argia , while the character of [Creon]361-creon , [the villain of the piece]2371-the villain of the piece , was reserved for [Alfieri]196-alfieri [himself]196-alfieri . The performance of Antigone was a great solemnity . [The magnificent rooms of [the Spanish Embassy]2373-the spanish embassy]2372-the magnificent rooms of the spanish embassy were crowded with the fashionable world of [Rome]10-rome , which , in the year 1782 , included [priests]1050-priests and [princes of [the Church]827-the church]2375-princes of the church quite as much as [painted ladies]2377-painted ladies and [powdered cavaliers]2378-powdered cavaliers . A contemporary diary , kept by the page of [the Princess Colonna]2379-the princess colonna , [a certain Abate Benedetti]2380-a certain abate benedetti , enables [us]2381-us to form some notion of the assembly . Foremost among [the ladies]3927-the ladies were [the two rival beauties , equally famous for [their]2383-the two rival beauties , equally famous for their conquests in the ecclesiastical as well as the secular nobility conquests in the ecclesiastical as well as [the secular nobility]2384-the secular nobility]2383-the two rival beauties , equally famous for their conquests in the ecclesiastical as well as the secular nobility , [the Princess Santacroce]2385-the princess santacroce and [the Princess Altieri]2386-the princess altieri , vying with [each other]2262-each other in the magnificence of [their]2383-the two rival beauties , equally famous for their conquests in the ecclesiastical as well as the secular nobility diamonds and of [their]2383-the two rival beauties , equally famous for their conquests in the ecclesiastical as well as the secular nobility lace , and each upon the arm of [a prince of [the Church]827-the church who had the honour of being [[her]2386-the princess altieri orthodox cavaliere servente]2390-her orthodox cavaliere servente]2388-a prince of the church who had the honour of being her orthodox cavaliere servente ; [the Princess Altieri]362-the princess altieri led in by [Cardinal Giovan Francesco Albani]363-cardinal giovan francesco albani , [the very gallant and art - loving nephew of [Winckelmann 's Cardinal Alessandro]275-winckelmann]2391-the very gallant and art - loving nephew of winckelmann 's cardinal alessandro ; [the Princess Santacroce]2385-the princess santacroce escorted by [the French Ambassador Cardinal de Bernis]364-the french ambassador cardinal de bernis , [the amiable society rhymester of [Mme . de Pompadour]365-mme , whom [Frederick the Great]366-frederick the great had surnamed Babet la bouquetière]2393-the amiable society rhymester of mme . de pompadour , whom frederick the great had surnamed babet la bouquetière . In [the front row]2394-the front row sat [the wife of [the Senator Rezzonico]367-the senator rezzonico , who , in virtue of being [the niece of [the late Pope Clement XIII]368-the late pope clement xiii .]2396-the niece of the late pope clement xiii .]2395-the wife of the senator rezzonico , who , in virtue of being the niece of the late pope clement xiii . , affected an almost royal pomp , and by [her]2395-the wife of the senator rezzonico , who , in virtue of being the niece of the late pope clement xiii . side sat [the wittiest and most literary of [the Sacred College]2398-the sacred college]2397-the wittiest and most literary of the sacred college , [the still very flirtatious old Cardinal Gerdil]2399-the still very flirtatious old cardinal gerdil . [The hall]2400-the hall was nearly full when the stir in [the crowd]2401-the crowd , and [the general looking in one direction]2402-the general looking in one direction , announced the arrival of [a guest who excited unwonted attention]2403-a guest who excited unwonted attention . [A young woman]2404-a young woman , who scarcely looked [her]2404-a young woman full age of thirty , small , slender , very simply and elegantly dressed , with something still girlish in [her]2404-a young woman small irregular features and complexion of northern brilliancy , was conducted along the gangway between the rows of chairs , and , as if [she]2404-a young woman were [the queen of the entertainment]2405-the queen of the entertainment , solemnly installed by the side of [the Princess Rezzonico]369-the princess rezzonico in [the first row]2406-the first row . Was it because [[her]2404-a young woman husband]790-her husband had called [himself]790-her husband [King of [England]13-england]648-king of england , or because [[her]2404-a young woman lover]2050-her lover was [the author of the play about to be performed]2410-the author of the play about to be performed ? Be it as it may , [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany was the object of universal curiosity , and the emotion which [she]527-the countess of albany displayed during the play was a second and perhaps more interesting performance for [the scandal - loving Romans]2412-the scandal - loving romans .

While the ghosts of [these long dead men]2413-these long dead men and [women]547-women , [ladies in voluminous brocaded skirts and diamond - covered bosoms]2415-ladies in voluminous brocaded skirts and diamond - covered bosoms , bursting out of the lace and jewels of [their]2415-ladies in voluminous brocaded skirts and diamond - covered bosoms stiff bodices , [cardinals in trailing scarlet robes]2416-cardinals in trailing scarlet robes and bishops with well - powdered hair contrasting curiously with [their]2416-cardinals in trailing scarlet robes Dominican or Franciscan dress , Roman nobles all in the strange old - world costumes , with ruffs and trunk hose and emblazoned mantles , of [[the Pope]650-the pope 's household and of [the military orders of [Malta]130-malta]2419-the military orders of malta and [Calatrava]131-calatrava]2418-the pope 's household and of the military orders of malta and calatrava , [secular dandies in elaborately - embroidered silk coats and waistcoats]2420-secular dandies in elaborately - embroidered silk coats and waistcoats , [ecclesiastical dandies]2421-ecclesiastical dandies to the full as dapper with [their]2421-ecclesiastical dandies heavy lace , and abundant fob jewels and inevitable two watches on the sober black of [their]2421-ecclesiastical dandies clothes ; - while these ghosts whom [we]2422-us have evoked in all [their]2421-ecclesiastical dandies finery long since gone to [the bric- -brac shops to fill [the theatre - hall of [the Spanish palace]2360-the spanish palace]2424-the theatre - hall of the spanish palace]2423-the bric- -brac shops to fill the theatre - hall of the spanish palace , sit and listen to the symphony which [Cimarosa]108-cimarosa [himself]108-cimarosa has written for Antigone , sit and watch [the magnificent Duchess of [Zagarolo]127-zagarolo]2426-the magnificent duchess of zagarolo , dressed as [Antigone in hoop and stomacher and piled - up feathered hair]2427-antigone in hoop and stomacher and piled - up feathered hair , and [the red - haired eccentric Piedmontese Count]2428-the red - haired eccentric piedmontese count , [[the d'Albany]2429-the d'albany 's lover]2430-the d'albany 's lover , bellowing the anger of [Creon]361-creon ; let [us]2422-us try and sum up what the tragedies of [Alfieri]196-alfieri are for [[us]2422-us people]2431-us people of to - day , and what [they]2432-they must have been for those people of a hundred years ago .

While scribbling for mere pastime at [his]196-alfieri earliest play , [Alfieri]196-alfieri had felt [his]196-alfieri mind illumined by a sort of double revelation : [he]196-alfieri would make [his]196-alfieri name immortal , and [he]196-alfieri would create a new kind of tragedy . These two halves of a proposition , of which [he]196-alfieri appears never to have entertained a single moment 's doubt , had originated at the same time and developed in close connection : that [he]196-alfieri could be otherwise than [an innovator]2433-an innovator was as inconceivable to [Alfieri]196-alfieri as that [he]196-alfieri could be otherwise than [a genius]2434-a genius , although , in reality , [he]196-alfieri was as far from being the one as from being the other . The fact was that [Alfieri]196-alfieri felt in [himself]196-alfieri the power of inventing a style and of producing works which should answer to the requirements of [his]196-alfieri own nature : considering [himself]196-alfieri as [the sole audience]2435-the sole audience , [he]196-alfieri considered [himself]196-alfieri as [the unique playwright]2436-the unique playwright . Excessively limited in [his]196-alfieri mental vision , and excessively strong in [his]196-alfieri mental muscle , it was with [his]196-alfieri works as with [his]196-alfieri life : the ideal was so comparatively within reach , and the will was so powerful , that one feels certain that [he]196-alfieri nearly always succeeded in behaving in the way of which [he]196-alfieri approved , and in writing in the style which [he]196-alfieri admired . And the most extraordinary part of the coincidence was , that as [he]196-alfieri happened to live in a time and country which had entirely neglected the tragic stage , and consequently had no habits or aspirations connected with it , [his]196-alfieri own desires with reference to Italian tragedy preceded those of [[his]196-alfieri fellow - countrymen]2437-his fellow - countrymen , [his]196-alfieri own ideal was thrust upon [them]2437-his fellow - countrymen before [they]2437-his fellow - countrymen well knew where [they]2437-his fellow - countrymen were ; and [his]196-alfieri own nature and likings became the sole standard by which [he]196-alfieri measured [his]196-alfieri works , [his]196-alfieri own satisfaction the only criterion by which they could be judged . In order , therefore , to understand the nature of [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's plays , it is necessary , first of all , to understand what were [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's innate likings and dislikings in the domain of the drama . Before all other things , [Alfieri]196-alfieri was not [a poet]1727-a poet : [he]196-alfieri lacked all , or very nearly all , the faculties which are really poetical . To begin with the more gross and external ones , [he]196-alfieri had no instinct for , no pleasure in , metrical arrangements for [their]2437-his fellow - countrymen own sake ; [he]196-alfieri did not think nor invent in verse , ideas did not come to [him]196-alfieri on the wave of metre ; [he]196-alfieri thought out , [he]196-alfieri elaborately finished , every sentence in prose , and then translated that prose into verse , as [he]196-alfieri might have translated and in some instances actually did translate from a French version into an Italian one . Moreover [he]196-alfieri was , to a degree which would have been surprising even in [a prose writer]2439-a prose writer , deficient in that which constitutes the intellectual essence of poetry as metre constitutes its material externality ; in that tendency to see things surrounded by , disguised in , a swarm , a masquerade , of associated ideas ; deficient in the power of suggesting images , of conceiving figures of speech ; in fancy , imagination , in the metaphorical faculty , or whatever else [we]2440-we may choose to call it . Nor did [he]196-alfieri perceive or describe visible things , visible effects , in their own unmetaphorical shapes and colours : not a line of description , not an adjective can be found in [his]196-alfieri works except such as may be absolutely indispensable for topographical or similar intelligibility ; [Alfieri]196-alfieri obviously cared as little for beautiful sights as for beautiful sound . This being the case , everything that [we]2440-we might call distinctly poetical , all those things which are precious to [us]2440-we in [Shakespeare]371-shakespeare , or [Marlowe]372-marlowe , or [Webster]373-webster , in Goethe or [Schiller]374-schiller , nay , even , occurring at intervals , in [Racine]375-racine [himself]375-racine , at least as much as mere psychology or oratory or pathos , appeared to [Alfieri]196-alfieri in the light of mere meretricious gewgaws , which took away from the interest of dramatic action without affording [him]196-alfieri any satisfaction in return . As it was with metre and metaphor and description , so it was also with the indefinable something which [we]2440-we call lyric quality : the something which sings to [our]2440-we soul , and which sends a thrill of delight through [our]2440-we nerves or a gust of emotion across [our]2440-we nature in the same direct way as do the notes of certain voices , the phrases of certain pieces of music : instantaneously , unreasoningly and unerringly . Of this [Alfieri]196-alfieri had little , so little that [we]2440-we may also say that [he]196-alfieri had nothing ; the presence of this quality being evidently unnoticed by [him]196-alfieri and unappreciated . So much for the absolutely poetical qualities . Of what [I]0-i may call the prose qualities of [a playwright]2441-a playwright , only a certain number appealed to [Alfieri]196-alfieri , and only a certain number were possessed by [him]196-alfieri . In a time when the novel was beginning to become a psychological study more minute than any stage play could ever be , [Alfieri]196-alfieri was only very moderately interested in the subtle analysis or representation of character and state of mind ; the fine touches which bring [home]1063-home [a person]2443-a person or a situation did not attract [his]196-alfieri attention ; nor was [he]196-alfieri troubled by considerations concerning the probability of a given word or words being spoken at a particular moment and by [a particular man]2444-a particular man or [woman]3888-woman : realism had no meaning for [him]196-alfieri . As it was with intellectual conception , so was it also with instructive sympathy : [Alfieri]196-alfieri never subtly analysed the anatomy of individual nature , nor did [he]196-alfieri unconsciously mimic its action and tones ; what most of [us]2440-we mean by pathos did not appeal to [him]196-alfieri . Neither metrical nor imaginative pleasurableness , nor descriptive charm , nor lyric poignancy , nor psychological analysis or intention entered , therefore , into [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's conception of a desirable tragedy , any more than any of these things fell within the range of [his]196-alfieri special talents ; for , [we]2440-we must always bear in mind that with [this man , whose feelings and desires were in such constant action and reaction]2446-this man , whose feelings and desires were in such constant action and reaction , with [this man whose will imposed [his]196-alfieri intellectual notions on [his]196-alfieri feelings]2447-this man whose will imposed his intellectual notions on his feelings , and [his]196-alfieri emotional tendencies on [his]196-alfieri thoughts , the thing which [he]196-alfieri enjoys is always as the concave to the convex of the thing which [he]196-alfieri produces . But although [Alfieri]196-alfieri was not [a poet]1727-a poet , and was not even [a potential novel writer]2449-a potential novel writer , [he]196-alfieri was , in a sense , essentially [a dramatist]2450-a dramatist ; though even here [we]2440-we must distinguish and diminish . [Alfieri]196-alfieri was not [a man who cared for rapid action or for intricate plot]2451-a man who cared for rapid action or for intricate plot : [he]196-alfieri never felt the smallest inclination to violate the old traditions of the pseudo - classic stage by those thrilling scenes or sights which had to be described and not shown , nor by those complications of interest which require years for an action instead of the orthodox twenty - four hours .

[He]196-alfieri was perfectly satisfied with the no - place , no - where - with [the vague temple]2452-the vague temple , or [palace hall]2453-palace hall , or [public square]2454-public square where , as in [the country of the abstract]2455-the country of the abstract , the action of pseudo - classic tragedy always takes place , or , more properly speaking , the talking of pseudo - classic tragedy always goes on ; [he]196-alfieri was perfectly satisfied with sending in [a servant]2456-a servant or [a messenger]2457-a messenger to inform [the public]2458-the public of a murder or suicide committed behind the scenes ; [he]196-alfieri was perfectly satisfied with taking up a story , so to speak , at the eleventh hour , without tracing it to its original causes or developing it through its various phases . In such matters [Alfieri]196-alfieri was as undramatic as [Corneille]376-corneille or [Racine]375-racine . Nevertheless [Alfieri]196-alfieri had a distinct dramatic sense : [an intense poseur [himself]196-alfieri , enjoying nothing so much as working [himself]196-alfieri up to produce a given effect upon [his]196-alfieri own mind or upon others]2459-an intense poseur himself , enjoying nothing so much as working himself up to produce a given effect upon his own mind or upon others , [he]196-alfieri had an extraordinary instinct for the theatrical , for the moral attitude which may be struck so as to be effective , and for the arrangement of subordinate parts so that this attitude surprise and move [the audience]2460-the audience .
