The moral attitude , the psychological gesture , which thus became the main interest of [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's plays , was , as might be expected from [such a man]1745-such a man , nearly always [his]196-alfieri own moral attitude , [his]196-alfieri own psychological gesture ; [he]196-alfieri [himself]196-alfieri , [his]196-alfieri uncompromising , unhesitating , unflinching , curt and emphatic nature , is always the hero or heroine of the play , however much the situation , the incidents , the other characteristics may vary . [Antigone]377-antigone is generous and tender , [Creon]361-creon is inhuman in all save paternal feeling , [Saul]378-saul is [a suspicious madman]2462-a suspicious madman , [Agamemnon]379-agamemnon [a just and confiding hero]2463-a just and confiding hero , [Clytæmnestra]380-clytæmnestra is sinful and self - sophisticating , Virginia pure and open - minded ; yet [all these different people]2464-all these different people , despite all [their]2464-all these different people differences , speak and act as [Alfieri]196-alfieri would speak and act , could [he]196-alfieri , without losing [his]196-alfieri peculiar characteristics , adopt for the moment vices or virtues which would become quite secondary matters by the side of [his]196-alfieri essential qualities of pride , narrowness , decision , violence , and self - importance . Whether [he]196-alfieri paint [his]196-alfieri face into a smile or a scowl , whether [he]196-alfieri put on the blond wig of innocence , or the black wig of villainy , [the man]2465-the man 's movement and gesture , the tone of [his]196-alfieri voice , the accent of [his]196-alfieri words , the length of [his]196-alfieri sentences , are always the same : so much so that in one play there may be two or three [Alfieris]381-alfieris , good and bad , [Alfieris]381-alfieris turned perfectly virtuous or perfectly vicious ; but anything that is not an [Alfieri]196-alfieri in some tolerably transparent disguise , is sure to be a puppet , [a lay figure with as few joints as possible]2466-a lay figure with as few joints as possible , just able to stretch out [its]2466-a lay figure with as few joints as possible arms and clap them to its sides , but dangling suspended between [heaven and earth]2467-heaven and earth .

The attitude and the gesture , which are the things for whose sake the play exists , are , as [I]0-i have said , the attitude and gesture of [Alfieri]196-alfieri . But the moral attitude and gesture of [Alfieri]196-alfieri happened to be just those which were rarest in the eighteenth century in [all countries]2468-all countries , and more especially rare in [Italy]3-italy ; and they were the moral attitude and gesture which the eighteenth century absolutely required to become the nineteenth , and which [the Italy of [Peter Leopold]315-peter leopold]132-the italy of peter leopold and [Pius VI]382-pius vi . and [Metastasio]383-metastasio and [Goldoni]384-goldoni absolutely required to become [the Italy of [Mazzini]385-mazzini and [Garibaldi]386-garibaldi]133-the italy of mazzini and garibaldi , [the Italy of [Foscolo]213-foscolo and [Leopardi]387-leopardi]134-the italy of foscolo and leopardi : they were the attitude and the gesture of single - mindedness , haughtiness , indifference to [one]1590-one 's own comfort and [[one]1590-one 's [neighbours]2472-neighbours]2471-one 's neighbours ' opinion , the attitude and gesture of manliness , of strength , if [you]2473-you will , of heroism . To have written tragedies whose whole value depended upon the striking exhibition of these qualities ; and to have made this exhibition interesting , nay , fascinating to [the very people]2474-the very people , to [the amiable , humane , indifferent , lying , [feeble - spirited Italians of the latter eighteenth century]2476-feeble - spirited italians of the latter eighteenth century]2475-the amiable , humane , indifferent , lying , feeble - spirited italians of the latter eighteenth century , till [these very men]2477-these very men were ashamed of what [they]2477-these very men had hitherto been ; to stamp [the new generation]2478-the new generation with the clear - cut die of [his]2478-the new generation own strong character ; this was the reality of the mission which [Alfieri]196-alfieri had felt within [himself]196-alfieri : a reality which will be remembered when [his]196-alfieri plays shall have long ceased to be acted , and shall long have ceased to be read . [Alfieri]196-alfieri imagined [himself]196-alfieri to be [a great poetic genius]2479-a great poetic genius , and [a great dramatic innovator]2480-a great dramatic innovator : [he]196-alfieri scorned with loathing the works of [Corneille]376-corneille , of [Racine]375-racine , and of [Voltaire]388-voltaire , all immeasurably more valuable as poetry and drama than [his]196-alfieri own ; [he]196-alfieri hated the works of [Metastasio]384-goldoni , [a poet]1727-a poet and [a playwright]2441-a playwright by the divine right of genius ; [he]196-alfieri refused to read [Shakespeare]371-shakespeare , lest [Shakespeare]371-shakespeare should spoil the perfection of [his]196-alfieri own conceptions . [He]196-alfieri slaved for months and years perfecting each of [his]196-alfieri plays , recasting the action and curtailing the dialogue and polishing the verse ; yet the action was always heavy , the dialogue unnatural to the last degree , the verse unpoetical . But all this extraordinary self - sufficiency was not a delusion , all this extraordinary labour was not a waste : [Alfieri]196-alfieri , who never [had a single poetical thought , nor a single art - revolutionising notion]2483-had a single poetical thought , nor a single art - revolutionising notion , was yet [a great genius and a great innovator]2484-a great genius and a great innovator , inasmuch as [he]196-alfieri first moulded in [his]196-alfieri own image [the Italian patriot of the nineteenth century]2485-the italian patriot of the nineteenth century . [His]196-alfieri use consisted in [his]196-alfieri mere existence among men so different from [himself]196-alfieri ; and [his]196-alfieri dramas , [his]196-alfieri elaborately constructed and curtailed and corrected dramas , were , so to speak , a system of mirrors by which the image of this strange new - fangled personality might be flashed everywhere into the souls of [[his]196-alfieri contemporaries]2486-his contemporaries . To perceive the moral attitude and gesture specially characteristic of [himself]196-alfieri , to artificially correct and improve and isolate them in [his]196-alfieri own reality , and then to multiply [their]2487-their likeness for all [the world]573-the world ; to know [himself]196-alfieri to be [Alfieri]196-alfieri , to make [himself]196-alfieri up as [Alfieri]196-alfieri , and to write plays whereof [the heroes and heroines]2489-the heroes and heroines were mere repetitions of [Alfieri]196-alfieri ; such was the mission of this powerful and spontaneous nature , of [this self - conscious and self - manipulating poseur]2490-this self - conscious and self - manipulating poseur .

The success of that performance of Antigone on the amateur stage in [the Spanish palace]2360-the spanish palace was very great . [A young man]1600-a young man , half lay , half ecclesiastic , [a dubious sort of poet]2493-a dubious sort of poet , [secretary]2494-secretary , [factotum]2495-factotum , accustomed to write not the most sincere poetry , and to execute , perhaps , not the most creditable errands , of [[the Pope]650-the pope 's dubious nephew]2497-the pope 's dubious nephew , [Duke Braschi]389-duke braschi - [a young man named [Vincenzo Monti]390-vincenzo monti]2498-a young man named vincenzo monti , was present at this performance , or one of the succeeding ones ; and from that moment became [the author of the revolutionary tragedy of [Aristodemo]391-aristodemo]2499-the author of the revolutionary tragedy of aristodemo , [the potential author of that famous ode on the battle of Marengo]2500-the potential author of that famous ode on the battle of marengo , one of [the forerunners of [new Italy]2502-new italy]2501-the forerunners of new italy . Nay , even when , some few months later , there died at [Vienna]39-vienna [the old Abate Metastasio]383-metastasio , and [his]383-metastasio death brought [home]1063-home to a rather forgetful world what [a poet]1727-a poet and what [a dramatist]2450-a dramatist that [old Metastasio]383-metastasio had been ; even then , [an intimate friend of [the dead man]2507-the dead man]2506-an intimate friend of the dead man , [a worldly priest]2508-a worldly priest , [a quasi prelate]2509-a quasi prelate , [the Abate Taruffi]392-the abate taruffi , could find no better winding up for the funeral oration , delivered before all [the pedants and prigs]2510-the pedants and prigs and fops and spies of pontifical [Rome]10-rome assembled in [the rooms of [the Arcadian academy]2512-the arcadian academy]2511-the rooms of the arcadian academy , than to point to [Count Vittorio Alfieri]196-alfieri , and prophesy that [Metastasio]383-metastasio had found [a successor greater than [himself]383-metastasio]2513-a successor greater than himself .

CHAPTER XI .

SEPARATION .

[Alfieri]196-alfieri and [the Countess]1995-the countess were happy , happier , perhaps , than at any other time of [their]2515-their lives ; but this happiness had to be paid for . The false position in which , however faultlessly , [they]2515-their were placed ; the illegitimate affection in which , however blamelessly , [they]2515-their were indulging ; these things , offensive to social institutions , although in no manner wrong in [themselves]2515-their , had produced [their]2515-their fruit of humiliation , nay , of degradation . Fate is more of a Conservative than [we]2516-we are apt to think ; it resents the efforts of [any individual]2517-any individual , be [he]2517-any individual as blameless as possible , to resist for [his]2517-any individual own comfort and satisfaction the uncomfortable and unsatisfactory arrangements of [the world]573-the world ; it punishes [the man who seeks to elude an unjust law by condemning [him]2517-any individual to the same moral police dep"t , to the same moral prison - food , as [the villain who has eluded the holiest law that was ever framed]3938-the villain who has eluded the holiest law that was ever framed ; and [Fate]393-fate , therefore , soiled the poetic passion of [Alfieri]196-alfieri and [[his]196-alfieri lady]1719-his lady]3937-the man who seeks to elude an unjust law by condemning him to the same moral police dep"t , to the same moral prison - food , as the villain who has eluded the holiest law that was ever framed ; and fate , therefore , soiled the poetic passion of alfieri and his lady by forcing it to the base practices of any illicit love . The manner in which [Fate]393-fate executes these summary lynchings of [people]927-people 's honour could not usually be more ingenious ; there seems to be a special arrangement by which [offenders]3941-offenders are punished in [their]3941-offenders most sensitive part . The punishment of [Alfieri]196-alfieri and of [Mme .]365-mme d'Albany for refusing to sacrifice [their]2515-their happiness to the proprieties of a society which married [girls of nineteen]3942-girls of nineteen to [drunkards whom [they]2515-their had never seen , but which would not hear of divorce]3943-drunkards whom they had never seen , but which would not hear of divorce ; this punishment , falling directly only upon [the man]2465-the man , but probably just as heavy upon [the woman who witnessed the humiliation of [the person whom [she]527-the countess of albany most loved and respected]3946-the person whom she most loved and respected]3945-the woman who witnessed the humiliation of the person whom she most loved and respected , consisted in turning [Alfieri]196-alfieri , [the man who was training [Italy]3-italy to be self - respecting , truthful , unflinching , into [a toady]3948-a toady , [a liar]3949-a liar , and [an intriguer]3950-an intriguer]3947-the man who was training italy to be self - respecting , truthful , unflinching , into a toady , a liar , and an intriguer .[527-the countess of albany]

[The Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany , living in [the palace of [[her]527-the countess of albany brother - in - law]694-her brother - in - law]2520-the palace of her brother - in - law , [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york , and under the special protection of [the Pope]650-the pope , was entirely dependent on the good pleasure of [the priestly bureaucracy of [the Rome of [Pius VI]382-pius vi]135-the rome of pius vi]2523-the priestly bureaucracy of the rome of pius vi . , that is to say , of about the most contemptible and vilest set of [fools]2524-fools and hypocrites and [sinners that can well be conceived]2525-sinners that can well be conceived ; [the Papacy]136-the papacy , just before the Revolution , had become [one of the most corrupt of the many corrupt Governments of the day]2526-one of the most corrupt of the many corrupt governments of the day . [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york [himself]265-cardinal york was [a weak and silly , but honest and kind - hearted man]2527-a weak and silly , but honest and kind - hearted man ; but [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york was entirely swayed by [the prelates]2528-the prelates and [priests]1050-priests and [priestlets]2530-priestlets and [semi - priestly semi - lay nondescripts among whom [he]265-cardinal york lived]2531-semi - priestly semi - lay nondescripts among whom he lived . [He]265-cardinal york was responsible for the honour of [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany , that is to say , of [[her]527-the countess of albany husband]790-her husband and [[his]790-her husband brother]804-his brother ; and the honour of [the Countess of]2535-the countess of [Albany]196-alfieri depended exactly upon the remarks which [the most depraved and hypocritical clergy in [Europe]137-europe]2536-the most depraved and hypocritical clergy in europe , [the people who did or abetted all the dirty work of [Pius VI]382-pius vi . and [his]382-pius vi Sacred College]2537-the people who did or abetted all the dirty work of pius vi . and his sacred college , chose to make or not to make about [her]527-the countess of albany conduct .

Such were [the persons upon whom depended]2538-the persons upon whom depended the liberty and happiness of [[Alfieri]196-alfieri 's lady]2539-alfieri 's lady , the possibility of that high - flown Platonic intercourse which constituted [Louis d'Albany]283-louis xvi 's whole happiness , and [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's strongest incentive to glory ; a word from [them]2540-them could exile [Alfieri]196-alfieri and lock [the Countess]1995-the countess up in [a convent]594-a convent . The consequence of this state of things is humiliating to relate , since it shows to what baseness [the most high - minded among [us]2544-us]2543-the most high - minded among us may be forced to degrade [themselves]2543-the most high - minded among us . Already , during those few days ' sojourn in [Rome]10-rome , before [his]196-alfieri stay in [Naples]67-naples and [Mme]365-mme . d'Albany 's release from [the Ursuline convent]2230-the ursuline convent , [Alfieri]196-alfieri had spent [his]196-alfieri time running about flattering and wheedling the powers in command that is to say , [the corrupt ministers of [the Papacy]2547-the papacy]2546-the corrupt ministers of the papacy and [[their]2546-the corrupt ministers of the papacy retinue of [minions and spies]2549-minions and spies]2548-their retinue of minions and spies , in order to obtain leave to inhabit [the same city]530-the same city as [[his]196-alfieri beloved]2127-his beloved and to see [her]2127-his beloved from time to time ; doing everything , and stooping to everything , [he]196-alfieri tells [us]2544-us , in order to be tolerated by [those priests]2552-those priests and [priestlets whom [he]196-alfieri abhorred and despised from the bottom of [his]196-alfieri heart]2553-priestlets whom he abhorred and despised from the bottom of his heart . " After so many frenzies , and efforts to make [myself]196-alfieri [a free man]3951-a free man , "[196-alfieri] [he]196-alfieri writes , in [his]196-alfieri autobiography , " [I]196-alfieri found [myself]196-alfieri suddenly transformed into [a man paying calls , and making bows and fine speeches]3952-a man paying calls , and making bows and fine speeches in [Rome]10-rome , exactly like [a candidate on promotion in prelatedom]3953-a candidate on promotion in prelatedom . "[196-alfieri] At this price of bitter humiliation , nay , of something more real than mere humiliation , [Alfieri]196-alfieri bought the privilege of frequenting [the palace of [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york]2554-the palace of cardinal york . But it was a privilege for which [you]2555-you could not pay once and for all ; its price was a black - mail of humbugging , and wheedling , and dirt - eating .

[Alfieri]196-alfieri hated and despised [all sovereigns]2556-all sovereigns and [all priests]2557-all priests ; and if there were [a sovereign]664-a sovereign and [a priest whom [he]196-alfieri despised and hated more than [the rest]2560-the rest]2559-a priest whom he despised and hated more than the rest , it was the then reigning [Pius VI]382-pius vi . , [a vain , avaricious , weak - minded man , stickling not in the least at humiliating Catholicism before anyone who asked [him]196-alfieri to do it , by no means clean - handed in [his]196-alfieri efforts to enrich [[his]196-alfieri family]933-his family , without courage , or fidelity to [his]196-alfieri promise]2561-a vain , avaricious , weak - minded man , stickling not in the least at humiliating catholicism before anyone who asked him to do it , by no means clean - handed in his efforts to enrich his family , without courage , or fidelity to his promise ; [a man whose miserable end as [the brutally - treated captive of [the French Republic]2565-the french republic]2564-the brutally - treated captive of the french republic has not been sufficient to raise to the dignity of [a martyr]2566-a martyr]2563-a man whose miserable end as the brutally - treated captive of the french republic has not been sufficient to raise to the dignity of a martyr . Of this [Pope Pius VI]382-pius vi . did [Alfieri]196-alfieri crave an audience , and to [him]196-alfieri did [he]196-alfieri offer the dedication of one of [his]196-alfieri plays ; nay , [the man who had sacrificed [his]196-alfieri fortune in order to free [himself]196-alfieri from the comparatively clean - handed despotism of [Sardinia]107-sardinia , who had stubbornly refused to be presented to [Frederick the Great and Catherine II]366-frederick the great . , who had declined making [Metastasio]383-metastasio 's acquaintance]2567-the man who had sacrificed his fortune in order to free himself from the comparatively clean - handed despotism of sardinia , who had stubbornly refused to be presented to frederick the great and catherine ii . , who had declined making metastasio 's acquaintance on account of a too deferential bow which [he]196-alfieri had seen [the old poet]2568-the old poet make to [Maria Theresa]227-maria theresa ; [the man who had in [his]196-alfieri portfolios plays and sonnets and essays intended to teach [the world]573-the world contempt for [kings]675-kings and [priests]1050-priests]2569-the man who had in his portfolios plays and sonnets and essays intended to teach the world contempt for kings and priests , [this man]2278-this man , [this Alfieri]2574-this alfieri , submitted to having [his]2574-this alfieri cheek patted by [Pope Braschi]395-pope braschi . This stain of baseness and hypocrisy with which , as [he]2574-this alfieri says , [he]2574-this alfieri contaminated [himself]2574-this alfieri , ate like a hidden and shameful sore into [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's soul ; yet , until the moment of writing [his]196-alfieri autobiography , [he]196-alfieri had not the courage to display this galling thing of the past even to [[his]196-alfieri most intimate friends]2575-his most intimate friends . To [Louise d'Albany]233-louise , to [the woman between whom and [himself]196-alfieri]2576-the woman between whom and himself [he]196-alfieri boasted that there was never the slightest reticence or deceit , [he]196-alfieri screwed up the force to tell the tale of that interview only some time later . [Alfieri]196-alfieri , honest enough to lay bare [his]196-alfieri own self - degradation , was not generous enough to hide the fact that this self - degradation was incurred out of love for [her]233-louise . That [[her]233-louise hero]2577-her hero should have stooped so low , so low that [he]196-alfieri scarcely dared to tell even [her]233-louise , surely this must have been as galling to [the Countess of Albany]196-alfieri as was the caress of [Pius VI]382-pius vi . to [Alfieri]196-alfieri [himself]196-alfieri ; this high poetic love of [theirs]2578-theirs , this exotic Dantesque passion , had been dragged down , by the impartial legality of fate , to the humiliating punishment which awaited all the basest love intrigues in [this base Rome]2579-this base rome of the base eighteenth century .

And , after some time , the stock of toleration bought at the price of this baseness was exhausted . [The clerical friends and advisers of [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york , who had hitherto assured [the foolish prince of the Church]2581-the foolish prince of the church that [he]196-alfieri was acting for the honour of [[his]196-alfieri brother]804-his brother and [[his]196-alfieri brother]804-his brother 's wife]2580-the clerical friends and advisers of cardinal york , who had hitherto assured the foolish prince of the church that he was acting for the honour of his brother and his brother 's wife in leaving [a young woman of thirty - one]2584-a young woman of thirty - one to the sole care of [a young poet of thirty - four]2585-a young poet of thirty - four , each being well known to be over head and ears in love with [the other]2586-the other ; [these prudent ecclesiastics]2587-these prudent ecclesiastics , little by little , began to change [their]2578-theirs minds , and the success of [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's plays , the general interest in [him]196-alfieri and [[his]196-alfieri lady]1719-his lady which that success produced , suggested to [them]2578-theirs that there really might be some impropriety in the familiarity between [the wife of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward]1967-the wife of charles edward and [the author of Antigone]2590-the author of antigone . The train was laid , and the match was soon applied . In April 1783 [the Pretender]605-the pretender fell ill in [Florence]9-florence , so ill that [[his]196-alfieri brother]804-his brother was summoned at once to what seemed [his]196-alfieri death - bed . [Charles Edward]204-charles edward recovered . But during that illness [the offended husband , who , [we]2594-we must remember , had offered a reward for [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's murder , poured out to [[his]196-alfieri brother]804-his brother , moved and reconciled to [him]804-his brother by the recent fear of [his]196-alfieri death , all [his]804-his brother grievances against [the Tuscan Court]1481-the tuscan court , against [[his]196-alfieri wife]908-his wife , and against [[her]908-his wife lover]2050-her lover]2593-the offended husband , who , we must remember , had offered a reward for alfieri 's murder , poured out to his brother , moved and reconciled to him by the recent fear of his death , all his grievances against the tuscan court , against his wife , and against her lover . A letter of [Sir Horace Mann]207-sir horace mann makes it clear that [Charles Edward]204-charles edward persuaded [[his]204-charles edward brother]804-his brother that [his]204-charles edward ill - usage of [[his]204-charles edward wife]908-his wife which , however , [Mann]207-sir horace mann , with [[his]207-sir horace mann spies]2601-his spies everywhere , had vouched for at the time was a mere invention , and part of an odious plot by which [Alfieri]196-alfieri had imposed upon [the Grand Duke]1459-the grand duke , [the Pope]650-the pope , [the society of [Florence]9-florence and [Rome]10-rome]2604-the society of florence and rome , nay , upon [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york [himself]265-cardinal york , in order to obtain [their]2605-their connivance in a shameful intrigue development . [The Cardinal]948-the cardinal returned to [Rome]10-rome in a state of indignation proportionate to [his]948-the cardinal previous saintly indifference to the doings of [Alfieri]196-alfieri and [Mme]365-mme . d'Albany ; [he]948-the cardinal discovered that [he]948-the cardinal had been shutting [his]948-the cardinal eyes to what all [the world]573-the world by [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's own confession saw as a very hazardous state of things ; and , with the tendency to run into extremes of [a foolish and weak - minded creature]2608-a foolish and weak - minded creature , [he]948-the cardinal immediately published from all the housetops the dishonour whose existence had never occurred to [him]948-the cardinal before . To [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany [he]948-the cardinal intimated that [he]948-the cardinal would not permit [her]527-the countess of albany to receive [Alfieri]196-alfieri under [his]948-the cardinal roof ; and of [the Pope the Pope who had so recently patted [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's cheek]2610-the pope the pope who had so recently patted alfieri 's cheek [he]2610-the pope the pope who had so recently patted alfieri 's cheek immediately implored an order that [Alfieri]196-alfieri should quit the Papal States within a fortnight . The order was given ; but [Alfieri]196-alfieri , in whose truthfulness [I]0-i have complete faith , says that , knowing that the order had been asked for , [he]196-alfieri forestalled the ignominy of being banished by spontaneously bidding farewell to [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany and to [Rome]10-rome .

" This event , "[196-alfieri] says [Alfieri]196-alfieri , " upset [my]196-alfieri brains for nearly two years ; and upset and retarded also [my]196-alfieri work in every way . "[196-alfieri] In speaking of [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's youth [I]0-i have already had occasion to remark that there was in [this man]2278-this man 's character something abnormal ; [he]196-alfieri was , as [I]0-i have said , [a moral invalid from birth]2613-a moral invalid from birth ; [his]196-alfieri very energy and resolution had somewhat of the frenzy and rigidity of a nervous disease , and though [he]196-alfieri would seem morally stronger than [other men]1642-other men when strictly following [his]196-alfieri self - prescribed rule of excessive intellectual exercise , and when surrounded by a soothing atmosphere of affection and encouragement , [his]196-alfieri old malady of melancholy and rage melancholy and rage whom [he]196-alfieri represents in one of [his]196-alfieri sonnets as [two horrible - faced women]2615-two horrible - faced women seated on either side of [him]196-alfieri , [his]196-alfieri old incapacity for work , for interest in anything , [his]196-alfieri old feverish restlessness of place , returned , as a fever returns with its heat and cold and impotence and delirium , whenever [he]196-alfieri was shut out of this atmosphere of happiness , whenever [he]196-alfieri was exposed to any sort of moral hardship . On leaving [Rome]10-rome [Alfieri]196-alfieri went to [Siena]6-siena , where , years before , when [he]196-alfieri had come light - hearted and bent only upon literary fame , to learn [Tuscan]138-tuscan , [he]196-alfieri had been introduced into [a little circle of [men]711-men and women whom [he]196-alfieri faithfully loved , and to that [Francesco Gori]325-gori who shared with [Tommaso di Caluso]332-tommaso di caluso the rather trying honour of being [[his]196-alfieri bosom friend]2618-his bosom friend]2616-a little circle of men and women whom he faithfully loved , and to that francesco gori who shared with tommaso di caluso the rather trying honour of being his bosom friend . This [Gori]325-gori , " [an incomparable man]3954-an incomparable man , "[196-alfieri] writes [Alfieri]196-alfieri , " good , compassionate , and with all [his]196-alfieri austerity and ruggedness of virtue con tanta altezza e ferocia di sensi most gentle , "[196-alfieri] appears literally to have nursed [Alfieri]196-alfieri in this period of moral sickness as one might nurse [a sick or badly - bruised child]2619-a sick or badly - bruised child . " Without [him]196-alfieri , "[196-alfieri] writes [Alfieri]196-alfieri , " [I]196-alfieri think [I]196-alfieri should most likely have gone mad . But [he]196-alfieri , although [he]196-alfieri saw in [me]196-alfieri [a would - be hero]3955-a would - be hero so disgracefully broken in spirit and inferior to [himself]196-alfieri "[196-alfieri] this passage is characteristic , as showing that [Alfieri]196-alfieri considered [himself]196-alfieri , when in a normal condition , far superior to [[his]196-alfieri much - praised [Gori]325-gori]2620-his much - praised gori , " although [he]196-alfieri knew better than any the meaning of courage and endurance , did not , therefore , cruelly and inopportunely , oppose [his]196-alfieri severe and frozen reason to [my]196-alfieri frenzies , but , on the contrary , diminished [my]196-alfieri pain by dividing it with [me]196-alfieri . O rare , O truly heavenly gift , this of being able both to reason and to feel . "[196-alfieri]

Weeping and raving , [Alfieri]196-alfieri was living once more upon letters received and sent as during [his]196-alfieri previous separation from [Mme]365-mme . d'Albany ; and of all these love - letters , none appear to have come down to [us]2621-us . Carefully preserved by [Mme]365-mme . d'Albany and by [[her]365-mme heir]2622-her heir [Fabre]256-fabre , they fell into the hands of [a Mr. Gache of [Montpellier]5-montpellier , who assumed the grave responsibility of destroying [them]2624-them and of thus suppressing for ever the most important evidence in the law - suit which posterity will for ever be bringing against [Alfieri]196-alfieri and [Mme]365-mme . d'Albany in favour of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward , or against [Charles Edward]204-charles edward in favour of [Alfieri]196-alfieri and [Mme]365-mme . d'Albany]2623-a mr. gache of montpellier , who assumed the grave responsibility of destroying them and of thus suppressing for ever the most important evidence in the law - suit which posterity will for ever be bringing against alfieri and mme . d'albany in favour of charles edward , or against charles edward in favour of alfieri and mme . d'albany . But some weeks ago , among the pile of [the Countess]196-alfieri 's letters to [Sienese friends]521-sienese friends preserved by [Cavaliere Guiseppe Porri]218-cavaliere guiseppe porri at [Siena]6-siena , [I]0-i had the good fortune to discover what are virtually five love - letters of [hers]196-alfieri , obviously intended for [Alfieri]196-alfieri although addressed to [[his]196-alfieri friend]1173-his friend [Francesco Gori]325-gori . [I]0-i confess that an eerie feeling came over [me]0-i as [I]0-i unfolded these five closely - written , unsigned and undated little squares of yellow paper , things intended so exclusively for the mere moment of writing and reading , all that long - dead momentary passion of [a long - dead man]2627-a long - dead man and [woman]3888-woman quivering back into reality , filling , as an assembly of ghosts might fill [a house]1439-a house , and drive out [[its]1439-a house living occupants]2630-its living occupants , this present hour which so soon will itself have become , with all its passions and worries , a part of the past , of the indifferent , the passionless . One is frightened on suddenly being admitted to witness , unperceived , as by the opening of a long - locked door , or by some spell said over a crystal globe or a beryl - stone , such passion as this ; [one]1590-one feels as if [one]1590-one would almost rather not . These five letters , as [I]0-i have said , are addressed to a " [Dear Signor Francesco]396-dear signor francesco , [friend of [[my]0-i friend]516-my friend]3956-friend of my friend , "[0-i] and who , of course , is [Francesco Gori]325-gori ; and are written , which no other letters of [Mme]365-mme . d'Albany 's are , not in French , but in tolerably idiomatic though far from correct Italian . Only one of them has any indication of place or date , " [Genzano]397-genzano , [Mardi]398-mardi "[325-gori] ; but this , and the references to [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's approaching journey northward and to [Gori]325-gori 's intention of escorting [him]196-alfieri as far as [Genoa]139-genoa , is sufficient to show that they must have been written in the summer of 1783 , when [Cardinal York]265-cardinal york , terrified at the liberty which [he]265-cardinal york had allowed to [[his]265-cardinal york sister - in - law]2070-his sister - in - law , had conveyed [her]2070-his sister - in - law safely to [some villa in [the Alban Hills]140-the alban hills]2634-some villa in the alban hills . [The woman who wrote these letters]2635-the woman who wrote these letters is a strangely different being from [the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany whom [we]2637-we know from all [her]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany other innumerable manuscript letters , from the published answers of [Sismondi]399-sismondi , of [Foscolo]213-foscolo and of [Mme . de Souza]426-mme to letters of [hers]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany which have disappeared . The hysterical frenzy of [Alfieri]196-alfieri seems to have entered into [this woman]1716-this woman ; [he]196-alfieri has worked up this naturally placid but malleable soul , [this woman in bad health , deprived of [all friends]2640-all friends]2639-this woman in bad health , deprived of all friends , jealously guarded by [enemies]1662-enemies , weak and depressed , until [she]1716-this woman has become another [himself]196-alfieri , " weeping , raving , "[196-alfieri] like [himself]196-alfieri , but unable to relieve , perhaps to enjoy , all this frantic grief by running about like [the mad Orlando]2642-the mad orlando , or talking and weeping by the hour to [a compassionate Gori]2643-a compassionate gori .

" [Dear Signor Francesco]396-dear signor francesco , "[2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany] [she]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany writes ; " how grateful [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany am to [you]396-dear signor francesco for [your]396-dear signor francesco compassion . [You]396-dear signor francesco ca n't have a notion of [our]3958-our unhappiness . [My]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany misery is not in the least less than that of [[our]3958-our friend]3959-our friend . There are moments when [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany feel [my]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany heart torn to pieces thinking of all that [he]3959-our friend must suffer . [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany have no consolation except [your]396-dear signor francesco being with [him]3959-our friend , and that is something . Never let [him]3959-our friend remain alone . [He]3959-our friend is worse , and [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany know that [he]3959-our friend greatly enjoys [your]396-dear signor francesco society , for [you]396-dear signor francesco are [the only person who does not bore [him]3959-our friend and whom [he]3959-our friend always meets with pleasure]3960-the only person who does not bore him and whom he always meets with pleasure . Oh ! dear [Signor Francesco]396-dear signor francesco , in what a sea of miseries are [we]3958-our not ! [You]396-dear signor francesco also , because [our]3958-our miseries are certainly also [yours]396-dear signor francesco . [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany no longer live ; and if it were not for [[my]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany friend]516-my friend , for whom [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany am keeping [myself]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany , [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany would not drag out this miserable life . What do [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany do in [this world]962-this world ? [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany am a useless creature in it ; and why should [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany suffer when it is of no use to [anyone]1386-anyone ? But [[my]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany friend]516-my friend - [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany can not make up [my]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany mind to leave [him]516-my friend , and [he]516-my friend must live for [his]516-my friend own glory ; and , as long as [he]516-my friend lives , even if [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany had to walk on [my]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany hands , [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany would suffer and live . Who knows what will happen , it is so long since [the man in [Florence]9-florence [Charles Edward]204-charles edward]3965-the man in florence charles edward is ill , and still [he]3965-the man in florence charles edward lives , and it seems to [me]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany that [he]3965-the man in florence charles edward is made of iron in order that [we]3966-we may all die . [You]3967-you will say , in order to console [me]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany , that [he]3965-the man in florence charles edward ca n't last ; but [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany see things clearly . This illness has not made [him]3965-the man in florence charles edward younger , but [he]3965-the man in florence charles edward may live another couple of years . [He]3965-the man in florence charles edward may at any moment be suffocated by the humours which have risen to [his]3965-the man in florence charles edward chest . What a cruel thing to expect [one]1590-one 's happiness from the death of [another]3969-another ! O God ! how it degrades [one]1590-one 's soul ! And yet [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany can not refrain from wishing it . What a thing , what a horrible thing is life ; and for [me]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany it has been a continual suffering , all except the two years that [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany spent with [[my]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany friend]516-my friend , and even then [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany lived in the midst of tears . And [you]3967-you also are probably not happy ; with a heart like [yours]3967-you it is not possible that [you]3967-you should be . [Whoever is born with any feeling]3972-whoever is born with any feeling can scarcely enjoy happiness . [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany recommend [[our]3973-our friend]3959-our friend to [your]3967-you care , particularly [his]3965-the man in florence charles edward health . [Mine]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany is not so bad ; [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany take care of [myself]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany and stay much in bed to kill the time and to rest [my]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany nerves , which are very weak . Good - bye , dear [Signor Francesco]396-dear signor francesco , preserve [your]396-dear signor francesco friendship for [me]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany ; [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany deserve it , since [I]2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany appreciate [you]396-dear signor francesco . "[2636-the quiet jog - trot , rather cynically philosophical countess of albany]

Later on [she]2644-i writes again : -

" [Dear Signor Francesco]396-dear signor francesco , [friend of ours]3975-friend of ours . [I]2644-i do all [I]2644-i can to take courage . [I]2644-i study as much as [I]2644-i can . Music alone distracts [my]2644-i thoughts , or rather deadens them , and [I]2644-i play the harp many hours a day , and [I]2644-i do so also because [I]2644-i know that [[my]2644-i friend]516-my friend wishes [me]2644-i to get to play it well . [I]2644-i work at it as hard as [I]2644-i can . [I]2644-i live only for [him]516-my friend ; without [him]516-my friend life would be odious to [me]2644-i , and [I]2644-i could not endure it . [I]2644-i do nothing in [this world]962-this world ; [I]2644-i am useless in it ; and where is the use of suffering for nothing ? But there is [[my]2644-i friend]516-my friend , and [I]2644-i must remain on [this earth]3979-this earth . [I]2644-i do not doubt of [him]516-my friend ; [I]2644-i know how much [he]516-my friend loves [me]2644-i . But in moments of suffering [I]2644-i have fears lest [he]516-my friend should find someone who would give [him]516-my friend less pain than [myself]2644-i , with whom [he]516-my friend might live cheerful and happy . [I]2644-i ought to wish it , but [I]2644-i have not got the strength to do so . But [I]2644-i believe so fully in [him]516-my friend that [I]2644-i am satisfied as soon as [he]516-my friend tells [me]2644-i that such a thing can not happen . [I]2644-i love [him]516-my friend more than [myself]2644-i ; it is a union of feeling which [we]3980-we only can understand . [I]2644-i find in [him]516-my friend all that [I]2644-i can desire ; [he]516-my friend is everything for [me]2644-i ; and yet [I]2644-i must suffer separation from [him]516-my friend . Certainly if [I]2644-i could come to a violent decision [I]2644-i should be [the happiest woman in [the world]573-the world]3981-the happiest woman in the world ; [I]2644-i should never think of the past ; [I]2644-i should live in [him]516-my friend and for [him]516-my friend ; for [I]2644-i care for nothing in [this world]962-this world . Comfort , luxury , position , all is vanity for [me]2644-i ; peace by [his]516-my friend side would suffice for [me]2644-i . And yet [I]2644-i am condemned to languish far from [him]516-my friend . What a horrible life ! "[2644-i]

Again [she]2645-i writes to [Gori]325-gori : -

" [Dear friend]3984-dear friend , [I]2645-i am so very , very grateful for the interest [you]3984-dear friend take in [my]2645-i unhappy situation , which is really terrible . Time serves only to aggravate it , and certainly it will bring no alleviation to [my]2645-i misery until [I]2645-i shall meet [[our]3985-our friend]3959-our friend . There is no peace , no tranquillity for [me]2645-i . [I]2645-i would give whatever of life may remain to [me]2645-i in order to live for one day with [him]516-my friend , and [I]2645-i should be satisfied . [My]2645-i feelings for [him]516-my friend are unchangeable , and [I]2645-i am sure that [his]516-my friend for [me]2645-i are the same . When shall [I]2645-i see the end of [my]2645-i woes ? Who knows whether [I]2645-i shall ever see it ? [That man [Charles Edward]204-charles edward]3987-that man charles edward does not seem inclined to depart ... [I]2645-i suffer a little from [my]2645-i nerves ... but those are the least of [my]2645-i sufferings . It is the heart which suffers . [I]2645-i have moments of despair when [I]2645-i could throw [myself]2645-i out of the window were it not for the thought that [I]2645-i must live for [[my]2645-i friend]516-my friend 's sake ; that [my]2645-i life is [his]516-my friend . [I]2645-i feel a disgust for life which is so reasoned out that [I]2645-i say to [myself]2645-i sometimes , ' Why do [I]2645-i live ? What good do [I]2645-i do ? ' and then [I]2645-i continue to suffer patiently , remembering [[my]2645-i friend]516-my friend . Forgive [me]2645-i for unbosoming [myself]2645-i with [you]516-my friend , who alone can understand [me]2645-i ; [you]516-my friend alone , except [[my]2645-i friend]516-my friend , understand what [I]2645-i suffer . Do [you]516-my friend know , [you]516-my friend ought to come and see [me]2645-i this winter , [you]516-my friend would give [me]2645-i such a pleasure . Good - bye , dear [Signor Francesco]396-dear signor francesco ; preserve [your]516-my friend friendship for [me]2645-i . "[2645-i]

Thus [she]2646-her runs on , repeating and re - repeating the same ideas , the same words , [her]2646-her love for [Alfieri]196-alfieri , [her]2646-her desperate situation , [her]2646-her hatred of life , [her]2646-her uselessness , [her]2646-her desire to play the harp well for [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's sake , [her]2646-her hopes that [Charles Edward]204-charles edward may die ; disconnected phrases , run into each other without so much as a comma or a full stop since [I]0-i have had to punctuate [my]0-i translation , at least partially , to make it intelligible ; the excited , unconsecutive , unceasing , discursive , reiterating gabble of hysteria , eager , vague , impotent , thoughts suddenly vanishing and as suddenly coming to a dead stop ; everything rattled off as if between two sobs or two convulsions . Did [Alfieri]196-alfieri enjoy receiving letters such as these ? Doubtless : they were echoes of [his]196-alfieri own ravings ; fuel for [his]196-alfieri own passion and vanity . It did not strike [him]196-alfieri , for all [the Greek and Roman heroes and heroines]2647-the greek and roman heroes and heroines whom [he]196-alfieri had made to speak with stoical , unflinching curtness , that there could be anything to move shame , and compassion sickened by shame , in the fact that this should be the expression of that high and pure love imitated from [Dante]343-dante and [Petrarch]340-petrarch . What could [he]196-alfieri do ? Give up [Louise]233-louise d'Albany , forget [her]233-louise ; and bid [her]233-louise , who lived only in [him]196-alfieri , whom a few years must free , forget [him]196-alfieri at the price of breaking [her]233-louise heart ? Certainly not . But [he]196-alfieri , [the man]2465-the man , [the man free to move about]2649-the man free to move about , to work , with [friends]857-friends and occupations , should surely have tried to teach resignation and patience to [this poor lonely , sick , hysterical woman]2651-this poor lonely , sick , hysterical woman , pointing out to [her]2651-this poor lonely , sick , hysterical woman that if only [they]2652-they would wait , and wait courageously , the moment of liberation and happiness must come . Surely more difficult and humiliating for [this lover]2653-this lover to bear than the sight of [[his]196-alfieri lady]1719-his lady degraded by the foul words and deeds of [the drunken Pretender]2655-the drunken pretender , ought to have been the reading of such letters as these ; the sight of [this once calm and dignified woman]2656-this once calm and dignified woman , of this [Beatrice]344-beatrice or [Laura]345-alfieri , in [her]2651-this poor lonely , sick , hysterical woman disconnected hysterical ravings . And for [myself]0-i , the thought of all that [the Countess of Albany]527-the countess of albany endured at the hands of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward awakens less pity , though pity mixed with indignation at the fate which humiliated [her]527-the countess of albany so deeply , and with shame for that deep humiliation , than that sudden cry with which [she]527-the countess of albany stops in the midst of the light - headed gabble about [her]527-the countess of albany miseries , and seems to start back ashamed as at the sight of [her]527-the countess of albany passion and tear - defiled face in a mirror : " What a cruel thing to expect [one]1590-one 's happiness from the death of another ! O God ! how it degrades [one]1590-one 's soul ! "[527-the countess of albany]

CHAPTER XII .

[COLMAR]401-colmar .

" On the 17th August 1784 , at eight in the morning , at [the inn of the Two Keys]3993-the inn of the two keys , [Colmar]401-colmar , [I]2658-i met [her]527-the countess of albany , and remained speechless from excess of joy . "[2658-i] So runs an annotation of [Alfieri]345-alfieri on the margin of one of [his]2658-i lyrics .

The hour of liberty and happiness had come for [Alfieri]345-alfieri and [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany ; sooner by far than [they]2659-they expected , and sooner , [we]2660-we may think , than [they]2659-they deserved . Liberty and happiness , however , not in the face of the law . [Charles Edward]204-charles edward was still alive ; but , pressed by [King Gustavus III]266-gustavus iii . of [Sweden]64-sweden , whom [he]204-charles edward contrived to wheedle out of some most unnecessary money , [he]204-charles edward had consented to a legal separation from [[his]204-charles edward fugitive wife]2197-his fugitive wife ; as a result of which [the Countess of Albany]196-alfieri , renouncing all money supplies from [the Stuarts]241-the stuarts , and subsisting entirely upon a share of the two pensions , [French and Papal]2662-french and papal , granted to [[her]2197-his fugitive wife husband]790-her husband , was permitted to spend a portion of the year wheresoever [she]2197-his fugitive wife pleased , provided [she]2197-his fugitive wife returned for awhile to show [herself]2197-his fugitive wife in [the Papal States]2664-the papal states . On hearing the unexpected news , [Alfieri]196-alfieri , who was crossing [the Apennines of]48-the apennines [Modena]142-modena with fourteen horses that [he]196-alfieri had been to buy in [England]13-england , was seized with a violent temptation to send [[his]196-alfieri caravan]2665-his caravan along [the main road]2666-the main road , and gallop by [cross - paths]2667-cross - paths to meet [the Countess]1995-the countess , who was crossing [the Apennines of]48-the apennines [Bologna]143-bologna on [her]1995-the countess way from [Rome]10-rome to [the baths of [Baden]144-baden in [Switzerland]145-switzerland]2669-the baths of baden in switzerland . The thought of [her]1995-the countess honour and safety restrained [him]196-alfieri , and [he]196-alfieri pushed on moodily to [Siena]6-siena . But , as on a previous occasion , [his]196-alfieri stern resolution not to seek [[his]196-alfieri lady]1719-his lady soon gave way ; and two months later followed that meeting at [the Two Keys at [Colmar]146-colmar on [the Rhine]147-the rhine]2671-the two keys at colmar on the rhine .

For the first time in those seven long years of platonic passion , [Alfieri]196-alfieri and [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany found [themselves]2672-their settled beneath the same roof . To the mind of [this Italian man]2673-this italian man , and [this half - French , half - German woman of the eighteenth century , for whom marriage was one of the sacraments of a religion in which they wholly disbelieved]2674-this half - french , half - german woman of the eighteenth century , for whom marriage was one of the sacraments of a religion in which they wholly disbelieved , and one of the institutions of a society which alleviated it with universal adultery ; to [Alfieri]196-alfieri and [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany the legal separation from [Charles Edward Stuart]204-charles edward was equivalent to a divorce . [The Pretender]605-the pretender could no longer prescribe any line of conduct to [[his]605-the pretender wife]908-his wife ; [she]908-his wife was free to live where and with whom [she]908-his wife chose ; and if [she]908-his wife were not free to marry , the idea , the wish for marriage , probably never crossed the brains of [these two platonic lovers of seven years ' standing]2677-these two platonic lovers of seven years ' standing . Marriage was a social contract between people who wished to obtain [each other]2262-each other 's money and titles and lands - who wished to have [heirs]2679-heirs . [Alfieri]196-alfieri , who had made over all [his]196-alfieri property to [[his]196-alfieri sister]1968-his sister , and [the Countess , who lived on a pension]2681-the countess , who lived on a pension , had no money or titles or lands to throw together ; and [they]2672-their certainly neither of [them]2672-their , [the man living entirely for [his]196-alfieri work]2682-the man living entirely for his work , [the woman]1874-the woman living entirely for [the man]2465-the man , had the smallest desire to have [children]548-children , [heirs to nothing at all]2686-heirs to nothing at all . What injury could [their]2672-their living together now do to [Charles Edward]204-charles edward , who had relinquished all [[his]204-charles edward husband]2687-his husband 's rights ? None , evidently . On the other hand , what harm could [their]2672-their living together do to [their]2672-their own honour or happiness , now that [they]2672-their had had seven years ' experience that only death could extinguish [their]2672-their affection ? None , again evidently . And as to harm to the institutions of society , what were those institutions , and what was [their]2672-their value , that [they]2672-their should be respected ? Such , could [we]2688-we have questioned [them]2672-their , would have been the answers of [Alfieri]196-alfieri and [the Countess]1995-the countess . That [they]2672-their were setting an example to [others less pure in mind , less exceptional in position]2690-others less pure in mind , less exceptional in position ; that [they]2672-their were making it more difficult for marriage to be reorganised on a more rational plan , by showing [men]711-men and [women]547-women a something that might do instead of rationally organised marriage ; that [they]2672-their were , in short , preventing the law from being rectified , by taking the law into [their]2672-their own hands : such thoughts could not enter into the mind of [continentals of the eighteenth century]2693-continentals of the eighteenth century , [people for whom the great Revolution , Romanticism , and the new views of society which grew out of both , were still in the future]2694-people for whom the great revolution , romanticism , and the new views of society which grew out of both , were still in the future . That a punishment should await [them]2672-their , that as time went on and youthful passion diminished , [their]2672-their lives should be barren and silent and cold for want of all those things : [children]548-children , legal bonds , social recognition , by which [their]2672-their union should fall short of a real marriage ; this [they]2672-their could never anticipate .

For the moment , united in the " excessively clean and comfortable "[1995-the countess] little château , rented by Madame d'Albany at [a short distance from [Colmar]146-colmar]2696-a short distance from colmar ; riding and driving about in [the lovely Rhine country]2697-the lovely rhine country ; [the Countess]1995-the countess deep in [her]1995-the countess reading again , [Alfieri]196-alfieri deep once more in [his]196-alfieri writings ; together , above all , after so many months of separation : [they]2672-their seemed perfectly happy . So happy that it seemed as if a misfortune must come to restore the natural balance of things ; and the misfortune came , in the sudden news of the death of [poor Francesco Gori]325-gori . A sense as of guiltiness at having half forgotten [that thoughtful and gentle friend]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend in the first flush of [their]2672-their happiness , seems to have come over [them]2672-their .

" O [God]272-god , "[196-alfieri] wrote [Alfieri]196-alfieri to [[Gori]325-gori 's friend]2700-gori 's friend [Bianchi]403-mario bianchi at [Siena]6-siena , " [I]196-alfieri do n't know what [I]196-alfieri shall do . [I]196-alfieri always see [him]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend and speak to [him]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend , and every smallest word and thought and gesture of [his]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend returns to [my]196-alfieri mind , and stabs [my]196-alfieri heart . [I]196-alfieri do not feel very sorry for [him]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend : [he]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend cared little for life for [its]3994-its own sake , and the life which [he]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend was forced to lead was too far below [his]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend great soul , and the goodness and tenderness of [his]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend heart , and the nobility of [his]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend noble scornfulness . [The person dearest to [me]196-alfieri of any , and immediately next to whom [I]196-alfieri loved [Checco Gori]404-gori most]3995-the person dearest to me of any , and immediately next to whom i loved checco gori most , knew and appreciated [him]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend and is not to be consoled for such a loss . [I]196-alfieri told [him]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend already last July , so many , many times , that [he]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend was not well , that [he]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend was growing visibly thinner day by day . Oh ! [I]196-alfieri ought never to have left [him]2699-that thoughtful and gentle friend in this state . "[196-alfieri]

A letter , this one on [Gori]404-gori 's death , which may induce [us]2701-us to forgive the letters of [Alfieri]196-alfieri of which [we]2701-us have seen a reflection in those of [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany : the passionate grief for [the lost friend]2702-the lost friend making [us]2701-us feel that there is something noble in the possibility of even the morbid grief at [the lost mistress]2703-the lost mistress . More touching still , bringing home what each of [us]2701-us , alas ! must have felt in those long , dull griefs for one who is not [[our]2701-us kith and kin]2704-our kith and kin , whom the thoughts of [our]2701-us nearest and dearest , of [our]2701-us work , of all those things which [the world]573-the world recognises as [ours]2701-us in a sense in which [the poor beloved dead]2706-the poor beloved dead was not , does not permit [us]2701-us to mourn in such a way as to satisfy [our]2701-us heart , and the longing for whom , half suppressed , comes but the more pertinaciously to haunt [us]2701-us , to make the present and future , all where [he]2707-he or [she]2708-she is not , a blank ; more touching than any letter in which [Alfieri]196-alfieri gives free vent to [his]196-alfieri grief for [poor Gori]404-gori , is that note which [he]196-alfieri wrote upon the manuscript of [his]196-alfieri poem on [Duke Alexander]405-duke alexander 's murder , after the annotation saying that this work was resumed at [Siena]6-siena , the 17th July 1784 - " O [God]272-god ! and [the friend of [my]196-alfieri heart]3996-the friend of my heart was still living then "[196-alfieri] ; the words which [a man]1698-a man speaks , or writes only for [himself]1698-a man , feeling that [no one]1470-no one , not [those even who are the very flesh and blood of [his]1698-a man heart]2711-those even who are the very flesh and blood of his heart , can , since [they]2711-those even who are the very flesh and blood of his heart are not [himself]1698-a man , feel that terrible pang at suddenly seeing the past so close within [his]1698-a man reach , so hopelessly beyond [his]1698-a man grasp .

The death of [Gori]404-gori seemed the only circumstance which diminished the happiness of [Alfieri]196-alfieri and [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany ; nay , it is not heartless , surely , to say that , cruel as was that wound , there was doubtless a quite special sad sweetness in each trying to heal it in the other , in the redoubled love due to this fellow - feeling in affliction , the new energy of affection which comes to [the survivors]2712-the survivors whenever [Death]406-death calls out the warning , " Love [each other]2262-each other while [I]406-death still let [you]2712-the survivors . "[406-death] But [they]2713-they had still to pay , and pay in many instalments , the price of happiness snatched before its legitimate time .

Supposed to be living apart from [Alfieri]196-alfieri , [the Countess]1995-the countess could not , therefore , take [him]196-alfieri back with [her]1995-the countess to [Italy]3-italy , where , according to the stipulations of the act of separation , [she]1995-the countess was bound to spend the greater part of every year . Hence the stay at [Colmar]146-colmar in 1784 , and those in the succeeding years , were merely so many interludes of happiness in the dreary life of separation ; happiness which , as [Alfieri]196-alfieri says in one of [his]196-alfieri sonnets , was constantly embittered by the thought that every day and every hour was bringing [them]2713-they nearer to a cruel parting . The day came : [Alfieri]196-alfieri had to take leave of [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany ; and , as [he]196-alfieri expresses it , had to return to much worse gloom than before , being separated from [[his]196-alfieri lady]1719-his lady without having the consolation of seeing [Gori]404-gori once more . Mechanically [he]196-alfieri returned to [Siena]6-siena , to [Siena]6-siena which it was impossible to conceive without [[his]196-alfieri friend]1173-his friend [Checco]404-gori ; but when [he]196-alfieri realised [the empty house]2717-the empty house , [the empty town]2718-the empty town , [he]196-alfieri found [the place [he]196-alfieri had so loved insupportable]2719-the place he had so loved insupportable , and went to spend [his]196-alfieri long solitary winter writing , reading , translating , breaking in horses , leading [a slave]951-a slave 's life to pass the weary time , at [Pisa]148-pisa . In April 1785 [Mme . d'Albany]426-mme obtained permission to quit [Bologna]143-bologna , where [she]426-mme had spent the winter , and to go to [[her]426-mme sisters]2721-her sisters in [France]35-france . In September [she]426-mme and [[her]426-mme lover]2050-her lover met once more in [the beloved country - house on [the Rhine]147-the rhine]2723-the beloved country - house on the rhine . But again , in December , came another separation ; [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany went to [Paris]4-paris , and [Alfieri]196-alfieri remained behind at [Colmar]146-colmar .

" Shall [we]3998-us then be again separated , "[196-alfieri] [he]196-alfieri writes in a sonnet , " by cruel and lying opinion , which blames [us]3998-us for errors which [the whole world]2126-the whole world commits every day ? Unhappy that [I]196-alfieri am ! The more [I]196-alfieri love [thee]4000-thy with true and loyal love , the more must [I]196-alfieri ever refuse [myself]196-alfieri that for which [I]196-alfieri am always longing : [thy]4000-thy sweet sight , beyond which [I]196-alfieri ask for nothing . But [the vulgar]4001-the vulgar can not understand this , and knows [us]3998-us but little , and does not see that [thy]4000-thy pure heart is the seat of virtue . "[196-alfieri]

Strange words , and which , coming from [a man cynical and truthful as [Alfieri]196-alfieri]2724-a man cynical and truthful as alfieri , may make [us]2725-us pause and refuse to affirm that this strange love , platonic for seven long years , ceased to be a mere passionate friendship even when it resorted to the secrecy and deceptions of a mere common intrigue ; even when it openly braved , in the semblance of marriage , the opinion of [the world]573-the world at large . During those many months of solitude in [the villa at [Colmar]146-colmar]2727-the villa at colmar , with no other company than that of [[his]196-alfieri Sienese servant]2728-his sienese servant or [secretary]2494-secretary and of the horses , whose news [he]196-alfieri carefully sent , in letters and sonnets , to [the Countess]1995-the countess , [Alfieri]196-alfieri appears for the first time to have got into a habit of excessive overwork , and to have had the first serious attack of the gout ; overwork and gout , the two things which were to kill [him]196-alfieri . A six months ' stay in [Paris]4-paris , where society , the business of printing [his]196-alfieri works , and the great distance of [[his]196-alfieri lodgings]2731-his lodgings from [the house of Mme . d'Albany]2732-the house of mme . d'albany , diminished [his]196-alfieri intellectual work , kept [him]196-alfieri up for the moment . But in the following summer of the year 1787 , shortly after [he]196-alfieri had returned to [Colmar]146-colmar with [the Countess]1995-the countess , and had welcomed as a guest [Tommaso di Caluso]332-tommaso di caluso , [[his]196-alfieri greatest friend]2734-his greatest friend since [Gori]404-gori 's death , [he]196-alfieri suddenly broke down under a terrific attack of dysentery . For many days , reduced to a skeleton , ice cold even under burning applications , and just sufficiently alive to feel in [his]196-alfieri intensely proud and masculine nature the cruel degradation of an illness which made [him]196-alfieri an object of loathing to [himself]196-alfieri , [Alfieri]196-alfieri remained at death 's door , devotedly tended by [[his]196-alfieri beloved]2127-his beloved and by [[his]196-alfieri friend]1173-his friend .

" It grieved [me]196-alfieri dreadfully to think that [I]196-alfieri should die , leaving [[my]196-alfieri lady]4002-my lady , and [[my]196-alfieri friend]516-my friend , and that fame scarcely rough hewn for which [I]196-alfieri had worked and frenzied [myself]196-alfieri so terribly for more than ten years , "[196-alfieri] writes [Alfieri]196-alfieri ; " for [I]196-alfieri felt very keenly that of all the writings which [I]196-alfieri should leave behind [me]196-alfieri , not one was completed and finished as it should have been had time been given [me]196-alfieri to complete and to perfect according to [my]196-alfieri ideas . On the other hand , it was a great consolation to know that , if [I]196-alfieri must die , [I]196-alfieri should die [a free man]3951-a free man , and between [the two best beloved persons that [I]196-alfieri had]4005-the two best beloved persons that i had , and whose love and esteem [I]196-alfieri believed [myself]196-alfieri to possess and to deserve . "[196-alfieri]

[Alfieri]196-alfieri recovered . But with that illness ends , [I]0-i think , the period of [his]196-alfieri youth , and of [his]196-alfieri genius , that is to say , of that high - wrought and passionate austerity and independence of character which was to [him]196-alfieri what artistic endowment is to [other writers]2737-other writers ; and with that illness begins a premature old age , mental and moral , decrepitude gradually showing itself in a kind of ossification of the whole personality ; the decrepitude which corresponds , on the other side of a brief manhood of comparative strength and health , to the morally inert and sickly years of [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's strange youth .

CHAPTER XIII .

[RUE DE BOURGOYNE]407-rue de bourgoyne .

[[Alfieri]196-alfieri 's mother]2738-alfieri 's mother , [an old lady of extreme simplicity of mind and gentleness of spirit]2739-an old lady of extreme simplicity of mind and gentleness of spirit , was still living at [Asti]99-asti , cheerfully depriving [herself]2738-alfieri 's mother of every luxury in order to devote [her]2738-alfieri 's mother fortune , as [she]2738-alfieri 's mother devoted [her]2738-alfieri 's mother thoughts and [her]2738-alfieri 's mother strength , to the services of [the poor]2740-the poor and of [the sick]2741-the sick . [Alfieri]196-alfieri , who had left [her]2738-alfieri 's mother as [a boy]1599-a boy , and scarcely seen [her]2738-alfieri 's mother except for a few hours at rare intervals , looked up to [her]2738-alfieri 's mother less with the affection of [a son]1372-a son than with the satisfaction of [an artist who sees in [the woman of whom [he]196-alfieri is born the peculiar type of features or character which [he]196-alfieri prizes most in [womankind]2746-womankind]2745-the woman of whom he is born the peculiar type of features or character which he prizes most in womankind ; if [he]196-alfieri , for all [his]196-alfieri conscious weaknesses , was more like [[his]196-alfieri own heroes]2747-his own heroes than [any man of [his]196-alfieri acquaintance]2748-any man of his acquaintance]2744-an artist who sees in the woman of whom he is born the peculiar type of features or character which he prizes most in womankind ; if he , for all his conscious weaknesses , was more like his own heroes than any man of his acquaintance , if [Mme .]426-mme d'Albany might be judiciously got up as [the Laura of [his]196-alfieri affections]2749-the laura of his affections , [the old Countess Alfieri]196-alfieri was even more unmistakably [the mother who suited [his]196-alfieri ideas]2750-the mother who suited his ideas , [the living model of [[his]196-alfieri mother of [Virginia]149-virginia]2752-his mother of virginia , or [[his]196-alfieri mother of [Myrrha]408-myrrha]2753-his mother of myrrha]2751-the living model of his mother of virginia , or his mother of myrrha . To [the Countess Alfieri]196-alfieri [he]196-alfieri had , already in 1784 , introduced [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri , whom [she]2754-the countess of albany , whom she invited to stay with her on her passage through asti as she returned from colmar into italy invited to stay with [her]2754-the countess of albany , whom she invited to stay with her on her passage through asti as she returned from colmar into italy on [her]2754-the countess of albany , whom she invited to stay with her on her passage through asti as she returned from colmar into italy passage through [Asti]99-asti as [she]2754-the countess of albany , whom she invited to stay with her on her passage through asti as she returned from colmar into italy returned from [Colmar]146-colmar into [Italy]3-italy]2754-the countess of albany , whom she invited to stay with her on her passage through asti as she returned from colmar into italy . [Mme . d'Albany]426-mme found an excuse for not accepting in the bad state of [the roads]2755-the roads , which rendered another route than that of [Asti]99-asti preferable . [Frank]316-the grand duke francis and indifferent to [the world]573-the world 's opinion as was [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany , [her]426-mme originally cut and dry intellectual temper hardened by many years ' misery , one can conceive that [she]426-mme should shrink from accepting the hospitality of [[Alfieri]196-alfieri 's mother]2738-alfieri 's mother . [Alfieri]196-alfieri had doubtless shown [her]426-mme [[his]196-alfieri mother]1610-his mother 's letters , and from these letters , as reflected in [his]196-alfieri answers , it is clear that [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany , returning from that first stay with [[her]527-the countess of albany lover]2050-her lover at [Colmar]146-colmar , would have felt that [she]527-the countess of albany was tacitly deceiving [the noble old lady under whose roof [she]527-the countess of albany was staying]2761-the noble old lady under whose roof she was staying . For [the Countess Alfieri]196-alfieri , [noble , and Italian]2762-noble , and italian , and [woman of the eighteenth century]2763-woman of the eighteenth century though [she]426-mme was , seems to have been one of [those persons into whose mind , high removed above all worldly concerns , no experience of vice , of weakness , nay , of mere equivocal situations]2764-those persons into whose mind , high removed above all worldly concerns , no experience of vice , of weakness , nay , of mere equivocal situations , can enter . Whatever [she]426-mme may have seen or heard in [her]426-mme youth of the habits of women of [her]426-mme century and station , of the virtual divorce which , after a few years , reigned in [aristocratic houses]2765-aristocratic houses , of [authorised lovers]2766-authorised lovers and socially accepted infidelity , seems to have passed out of [her]426-mme memory and left [her]426-mme mind as innocent as it may have been during [her]426-mme convent school - days . [She]426-mme had taken great interest in [this poor young woman]2767-this poor young woman , maltreated by [a drunken husband]2768-a drunken husband , and finally saved from [his]2768-a drunken husband clutches by the benevolence of [the Grand Duke of [Tuscany]80-tuscany]2196-the grand duke of tuscany and of [a prince of the church]2770-a prince of the church , about whom [[her]426-mme son]2771-her son had written to [her]426-mme . That [[her]426-mme son]2771-her son experienced more than [her]426-mme own pity for so worthy an object , that [he]2771-her son was at all compromised in the fate of [this virtuous , unhappy lady]2773-this virtuous , unhappy lady , never entered [her]426-mme mind . So little could [she]426-mme understand the muddy things of [this world]962-this world , that in 1789 , when [Alfieri]196-alfieri was publicly living with [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany at [Colmar]146-colmar , [the Countess Alfieri]196-alfieri sent [him]196-alfieri , through [[his]196-alfieri friend]1173-his friend [Caluso]332-tommaso di caluso , the suggestion of a match which [she]426-mme had greatly at heart , between [him]196-alfieri and [a young lady of Asti]2776-a young lady of asti , " fifteen or sixteen years old , without any faults , such as [he]196-alfieri would certainly like , cultivated , docile , and clever . "[426-mme] It is one of the things which grate upon one most in [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's character , and which show that however much [he]196-alfieri might be cast and have chiselled [himself]196-alfieri in antique heroic form [he]196-alfieri was yet made of the same stuff as [[his]196-alfieri contemporaries]2486-his contemporaries , to find that [he]196-alfieri and [[his]196-alfieri friend]1173-his friend [Caluso]332-tommaso di caluso merely amused [themselves]2779-themselves immensely at this proposal of marriage , and concocted a dutiful letter to [the old Countess]2780-the old countess explaining that matrimony was not at present in [his]196-alfieri plans . What would [Madame Alfieri]409-alfieri have thought had [she]409-alfieri known the truth ! It is very sad to think how , in some cases , the very noblest and purest , just because [they]2781-they are so completely noble and pure and above all the base necessities of the world of passion , must be unable to see , in the doings of [others less fortunate than [themselves]2781-they]2782-others less fortunate than themselves , those very elements of nobility and purity which redeem the baser circumstances of [their]2781-they lives . That [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany had loved [a man not [[her]426-mme husband]790-her husband , had fled from [[her]426-mme husband]790-her husband and united [her]426-mme life to that of [[her]426-mme lover]2050-her lover]2783-a man not her husband , had fled from her husband and united her life to that of her lover , would be a horror visible to [the old Countess]2780-the old countess ' eyes ; the platonic purity , the fidelity , the loyalty of this long and illegitimate love , would have escaped [her]426-mme . No art is so cruelly contemptuous of whatever of beauty and sweetness imperfect reality may contain , as the art which is able to attain an ideal perfection ; and thus it is also in matters of appreciation of [man]2788-man by [man]2788-man and [woman]3888-woman by [woman]3888-woman . [The Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany was apparently more frank than [Alfieri]409-alfieri , because frank rather from temperament than from pre - occupation about a given ideal of conduct . That [the mother of [Alfieri]409-alfieri]2793-the mother of alfieri should understand so little seems to have worried [her]2793-the mother of alfieri ; and when [the unsuspecting old lady]2794-the unsuspecting old lady asked [her]2793-the mother of alfieri sympathisingly for news of [Charles Edward]204-charles edward , [she]2793-the mother of alfieri wrote back as follows : " As to [[my]2793-the mother of alfieri husband]4006-my husband , [he]4006-my husband is better ; but [I]2793-the mother of alfieri must confess to [you]2794-the unsuspecting old lady , [Madame]409-alfieri , that [I]2793-the mother of alfieri can not take so lively an interest in [him]4006-my husband as [you]2794-the unsuspecting old lady suppose , for [he]4006-my husband made [me]2793-the mother of alfieri , during nine years , [the most wretched woman that ever lived]4007-the most wretched woman that ever lived . If [I]2793-the mother of alfieri do not hate [him]4006-my husband it is a result of Christian charity , and because [we]4008-we are desired to pardon . [He]4006-my husband drags out a miserable life , abandoned by all [the world]573-the world , without [relatives]4010-relatives or [friends]857-friends , given over to [[his]4006-my husband servants]1490-his servants ; but [he]4006-my husband has willed it thus , since [he]4006-my husband has never been able to live with [anyone]1386-anyone . Forgive [me]2793-the mother of alfieri , [Madame]4014-madame , for having entered into such details with [you]4014-madame ; but the friendship which [you]4014-madame have shown towards [me]2793-the mother of alfieri obliges [me]2793-the mother of alfieri to speak sincerely . "[2793-the mother of alfieri] [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany , writing some time before to condole about the death of [[Alfieri]409-alfieri 's half - brother]2795-alfieri 's half - brother , had tried to insinuate to [the old Countess]2780-the old countess what [[her]2780-the old countess son]2771-her son was for [her]2780-the old countess , and what position [she]2780-the old countess [herself]2780-the old countess might one day assume in [the Alfieri family]2798-the alfieri family : " [I]2780-the old countess hope that if circumstances change , [you]4014-madame will not see [a family]969-a family die out to which [you]4014-madame are so attached , and that [you]4014-madame will receive the greatest consolation from [M. le Comte Alfieri]410-alfieri . "[2780-the old countess] Words which could only mean that when [the Pretender]605-the pretender died [Mme]426-mme .
