With considerable difficulty a passport for [the Countess]1995-the countess had been obtained from [the Swedish Minister]3243-the swedish minister , [one for [Alfieri]196-alfieri from [the Venetian Resident almost [the only diplomatic representatives]3246-the only diplomatic representatives]3245-the venetian resident almost the only diplomatic representatives , says [Alfieri]196-alfieri , who still remained to [that ghost of [a king]3248-a king]3247-that ghost of a king , and a passport for each of [them]3241-their and for each of [[their]3241-their servants]3249-their servants from [[their]3241-their communal section]3250-their communal section]3244-one for alfieri from the venetian resident almost the only diplomatic representatives , says alfieri , who still remained to that ghost of a king , and a passport for each of them and for each of their servants from their communal section . Departure was fixed for the 20th August , but [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's black presentiments hastened it to the 18th . Arrived at [the Barrière Blanche]166-the barrière blanche , on [the road to [Calais]450-calais]3251-the road to calais , passports were examined by [two or three soldiers of the National Guard]3252-two or three soldiers of the national guard , and the gates were on the point of being opened to let [the two heavily - loaded carriages]3253-the two heavily - loaded carriages pass , when suddenly , from out of [a neighbouring pot - house]3254-a neighbouring pot - house , rushed [some twenty - five or thirty ruffians]3255-some twenty - five or thirty ruffians , ragged , drunken , and furious . [They]3255-some twenty - five or thirty ruffians surrounded [the carriages]553-the carriages , yelling that [all the rich]3257-all the rich were running away and leaving [them]3257-all the rich to starve without work ; and [a crowd]3258-a crowd rapidly formed round [them]3255-some twenty - five or thirty ruffians and the National Guards , who wanted [the travellers]3259-the travellers to be permitted to pass on . [Alfieri]196-alfieri jumps out of [the carriage]1250-the carriage , brandishing [his]196-alfieri seven passports , and throws [himself]196-alfieri , [a long , lean , red - haired man , fiercely gesticulating and yelling at the top of [his]196-alfieri voice]3261-a long , lean , red - haired man , fiercely gesticulating and yelling at the top of his voice , among [the crowd]2401-the crowd , forcing [this man]2278-this man and that to read the passports , crying frantically , " Look ! Listen ! Name [Alfieri]196-alfieri . Italian and not French ! Tall , thin , pale , red - haired ; that is [I]196-alfieri ; look at [me]196-alfieri . [I]196-alfieri have [my]196-alfieri passport ! [We]4049-we have [our]4049-we passports all in order from [the proper authorities]4050-the proper authorities ! [We]4049-we want to pass ; and , by [God]272-god ! [we]4049-we will pass ! "[196-alfieri]

After half an hour of this altercation , with voices issuing from [the crowd]2401-the crowd , " Burn [the carriages]553-the carriages ! "[2401-the crowd] " Throw stones at [them]553-the carriages ! "[2401-the crowd] " [They]553-the carriages are running away , [they]553-the carriages are [noble and rich]4052-noble and rich ; take [them]553-the carriages to [the Hotel de Ville]4053-the hotel de ville to be judged ! "[2401-the crowd] at last [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's vociferations and gesticulations wearied even [the [Paris]4-paris mob]3265-the paris mob , [the crowd]2401-the crowd became quieter , [the National Guards]3267-the national guards gave the sign for departure , and [Alfieri]196-alfieri , jumping into [the carriage]1250-the carriage where Mme . d'Albany was sitting more dead than alive , shouted to [the postillions]3269-the postillions to gallop off .

At [a country house near [Mons]17-mons]3270-a country house near mons , belonging to [the Countess of [[Albany]196-alfieri 's sister]3272-albany 's sister]3271-the countess of albany 's sister , [the fugitives]3273-the fugitives received the frightful news of the September massacres ; of [those men]3274-those men and [women]547-women driven , like beasts into [an arena]3276-an arena , down the prison - stairs into [the prison yard]3277-the prison yard , to fall , hacked to pieces by the bayonets and sabres and pikes of [[Maillard]452-maillard 's amateur executioners]3278-maillard 's amateur executioners , on to the blood - soaked mattresses , while [the people of [Paris]4-paris]3279-the people of paris , morally divided on separate benches , [the gentlemen here]3280-the gentlemen here , [the ladies there]3281-the ladies there , sat and looked on ; of [those men]3274-those men and women many had frequented [the salon of [the Rue de Bourgoyne]153-the rue de bourgoyne]3283-the salon of the rue de bourgoyne , had chatted and laughed , only a few weeks back , with [Alfieri]196-alfieri and [the Countess]1995-the countess ; amongst [those men]3274-those men and [women Alfieri]3286-women alfieri and [the Countess]1995-the countess might [themselves]3288-their easily have been , had [the ruffians of [the Barrière Blanche]166-the barrière blanche]3289-the ruffians of the barrière blanche dragged [them]3288-their back to [[their]3288-their house]1559-their house , where an order to arrest [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany arrived two days later , that very 20th August which had originally been fixed for [their]3288-their departure . The thought of this narrow escape turned the recollection of that scene at [the Barrière Blanche]3291-the barrière blanche into a perfect nightmare , which focussed , so to speak , all the frenzied horror conceived by [Alfieri]196-alfieri for the French Revolution , for [the " Tiger - Apes "[196-alfieri] of [France]35-france]3292-the " tiger - apes " of france .

By [November Alfieri]196-alfieri and [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany were in [Florence]9-florence , safe ; but established in [a miserable inn]3293-a miserable inn , without [their]3288-their furniture , [their]3288-their horses , [their]3288-their books ; all left in [Paris]4-paris ; nay , almost without the necessary clothes , and with very little money . From [the dirty inn]3294-the dirty inn [they]3288-their migrated into [rather unseemly furnished lodgings]3295-rather unseemly furnished lodgings , and finally , after some debating about [Siena]6-siena and inquiring whether [a house]1439-a house might not be had [there]593-there on [the promenade of [the Lizza]168-the lizza]3298-the promenade of the lizza , [they]3288-their settled down in [the house]769-the house , one of a number formerly belonging to [the Gianfigliazzi family]3300-the gianfigliazzi family , on [the Lung Arno]177-the lung arno , close to [the Ponte Santa Trinita]170-the ponte santa trinita , in [Florence]9-florence . The situation is one of the most delightful in [Florence]9-florence : across [the narrow quay]3301-the narrow quay the windows look almost sheer down into [the river]3302-the river , sparkling with a hundred facets in the spring and summer sunlight , cut by the deep shadows of [the old bridges]3303-the old bridges , to where it is lost to sight between the tall poplars by the Greve mouth and [the ilexes and elms of [the Cascine]171-the cascine]3304-the ilexes and elms of the cascine , closed in by [the pale blue peaks of [the Carrara Alps]172-the carrara alps]3305-the pale blue peaks of the carrara alps ; or else , in autumn and winter , scarcely moving , a mass of dark - greens and browns , wonderfully veined , like some strange oriental jasper , with transparent violet streakings , and above which arise , veiled , half washed out by mist , [the old corbelled houses]3306-the old corbelled houses , the church - steeples and roofs , the tiers and tiers of pine and ilex plumes on [the hill]3307-the hill opposite .

For a moment , with the full luminousness of the Tuscan sky once more in [his]3308-his eyes , and the guttural strength of the Tuscan language once more in [his]3308-his ears , [Alfieri]196-alfieri seems to have been delighted . But [his]3308-his cheerfulness was not of long duration . Ever since [his]196-alfieri great illness at [Colmar]146-colmar , [Alfieri]196-alfieri had , [I]0-i feel persuaded , become virtually [an old man]3309-an old man ; [his]196-alfieri strength and spirits were impaired , and the strange morose depression of [[his]196-alfieri half - fructified youth]3310-his half - fructified youth seemed to return . Coming at that moment , the disappointment , the terror , the horror of the French Revolution became , so to speak , part of a moral illness which lasted to [his]196-alfieri death . [Alfieri]196-alfieri was not a tender - hearted nor [a humane man]3311-a humane man ; had [he]196-alfieri been , [he]196-alfieri would have felt more sympathy than [he]196-alfieri did with the beginning of the great movement , with the strivings after reform which preceded it ; [he]196-alfieri had , on the contrary , the sort of cold continuous rage , the ruthless self - righteousness and cut - and - dryness which would have made [him]196-alfieri , had [he]196-alfieri been [a Frenchman]3312-a frenchman , [a terrorist of the most dreadful type]3313-a terrorist of the most dreadful type ; [a regular routinist in extermination of corrupt people]3314-a regular routinist in extermination of corrupt people . Hence [I]0-i can not believe that , much as [he]196-alfieri may have been shocked by the news of the September massacres , of the grandes fournées which preceded [Thermidor]455-thermidor , and much as [he]196-alfieri may have been distressed by [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany 's anxiety and grief for [so many friends who lost [their]3315-so many friends who lost their property or life property or life]3315-so many friends who lost their property or life , [Alfieri]196-alfieri was [the man to be driven mad by the mere thought of bloodshed]3316-the man to be driven mad by the mere thought of bloodshed . But [Alfieri]196-alfieri had , ever since [his]196-alfieri earliest youth , made liberty [his]196-alfieri goddess , and the worship of liberty [his]196-alfieri special religion and mission . That such a religion and mission , to which [he]196-alfieri had devoted [himself]196-alfieri in a time and country when and where [no one else dreamed of anything of the sort]3317-no one else dreamed of anything of the sort , should suddenly become , and without the smallest agency of [his]196-alfieri , the religion and mission of [the very nation and people whom [he]196-alfieri instinctively abhorred from the depths of [his]196-alfieri soul]3318-the very nation and people whom he instinctively abhorred from the depths of his soul ; that liberty , which [he]196-alfieri alone was to teach [men]711-men to desire , should be the fashionable craze , mixed up with science , philanthropy , sentiment , and everything [he]196-alfieri hated most in [the French]432-the french , this was already a pain that gnawed silently into [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's soul . But when liberty was , as it were , dragged out of [[his]196-alfieri own little private temple]3320-his own little private temple , where [he]196-alfieri adored and hymned [it]3321-it , decked out in patrician dignity of [Plutarch]346-plutarch and [Livy]338-livy , and carried about , dressed in the garb of [a Paris fish - wife]3322-a paris fish - wife , a red cotton night - cap on [her]3322-a paris fish - wife head , by a tattered , filthy , drunken , blood - stained crew of sansculottes , nay , worse , rolled along on [a triumphal car]3323-a triumphal car by an assembly of [lawyers]3324-lawyers and [doctors]3325-doctors and [ex - priests]3326-ex - priests and [journalists]3327-journalists - when liberty , which had been to [him]196-alfieri antique and aristocratic , became modern and democratic ; when [the whole of [France]35-france]3328-the whole of france had turned into [a blood - reeking and streaming temple of [this Moloch goddess]3330-this moloch goddess]3329-a blood - reeking and streaming temple of this moloch goddess , then a sort of moral abscess , long growing unnoticed , seemed to burst within [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's soul , and a process of slow moral blood - poisoning to begin .

The Reign of Terror came to an end , the reaction of Thermidor set in ; but this was nothing to [Alfieri]196-alfieri , for , whereas the unspeakable profanation of what was [[his]196-alfieri own personal and quasi - private property]3331-his own personal and quasi - private property , liberty , had hitherto been limited to [France]35-france , it now spread , [a frightful invading abomination]3332-a frightful invading abomination , with the armies of [the Directory all over [the world]573-the world]3333-the directory all over the world ; nay , to [Italy]3-italy [itself]3-italy .

It was as an expression , an eternal , immortal expression , the severest conceivable retribution , [Alfieri]196-alfieri sincerely thought , of this rage , all the stronger as there entered into it the petty personal vanity as well as the noble abstract feeling of [the man]2465-the man - it was as an expression of this gallophobia that [Alfieri]196-alfieri composed [his]196-alfieri famous but little - read Misogallo . This collection of prose arguments and vituperations and versified epigrams , all larded and loaded with quotations from [all the Latin and Greek authors whom [Alfieri]196-alfieri was busy spelling out]3336-all the latin and greek authors whom alfieri was busy spelling out , does certainly contain many things which , old as they are , strike even [us]3337-we with the force of living contempt and indignation . Nay , even including its most stupid and dullest violent parts , [we]3337-we can sympathise with its bitterness and violence , when [we]3337-we think of the frightful deeds of blood which , talking heroically of justice and liberty , [France]35-france had been committing ; of the miserable series of petty rapines and extortions which , talking patronisingly of the Greeks and [Romans]3338-romans , the French nation was practising upon [the Italians whom it had come to liberate]3339-the italians whom it had come to liberate . That such feeling should be elicited was natural enough . But [we]3337-we feel , as [we]3337-we turn over the pages of the Misogallo , and collate with its epigrams a certain passage in [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's memoirs and letters , that when [we]3337-we meet it in [this particular man]3340-this particular man , in [this hard , savage , narrow , pedantic doctrinaire , whose very magnanimity is vanity and egotism]3341-this hard , savage , narrow , pedantic doctrinaire , whose very magnanimity is vanity and egotism , [we]3337-we can no longer sympathise with the hatred of the French , which in [juster and more modest men]3342-juster and more modest men , as for instance [Carlo Botta]456-carlo botta , invariably elicits [our]3337-we sympathy . Much as [we]3337-we dislike [the republican French who descended into [Italy]3-italy]3343-the republican french who descended into italy , [the Misogallo]457-the misogallo makes [us]3337-we like [Alfieri]196-alfieri even less . Whether this revolution , despite the oceans of blood which it shed , might not be bringing a great and lasting benefit to [mankind]1604-mankind by sweeping away the hundred and one obstacles which impeded social progress ; whether this French invasion , despite the money which it extorted , the statues and pictures which [it]35-france stole , the miserable high - flown lies which it told , might not be doing [Italy]3-italy a great service in accustoming it to [modern institutions]3345-modern institutions , in training [it]3-italy to warfare , in ridding [it]3-italy of [a brood of inept little tyrants]3346-a brood of inept little tyrants : such questions did not occur to [Alfieri]196-alfieri , for whom liberty meant everything , progress and improvement nothing . As the century drew to a close , and the futility of so many vaunted reforms , the hollowness of so many promises , became apparent to [the Italians]3347-the italians with the shameful treaty which gave [Venice]18-venice , liberated of [[her]18-venice oligarchy]3348-her oligarchy , to [Austria]174-austria , all [the nobler men of the day]3349-the nobler men of the day , [Pindemonti]217-ippolito pindemonti , [Botta]456-carlo botta , [Foscolo]213-foscolo , and [the crowds of [nameless patriotic youths who filled the universities]3351-nameless patriotic youths who filled the universities]3350-the crowds of nameless patriotic youths who filled the universities , were seized by a terrible soul - sickness ; everything seemed to have given way , each course was as bad as the other , and [Italy]3-italy seemed destined to servitude and indignity , whether under [[her]3-italy new masters]3352-her new masters [the French]3353-the french , or under [[her]3-italy old masters]3354-her old masters the Austrians and [Bourbons]3355-bourbons and [priests]1050-priests . But the feelings of [Alfieri]196-alfieri were not of this kind ; [he]196-alfieri was not torn by patriotism ; [he]196-alfieri was simply pushed into sympathy with the tyrannies which [he]196-alfieri had so hated by the intolerable pain of finding that the liberty which [he]196-alfieri had preached was being propagandised by [the nation]4039-the nation and the class of society which [he]196-alfieri detested most .

[Such Alfieri]196-alfieri appears to [me]0-i , and such [I]0-i think [he]196-alfieri must appear to everyone who conscientiously studies the extraordinary manner in which [this apostle of liberty came to preach in favour of despotism]3358-this apostle of liberty came to preach in favour of despotism . But in [his]196-alfieri own eyes , and in the eyes of [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany , [Alfieri]196-alfieri doubtless found abundant arguments to prove [himself]196-alfieri perfectly logical and magnanimous . This French Revolution was merely a revolt of [slaves]3116-slaves ; and what tyranny could be more odious than the tyranny of [those whom nature had fitted only for slavery]3361-those whom nature had fitted only for slavery ? What are [the French]432-the french ? " The French , "[457-the misogallo] answers one of the epigrams of [the Misogallo]457-the misogallo , " have always been [puppets]4054-puppets ; formerly puppets in powder , now stinking and blood - stained puppets . "[457-the misogallo] " [We]4055-we indeed are [slaves]3116-slaves , "[457-the misogallo] says another epigram , " but [at least indignant slaves]4057-at least indignant slaves "[457-the misogallo] a statement which the whole history of [Italy]3-italy in the nineties goes to disprove ; " not , as [[you]4058-you Gauls]4059-you gauls always have been and always will be , [slaves]3116-slaves applauding power whatever it be . "[457-the misogallo] The nasal and guttural pronunciation of the French language , the bare existence of such a word as quatrain , is enough to prove to [Alfieri]196-alfieri that [the French]432-the french can never know true liberty . [Alfieri]196-alfieri , who had looked [the ancien régime]3362-the ancien régime more than once in the face , actually persuaded [himself]196-alfieri that , as [he]196-alfieri writes , " [the frightful French mob]4061-the frightful french mob robbed and slaughtered [the upper classes]4062-the upper classes because [those upper classes]4063-those upper classes had always treated it too kindly . "[196-alfieri] [Alfieri]196-alfieri actually got to believe these things . [He]196-alfieri would , had power been put in [his]196-alfieri hands , have headed a counter revolution and exterminated as many [people]927-people again as [the republicans]3364-the republicans had exterminated . Power not being in [his]196-alfieri hands , [he]196-alfieri hastened to do what seemed to [him]196-alfieri a vital matter to all [Europe]137-europe , a sort of fatal thrust to [France]35-france ; [he]196-alfieri solemnly recanted all [his]196-alfieri former writings in favour of revolutions and [republics]3365-republics . [He]196-alfieri , who had witnessed the taking of [the Bastille]150-the bastille and sung it in an ode , deliberately wrote as follows : " The famous day of the 14th July 1789 crowned the victorious iniquity of [the people]2321-the people . Not understanding at that time the nature of [these slaves]4065-these slaves , [I]196-alfieri dishonoured [my]196-alfieri pen by writing an ode on the taking of [the Bastille]150-the bastille . "[196-alfieri] Surely , if [we]3366-we admit that to see liberty degraded by its association with revolutionary horrors must have been unbearably bitter to the nobler portion of [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's nature , [we]3366-we must admit that to see [Alfieri]196-alfieri [himself]196-alfieri , [Alfieri]196-alfieri so proud of [his]196-alfieri former ferocious love of liberty , turned into [a mere ranting renegade]3367-a mere ranting renegade , is an unendurable spectacle also ; [we]3366-we should like to wash [our]3366-we hands of [him]196-alfieri as [he]196-alfieri tried to wash [his]196-alfieri hands of the Revolution .

All this political atrabiliousness did not improve [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's temper ; and could not have made it easier or more agreeable to live with [him]196-alfieri . [The Countess of Albany]196-alfieri naturally disliked the Revolution and [the French]432-the french , after all the grief and inconvenience which [she]3368-she owed [them]3369-them ; [she]3368-she naturally , also , disliked everything that [Alfieri]196-alfieri disliked . Still , [I]0-i can not help fancying that [this woman , far more intellectual than passionate , and growing more indifferent , more easy - going , more half - optimistically]3370-this woman , far more intellectual than passionate , and growing more indifferent , more easy - going , more half - optimistically , half - cynically charitable towards [the world]573-the world with every year that saw [her]3368-she grow fat , and plain , and dowdy , - [I]0-i can not help fancying that [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany must have got to listen to [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's misogallic furies much as [she]3368-she might have listened to [his]196-alfieri groans had [he]196-alfieri been afflicted with gout or the toothache , sympathising with the pain , but just a little weary of its expression . [She]3368-she must also , at times , have compared [the little company of select provincial notabilities , illustrious people never known beyond [[their]3373-the little company of select provincial notabilities , illustrious people never known beyond their town and their lifetime , which she collected about herself and alfieri in the house by the arno town]3374-their town and [their]3373-the little company of select provincial notabilities , illustrious people never known beyond their town and their lifetime , which she collected about herself and alfieri in the house by the arno lifetime , which [she]3368-she collected about [herself]3368-she and [Alfieri]196-alfieri in [the house]769-the house by [the Arno]459-the arno]3373-the little company of select provincial notabilities , illustrious people never known beyond their town and their lifetime , which she collected about herself and alfieri in the house by the arno , with [the brilliant society which had assembled in [[her]3368-she hotel in [Paris]4-paris]3377-her hotel in paris]3376-the brilliant society which had assembled in her hotel in paris . To [her]3368-she , who was , after all , not Italian , but French by education and temper , and who had been steeped anew in French ideas and habits , [this small fry of Italian literature , professional and pedantic]3378-this small fry of italian literature , professional and pedantic , able to discuss and alas ! but too able to hold forth , but absolutely unable to talk , to causer in the French sense , must have become rather oppressive . [She]3368-she and [Alfieri]196-alfieri were both growing elderly , and the hearth by which [they]3379-their were seated , alone , childless , with nothing but the ghost of [their]3379-their former passion , the ghost of [their]3379-their former ideal , to keep [them]3379-their company , was on the whole very bleak and cheerless . [Alfieri]196-alfieri , working off [his]196-alfieri over - excitement in a system of tremendous self - education , sitting for the greater part of the day poring over Latin and Greek and Hebrew grammars , and exercises and annotated editions , till [he]196-alfieri was so exhausted that [he]196-alfieri could scarcely digest [his]196-alfieri dinner ; [the Countess]1995-the countess killing the endless days reading new books of philosophy , of poetry , of fiction , anything and everything that came to hand , writing piles and piles of letters to [every person of [her]1995-the countess acquaintance]3381-every person of her acquaintance ; this double existence of bored and overworked dreariness , was this the equivalent of marriage ? was this the realisation of ideal love ?

But there were things to confirm [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany in that easy - going indifferentism which replaced passion and suffering in [this fat , kindly , intellectual woman of forty]3382-this fat , kindly , intellectual woman of forty ; things which , as they might have made [other women]1555-other women weep , probably made [this woman]1716-this woman do what in its way was just as sad - smile .

[Alfieri]196-alfieri had always had what , to [us]3385-us , may seem very strange notions on the subject of love , but which were not strange when [we]3385-us consider the times and nation in general , and [the man in particular]3386-the man in particular . After the various love manias which preceded [his]196-alfieri meeting with [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany , [he]196-alfieri had determined , as [he]196-alfieri tells [us]3385-us , to save [his]196-alfieri peace of mind and dignity by refusing to fall in love with [women of respectable position]3387-women of respectable position . [The Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany , by enchaining [him]196-alfieri in the bonds of what [he]196-alfieri called " worthy love , "[527-the countess of albany] had saved [him]196-alfieri from any chance of fresh follies with [these alarming " virtuous women]4066-these alarming " virtuous women . "[527-the countess of albany] But follies with [women of less respectable position and less obvious virtue]3389-women of less respectable position and less obvious virtue appear to have presented no fear of degradation to [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's mind . And now , late on in the nineties , when [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany was rapidly growing plain and stout and elderly , and [he]196-alfieri was getting into the systematic habit of regarding [her]527-the countess of albany less in [her]527-the countess of albany reality than in the ideal image which [he]196-alfieri had arranged in [his]196-alfieri mind ; now , when [he]196-alfieri was writing the autobiography where [the Countess]1995-the countess figured as [[his]196-alfieri Beatrice]2054-his beatrice , and when [he]196-alfieri was composing the Latin epitaphs which were to unite [[his]196-alfieri tomb]3392-his tomb with that of [the woman]1874-the woman " a [Victorio Alferio]460-victorio alferio , ultra resomnia dilecta , "[196-alfieri] just at this time [Alfieri]196-alfieri appears to have returned to those flirtations with women neither respectable nor virtuous which seemed to [him]196-alfieri so morally safe to indulge in . A very strange note , preserved at [Siena]6-siena , to a " [Nina padrona mia dilettissima]461-nina padrona mia dilettissima , "[404-gori] shows that the memory of [Gori]404-gori and the friendship of [[Gori]404-gori 's friends]3394-gori 's friends were not the only things which attracted [him]196-alfieri ever and anon from [Florence]9-florence to [Siena]6-siena . A collection of wretched bouts - rimés and burlesque doggrel , written at [Florence]9-florence in [a house which [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany]3395-a house which mme . d'albany could not enter , and in the company of women whom [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany could not receive , and among which is a sonnet in which [Alfieri]196-alfieri explains [his]196-alfieri condescension in joining in these poetical exercises of the demi - monde by an allusion to [Hercules]462-hercules and Omphale , shows that [Alfieri]196-alfieri frequented in [Florence]9-florence other society besides that which crowded round [[his]196-alfieri lady]1719-his lady in [Casa Gianfigliazzi]175-casa gianfigliazzi .

[Mme . d'Albany]426-mme was far too shrewd and far too worldly not to see all this ; and [Alfieri]196-alfieri was far too open and cynical to attempt to hide it . [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany , having [her]426-mme praises and [his]196-alfieri love read to [her]426-mme in innumerable sonnets , in the autobiography and in the epitaphs , probably merely smiled ; [she]426-mme was [a woman of the eighteenth century]1543-a woman of the eighteenth century , [a foreigner]1797-a foreigner , [an easy - going woman]3399-an easy - going woman , and had learned to consider such escapades as these as an inevitable part of matrimony or quasi - matrimony . But , for all [her]426-mme worldly philosophy , did [she]426-mme never feel a vague craving , a void , as [she]426-mme sat in [that big empty house]3400-that big empty house reading [her]426-mme books while [Alfieri]196-alfieri was studying [his]196-alfieri Greek , a vague desire to have what consoles [other women]1555-other women for coldness or infidelity , [a son]1372-a son or [a daughter]658-a daughter , a normal object of devotion , something besides [Alfieri]196-alfieri , and which [she]426-mme could love whether deserving or not ; something besides [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's glory , in which [she]426-mme could take an interest whether [other people]3404-other people did or did not agree ? Such a connection as [hers]426-mme with [Alfieri]196-alfieri may have had an attraction of romance , of poetry , connected with its very illegitimacy , its very negation of normal domestic life , as long as both [she]426-mme and [Alfieri]196-alfieri were young and passionately in love ; but where was the romance , the poetry now , and where was [the humdrum married woman]3405-the humdrum married woman 's happiness , at whose expense that romance , that poetry , had been bought ?

Mme . d'Albany , if [I]0-i may judge by the enormous piles of [her]426-mme letters which [I]0-i have [myself]0-i seen , and by the report of [[my]0-i friend]516-my friend [Signor Mario Pratesi]199-signor mario pratesi , who has examined another huge collection for [my]0-i benefit , was getting to make [herself]426-mme a sort of half - vegetating intellectual life , reading so many hours a day , writing letters so many more hours ; taking the quite unenthusiastic , business - like interest in literature and politics of a woman whose life is very empty , and , it seems to [me]0-i , from the tone of [her]426-mme letters , growing daily more indifferent to life , more desultory , more cynical , more misanthropic and tittle - tattling . And [Alfieri]196-alfieri , meanwhile , was growing more unsociable , more misanthropic , more violent in temper , hanging a printed card stating that [he]196-alfieri wished no visits one such is preserved in [the library at [Florence]9-florence]3407-the library at florence in [the hall]2400-the hall , pursuing and flogging [street - boys]3409-street - boys because [they]3409-street - boys splashed [his]196-alfieri stockings by playing in the puddles ; insulting [Ginguené]463-ginguené and [General Miollis]464-general miollis when [they]3410-they attempted to be civil ; groaning over the victories of [the French]432-the french , rejoicing over the brutal massacres by [the priest - hounded Tuscan populace]3411-the priest - hounded tuscan populace ; going to [Florence]9-florence when [they]3410-they were spending the summer in [a villa]1134-a villa for the pleasure of seeing [the Austrian troops]3413-the austrian troops enter , and of witnessing as [Gino Capponi]214-gino capponi records [the French prisoners]3414-the french prisoners or [Frenchly - inclined Florentines]3415-frenchly - inclined florentines being pilloried and tortured by [the anti - revolutionary mob]3416-the anti - revolutionary mob . Besides such demonstrations of an unamiable disposition as these , working with the fury of [an alchemist]3417-an alchemist , and , perhaps , taking a holiday at [that house where the doggrel]3418-that house where the doggrel verses were written . [The Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri , who had been so horribly unhappy with [[her]3419-the countess of albany , who had been so horribly unhappy with her legitimate husband legitimate husband]3420-her legitimate husband]3419-the countess of albany , who had been so horribly unhappy with her legitimate husband , must have been rather dreary of soul with [[her]3419-the countess of albany , who had been so horribly unhappy with her legitimate husband world - authorised lover]3421-her world - authorised lover .

It was at this moment , as [she]3419-the countess of albany , who had been so horribly unhappy with her legitimate husband sat , [an idle , desultory , neither happy nor unhappy woman]3422-an idle , desultory , neither happy nor unhappy woman , rapidly growing old , watching the century draw to a close amid chaos and misery , - it was at this moment that [an eccentric English prelate]3423-an eccentric english prelate , [Lord Bristol]465-lord bristol , [Bishop of [Derry]176-derry]3424-bishop of derry , introduced at [the house on [the Lung Arno]177-the lung arno]3425-the house on the lung arno [a friend of [his]3423-an eccentric english prelate]1762-a friend of his , [a French painter]3427-a french painter , [a former pupil of [David]428-david , and who had won the Prix de [Rome]10-rome]3428-a former pupil of david , and who had won the prix de rome , by name [François Xavier Fabre]256-fabre . [M. Fabre]466-alfieri was French , but [he]466-alfieri was [a royalist]3429-a royalist ; [he]466-alfieri hated the Revolution ; [he]466-alfieri had settled in [Italy]3-italy ; and , in consideration of this , [he]466-alfieri was tolerated by [Alfieri]466-alfieri . To [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany , on the other hand , the fact of [Fabre]466-alfieri being French must secretly have been a great recommendation . French in language , habits , mode of thought , French in heart , cut off , as it seemed , for ever from [Paris]4-paris and [Parisian]178-parisian society , cooped up among [this pedantic small fry of [Florentines]179-florentines]3430-this pedantic small fry of florentines , listening all day to [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's tirades against [the French nation]3067-the french nation , the French reforms , the French philosophy , the French language , the French everything , [the poor woman]3432-the poor woman must have heartily enjoyed an hour 's chat in good French with [a real Frenchman]3433-a real frenchman , [a Frenchman who , for all [Alfieri]466-alfieri might say , was really French]3434-a frenchman who , for all alfieri might say , was really french ; [she]3432-the poor woman must have enjoyed talking about [his]466-alfieri work , [his]466-alfieri pictures , about everything and anything that was not [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's Greek , or [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's Hebrew , or [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's tragedies , or comedies or satires . [Alfieri]466-alfieri was [a great genius]3435-a great genius and [a great man]3436-a great man ; and [she]3432-the poor woman loved , or imagined [she]3432-the poor woman loved , [Alfieri]466-alfieri like [her]3432-the poor woman very soul . But still - still , it was somehow a relief when [young Fabre]466-alfieri , with [his]466-alfieri regular south - of - [France]35-france face , [his]466-alfieri rather mocking and cynical French expression , [his]466-alfieri easy French talk , came to give [her]3432-the poor woman a painting lesson while [Alfieri]466-alfieri was pacing up and down translating [Homer]467-homer and [Pindar]468-pindar with the help of a lexicon .

CHAPTER XVII .

[CASA GIANFIGLIAZZI]469-casa gianfigliazzi .

Thus things jogged on . Occasionally a grand performance of one of [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's plays enlivened [the house on [the Lung Arno]177-the lung arno]3425-the house on the lung arno . [A room]1916-a room was filled with chairs , arranged with curtains , and [a select company invited to see [the poet]3936-the poet]3439-a select company invited to see the poet for by this respectful title [he]466-alfieri appears always to have been mentioned play Saul or [Creon]361-creon , to [his]466-alfieri own admiration , but apparently less so to that of [[his]466-alfieri guests]3441-his guests . Occasionally , also , [Alfieri]466-alfieri and [[Mme .]426-mme]2983-mme . d'Albany would go for a few days to [Siena]6-siena to enjoy the conversation of [a little knot of friends of [[their]3444-their dead friend]3445-their dead friend [Gori]404-gori]3443-a little knot of friends of their dead friend gori ; [a certain [Cavaliere Bianchi]470-cavaliere bianchi]3446-a certain cavaliere bianchi , a certain [Canon Ansano Luti]471-canon luti , a certain [Alessandro Cerretani]472-alessandro cerretani , and [one or two others]3447-one or two others , who met in the house of [a charming and intellectual woman]3448-a charming and intellectual woman , [Teresa Regoli]473-teresa regoli , [daughter of [a Sienese shopkeeper]3450-a sienese shopkeeper]3449-daughter of a sienese shopkeeper , married to [another shopkeeper]3451-another shopkeeper , called [Mocenni]474-mocenni , and who was [one of [Mme]426-mme . [d'Albany 's most intimate friends]3453-d'albany 's most intimate friends]3452-one of mme . d'albany 's most intimate friends . Occasionally , also , some of these would come for a jaunt to [Florence]9-florence , when [Alfieri]466-alfieri and [the Countess]1995-the countess moved [heaven and earth]2467-heaven and earth recollecting [their]3456-their own aversion to husbands that [the Grumbler]3457-the grumbler , as [Signor Mocenni]474-mocenni was familiarly called , should be left behind , and la chère Thérèse come accompanied in characteristic Italian eighteenth - century fashion only by [[her]1995-the countess children]1612-her children and by [[her]1995-the countess cavaliere servente]3459-her cavaliere servente , [Mario Bianchi]403-mario bianchi . These were the small excitements in this curious double life of more than married routine . [Alfieri]466-alfieri , who , as [he]466-alfieri was getting old and weak in health , was growing only [the more furiously active and rigidly disciplinarian]3460-the more furiously active and rigidly disciplinarian , had determined to learn Greek , to read [all the great Greek authors]3461-all the great greek authors ; and worked away with terrific ardour at this school - boy work , crowning [his]466-alfieri efforts with a self - constituted Order of Homer , of which [he]466-alfieri [himself]466-alfieri was [the sole founder and sole member]3462-the sole founder and sole member . [He]466-alfieri was , also , having finally despatched the sacramental number of tragedies , working at an equally sacramental number of satires and comedies , absolutely unconscious of [his]466-alfieri complete deficiency in both these styles , and persuaded that [he]466-alfieri owed it to [[his]466-alfieri nation]3463-his nation to set [them]3464-them on the right road in comedy and satire , as [he]466-alfieri had set [them]3464-them on the right road in tragedy .

[A ridiculous man]3465-a ridiculous man ! Not so . [I]0-i have spoken many hard words against [Alfieri]466-alfieri ; and [I]0-i repeat that [he]466-alfieri seems to [me]0-i to have often fallen short , betrayed by [his]466-alfieri century , [his]466-alfieri vanity , [his]466-alfieri narrowness and hardness of temper , even of the ideal which [he]466-alfieri had set up for [himself]466-alfieri . But [I]0-i would not have it supposed that [I]0-i do not see the greatness of that ideal , and the nobleness of the reality out of which it arose . That [Alfieri]466-alfieri , a strange mixture of [the passionate man of spontaneous action]3466-the passionate man of spontaneous action , and of [the self - manipulating , idealising poseur]3467-the self - manipulating , idealising poseur , should have fallen short of [his]466-alfieri own ideals , is perhaps the one pathetic circumstance of [his]466-alfieri life ; the one dash of suffering and failure which makes [this heroic man]3468-this heroic man [a hero]2850-a hero . [Alfieri]466-alfieri did not probably suspect wherein [he]466-alfieri fell short of [his]466-alfieri own ideal ; [he]466-alfieri did not , could not see that [his]466-alfieri faults were narrowness of nature , and incompleteness , meanness of conception , for , if [he]466-alfieri had , [he]466-alfieri would have ceased to be narrow and ceased to be mean . But [Alfieri]466-alfieri knew that there was something very wrong about [himself]466-alfieri , [he]466-alfieri felt a deficiency , a jar in [his]466-alfieri own soul ; [he]466-alfieri felt , as [he]466-alfieri describes in the famous sonnet at the back of [Fabre]466-alfieri 's portrait of [him]466-alfieri , that [he]466-alfieri did not know whether [he]466-alfieri was noble or base , whether [he]466-alfieri was [Achilles]475-achilles or [Thersites]476-thersites .

" Uom , sei tu grande o vile ? Mori , [il saprai]4067-il saprai . "[466-alfieri] " [Man]2788-man , art [thou]2788-man noble or base ? Die , and [thou]2788-man shalt know it . "[466-alfieri] Thus wrote [Alfieri]466-alfieri , making , as usual , fame the arbiter of [his]466-alfieri worth ; and showing , even in the moment of seeking for truth about [himself]466-alfieri , how utterly and hopelessly impossible it was for [him]466-alfieri to feel it . Mean and great ; both , [I]0-i think , at once . But of the meanness , the narrowness of nature , the want of resonance of fibre , the insufficiency of moral vitality in so many things ; of [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's vanity , intolerance , injustice , indifference , hardness ; of all these peculiarities which make [the real man]3470-the real man repulsive , [the ideal man]2896-the ideal man unattractive , to [us]3472-us , [I]0-i have said more than enough , and when [we]3472-us have said all this , [Alfieri]466-alfieri still remains , for all [his]466-alfieri vanity , selfishness , meanness , narrow - mindedness , [a man of grander proportions , of finer materials , nay , even of nobler moral shape]3473-a man of grander proportions , of finer materials , nay , even of nobler moral shape , than [the vast majority of men superior to [him]466-alfieri in all these points]3474-the vast majority of men superior to him in all these points . Let [us]3472-us look at [him]466-alfieri in those last decaying years , at those studies which have seemed to [us]3472-us absurd : self - important , pedantic , almost monomaniac ; or brooding over those feelings which were , doubtless , selfish , morbid ; let [us]3472-us look at [him]466-alfieri , for , despite all [his]466-alfieri faults , [he]466-alfieri is fine . Fine in indomitable energy , in irrepressible passion . [Alfieri]466-alfieri was fifty ; [he]466-alfieri was tormented by gout ; [his]466-alfieri health was rapidly sinking ; but the sense of weakness only made [him]466-alfieri more resolute to finish the work which however mistakenly [he]466-alfieri thought it [his]466-alfieri duty to leave completed ; more determined that , having lived for so many years [a dunce]3475-a dunce , [he]466-alfieri would go down to the grave cleansed of the stain of ignorance , having read and appreciated as much of [the great writers of antiquity]3476-the great writers of antiquity as [any man who had had a well - trained youth]3477-any man who had had a well - trained youth , [a studious manhood]3478-a studious manhood . Soon after [his]466-alfieri great illness which , [I]0-i believe , changed [him]466-alfieri so much for the worse by hastening premature old age at [Colmar]146-colmar , [he]466-alfieri had written to [[his]466-alfieri friends]860-his friends at [Siena]6-siena that [he]466-alfieri had very nearly been made a fool of by [Death]406-death ; but that , having escaped , [he]466-alfieri intended , by hurrying [his]466-alfieri work , to make a fool of [Death]406-death instead . And in 1801 [he]466-alfieri wrote in [his]466-alfieri memorandum - book : " Health giving way year by year ; whence , hurrying to finish [my]466-alfieri six comedies , [I]466-alfieri make it decidedly worse . "[466-alfieri]

Soon after , as [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany later informed [[his]466-alfieri friend]1173-his friend [Caluso]332-tommaso di caluso , [Alfieri]466-alfieri , finding that [his]466-alfieri digestion had become so bad as to produce inability to work after meals , began systematically to diminish [his]466-alfieri already extremely sober allowance of food ; while , at the same time , [he]466-alfieri did not diminish the exercise , walking , riding , and driving , which [he]466-alfieri found necessary to keep [himself]466-alfieri in spirits . Knowing that death could not be far ahead , and accustomed since [his]466-alfieri youth to think that [his]466-alfieri life ought not to extend over sixty years , [Alfieri]466-alfieri was calmly and deliberately walking to meet [Death]406-death .

Calmly and deliberately ; but not heartlessly . Engrossed in [his]466-alfieri studies , devoted to [his]466-alfieri own glory as [he]466-alfieri was , [he]466-alfieri was still full of a kind of mental passion for [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany . [He]466-alfieri was unfaithful to [her]426-mme for the sake of [low women]3481-low women , [he]466-alfieri was neglectful of [her]426-mme for the sake of [his]466-alfieri work ; [he]466-alfieri did not , perhaps , receive much pleasure from [this stout , plain , prosaic lady like one of [[Rubens]477-rubens 's women]3483-rubens 's women grown old]3482-this stout , plain , prosaic lady like one of rubens 's women grown old , as [Lamartine]337-lamartine later described [her]426-mme whom [he]466-alfieri left to [her]426-mme letter - writing , [her]426-mme reading of [Kant]478-kant , of La Harpe , of [Shakespeare]371-shakespeare , of Lessing ; to [her]426-mme painting lessons , and long discussions on art with [Monsieur Fabre]479-monsieur fabre . [The woman whose presence , no longer exciting]3484-the woman whose presence , no longer exciting , was doubtless a matter of indifference to [him]466-alfieri . But , nevertheless , it seems to [me]0-i probable that [Alfieri]466-alfieri never wrote more completely from [his]466-alfieri heart than when , composing the epitaph of [the Countess]1995-the countess , [he]466-alfieri said of [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany that [she]426-mme had been loved by [him]466-alfieri more than anything on [earth]1198-earth , and held almost as [a mortal divinity]3487-a mortal divinity . " A Victorio Alferio ... ultra res omnes dilecta , et quasi mortale numen ab ipso constanter habita et observata . "[466-alfieri] For a thought begins about the year 1796 to recur throughout [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's letters and sonnets , and whenever [he]466-alfieri mentions [the Countess]1995-the countess in [his]466-alfieri autobiography ; a thought too terrible not to be genuine : [he]466-alfieri or [[his]466-alfieri beloved]2127-his beloved must die first ; [one or the other]3490-one or the other must have the horror of remaining alone , widowed of all interest on [earth]1198-earth . How constantly this idea haunted [him]466-alfieri , and with what painful vividness , is apparent from a letter which [I]0-i shall translate almost in extenso ; as , together with those few words which [I]0-i have quoted about [Gori]404-gori 's death , it shows the passionate tenderness that was hidden , like some aromatic herb beneath the Alpine snow , under the harsh exterior of [Alfieri]466-alfieri .

The letter is to [Mme . Teresa Mocenni]480-mme . teresa mocenni at [Siena]6-siena , and relates to the death of [Mario Bianchi]403-mario bianchi , who had long been [[her]1995-the countess devoted cavaliere servente]3492-her devoted cavaliere servente . " [Your]480-mme . teresa mocenni letter , "[466-alfieri] writes [Alfieri]466-alfieri , " breaks [my]466-alfieri heart . [I]466-alfieri feel the complete horror of a situation which it gives [me]466-alfieri the shivers merely to think may be [my]466-alfieri situation one day or other ; and oh ! how much worse would it not be for [me]466-alfieri , living alone , isolated from [everyone]1388-everyone , closed up in [myself]466-alfieri . O [God]272-god ! [I]466-alfieri hope [I]466-alfieri may not be [the survivor]4070-the survivor , and yet how can [I]466-alfieri wish that [[my]466-alfieri better self la parte migliore di [me]466-alfieri stesso]4071-my better self la parte migliore di me stesso should endure a situation which [I]466-alfieri [myself]466-alfieri could never have the courage to endure ? These are frightful things . [I]466-alfieri think about them very often , and sometimes [I]466-alfieri write some bad rhymes about them to ease [my]466-alfieri mind ; but [I]466-alfieri never can get accustomed either to the thought of remaining alone , nor to that of leaving [[my]466-alfieri lady]4002-my lady . "[466-alfieri] " Some opinions , "[3493-he] [he]3493-he goes on - and this hankering after Christianity on the part of [a man who had lived in eighteenth - century disbelief]3494-a man who had lived in eighteenth - century disbelief seems to bear out what [Mme]480-mme . teresa mocenni . d'Albany told [the late Gino Capponi]214-gino capponi , that had [Alfieri]466-alfieri lived much longer [he]466-alfieri would have died telling [his]466-alfieri rosary , - ' some opinions are more useful and give more satisfaction than others to a well - constituted heart . Thus , it does [our]3495-us affection much more good to believe that [[our]3495-us Mario Bianchi]3496-our mario bianchi is united to [Candido]481-candido [another dead friend]3497-another dead friend and to [Gori]404-gori , that [they]3498-they are talking and thinking about [us]3495-us , and that [we]3495-us shall meet [them]3498-they all some day , than to believe that [they]3498-they are all of [them]3498-they reduced to a handful of ashes . If such a belief as the first is repugnant to physics and to mathematical evidence , it is not , therefore , to be despised . The principal advantage and honour of [mankind]1604-mankind is that it can feel , and science teaches [us]3495-us how not to feel . Long live , therefore , ignorance and poetry , and let [us]3495-us accept the imaginary as the true . [Man]482-man subsists upon love ; love makes [him]482-man [a god]3500-a god : for [I]0-i call [God]272-god an intensely felt love , and [I]0-i call dogs , or French , which comes to the same , [the frozen philosophisers who are moved only by the fact that two and two make four]3501-the frozen philosophisers who are moved only by the fact that two and two make four . "[0-i]

[Alfieri]466-alfieri 's secret desire that [he]466-alfieri might not survive [[his]466-alfieri beloved]2127-his beloved was fulfilled sooner , perhaps , than [he]466-alfieri expected . [The eccentric figure]3503-the eccentric figure , [the tall , gaunt man , thin and pale as a ghost , with flying red hair and flying scarlet cloak]3504-the tall , gaunt man , thin and pale as a ghost , with flying red hair and flying scarlet cloak , driving [the well - known phaeton]3505-the well - known phaeton , or sauntering moodily along [the Lung Arno]177-the lung arno and through [the Boboli gardens]3506-the boboli gardens , was soon to be seen no more . As the year 1803 wore on [he]466-alfieri felt [himself]466-alfieri hard pressed by the gout ; [he]466-alfieri ate less and less , [he]466-alfieri took an enormous amount of foot exercise ; [he]466-alfieri worked madly at [his]466-alfieri memoirs , [his]466-alfieri comedies , [his]466-alfieri translations , [he]466-alfieri felt almost constantly fatigued and depressed . On the 3rd October 1803 , after [his]466-alfieri usual morning 's work , [he]466-alfieri went out for a drive in [[his]466-alfieri phaeton]3507-his phaeton ; but a strange and excessive cold , despite the still summer weather , forced [him]466-alfieri to alight and to try and warm [himself]466-alfieri by walking . Walking brought on violent internal pains , and [he]466-alfieri returned [home]1063-home with the fever on [him]466-alfieri . The next day [he]466-alfieri rose and dressed , but [he]466-alfieri was unable to eat or work , and fell into a long drowse ; the next day after that [he]466-alfieri again tried to take a walk , but returned with frightful pains . [He]466-alfieri refused to go to bed except at night , and tore off the mustard plaisters which [the doctors]3509-the doctors had placed on [his]466-alfieri feet , lest the blisters should prevent [his]466-alfieri walking ; dying , [he]466-alfieri would still not be [a sick man]3510-a sick man . The night of the 8th [he]466-alfieri was unable to sleep , and talked a great deal to [the Countess]1995-the countess , seated by [his]466-alfieri bedside , about [his]466-alfieri work , and repeated part of Hesiod in Greek to [her]1995-the countess . Accustomed for months to the idea of death , [he]466-alfieri does not seem to have guessed that it was near at hand . But the news that [he]466-alfieri was dying spread through [Florence]9-florence . [A Piedmontese lady]3512-a piedmontese lady - strangely enough [a niece of that [Marchesa de Prié]324-marchesa di prié opposite to whose windows [Alfieri]466-alfieri had renewed the device of [Ulysses]483-ulysses and the sirens by being tied to a chair]3513-a niece of that marchesa de prié opposite to whose windows alfieri had renewed the device of ulysses and the sirens by being tied to a chair - hastened to [a learned and eccentric priest]3514-a learned and eccentric priest , [a Padre Canovai , entreating [him]466-alfieri to run and offer [the dying poet the consolations of religion]3515-the dying poet the consolations of religion . [Canovai]484-alfieri , knowing that both [Alfieri]484-alfieri and [Mme . d'Albany]484-alfieri]484-alfieri were unbelievers , stoutly refused ; but later on , seized with remorse , [he]484-alfieri hurried to [the house on [the Lung Arno]177-the lung arno]3425-the house on the lung arno . Admitted into [the sick room]3517-the sick room , [he]484-alfieri came just in time to see [Alfieri]484-alfieri , who had got up during a momentary absence of [Mme]484-alfieri . d'Albany , rise from [his]484-alfieri arm - chair , lean against [his]484-alfieri bed , and , without agony or effort , unconscious " like a bird , "[1995-the countess] says [the Countess]1995-the countess , give up the ghost . It was between nine and ten of the morning of the 9th October 1803 . [Vittorio Alfieri]196-alfieri was in [his]196-alfieri fifty - fifth year .

[The Abate di Caluso]485-the abate di caluso , [the greatest friend [he]196-alfieri had , after [Gori]404-gori]3519-the greatest friend he had , after gori , was summoned from [Turin]97-turin to console [the Countess]1995-the countess and put all papers in order . [Alfieri]196-alfieri 's will , made out in 1799 , left all [his]196-alfieri books and MSS . , and whatever small property [he]196-alfieri possessed , to [the Countess Louise]486-louise d'Albany , leaving [her]486-louise to dispose of them entirely according to [her]486-louise good pleasure . Among these papers was found a short letter , undated , addressed " To [the friend [I]484-alfieri have left behind]4073-the friend i have left behind , [Tommaso di Caluso]332-tommaso di caluso , at [Turin]97-turin , "[484-alfieri] and which ran as follows : -

" As [I]484-alfieri may any day give way beneath the very serious malady which is consuming [me]484-alfieri , [I]484-alfieri have thought it wise to prepare these few lines in order that they may be given to [you]4074-you as a proof that [you]4074-you have always , to [my]484-alfieri last moment , been present to [my]484-alfieri mind and very dear to [my]484-alfieri heart . [The person whom above everything in [the world]573-the world [I]484-alfieri have most respected and loved]4075-the person whom above everything in the world i have most respected and loved , may some day tell [you]4074-you all the circumstances of [my]484-alfieri illness . [I]484-alfieri supplicate and conjure [you]4074-you to do [your]4074-you best to see and console [her]4075-the person whom above everything in the world i have most respected and loved , and to concert with [her]4075-the person whom above everything in the world i have most respected and loved the various measures which [I]484-alfieri have begged [her]4075-the person whom above everything in the world i have most respected and loved to carry out with regard to [my]484-alfieri writings .[484-alfieri]

" [I]484-alfieri will not give [you]4074-you more pain , at present , by saying any more . [I]484-alfieri have known in [you]4074-you one of [the most rare men]4077-the most rare men in every respect . [I]484-alfieri die loving and esteeming [you]4074-you , and valuing [myself]484-alfieri for [your]4074-you friendship if [I]484-alfieri have deserved it . Farewell , farewell . "[484-alfieri]

CHAPTER XVIII .

FABRE .

" [Happiness]487-happiness has disappeared out of [the world]573-the world for [me]484-alfieri , "[484-alfieri] wrote [Mme]484-alfieri . d'Albany , in January 1804 , to [[her]3521-her old friend]3522-her old friend [Canon Luti]471-canon luti , at [Siena]6-siena . " [I]471-canon luti take interest in nothing ; [the world]573-the world might be completely upset without [my]471-canon luti noticing it . [I]471-canon luti read a little , and reading is the only thing which gives [me]471-canon luti any courage , a merely artificial courage ; for when [I]471-canon luti return to [my]471-canon luti own thoughts and think of all that [I]471-canon luti have lost , [I]471-canon luti burst into tears and call [Death]406-death to [my]471-canon luti assistance , but Death will not come . O [God]272-god ! what a misfortune to lose [a person whom [one adores and venerates at the same time]4081-one adores and venerates at the same time]4080-a person whom one adores and venerates at the same time . [I]471-canon luti think that if [I]471-canon luti still had [Thérèse Mme . Mocenni]488-mme it would be some consolation ; but there is no consolation for [me]471-canon luti . [I]471-canon luti have the strength to hide [my]471-canon luti feelings before [the world]573-the world , for [no one]1470-no one could conceive [my]471-canon luti misfortune who has not felt it . A twenty - six years ' friendship with [so perfect a being]4084-so perfect a being , and then to see [him]4084-so perfect a being taken away from [me]471-canon luti at the very age when [I]471-canon luti required [him]4084-so perfect a being most . "[471-canon luti]

[Alfieri]484-alfieri [a perfect being]3523-a perfect being - [a being adored and venerated by Mme]3524-a being adored and venerated by mme . d'Albany ! [One]1590-one can not help , in reading these words , smiling sadly at the strange magic by which [Death]406-death metamorphoses [those whom [he]406-death has taken in the eyes of [the survivors]2712-the survivors]3526-those whom he has taken in the eyes of the survivors ; at the strange potions by means of which [he]406-death makes love spring up in the hearts where it has ceased to exist , saving [us]3528-us from hypocrisy by making [us]3528-us really feel what is false to [our]3528-us nature , enabling [us]3528-us to lie to [ourselves]3528-us instead of lying to [others]1434-others . [The Countess of Albany]196-alfieri 's grief was certainly most sincere ; long after all direct references to [Alfieri]196-alfieri have ceased in [her]3530-her correspondence [I]0-i am speaking principally of that with [[her]3530-her intimates]3531-her intimates at Siena , there reigns throughout [her]3530-her letters a depression , an indifference to everything , which shows that [the world]573-the world had indeed become empty in [her]3530-her eyes . But though the grief was sincere , [I]0-i greatly question whether the love was so . [Alfieri]196-alfieri had become , in [his]196-alfieri later years , the incarnation of dreary violence ; [he]196-alfieri could not have been much to [anyone]1386-anyone 's feelings ; and [Mme]484-alfieri . d'Albany 's engrossment in [her]3530-her readings , in political news and town gossip , even with [[her]3530-her most intimate correspondents]3534-her most intimate correspondents , shows that [Alfieri]484-alfieri played but a very small part in [her]3530-her colourless life . So small a part , that one may say , without fear of injustice , that [Mme]484-alfieri . d'Albany had pretty well ceased to love [him]196-alfieri at all ; for had [she]3530-her loved [him]196-alfieri , would [she]3530-her have been as indifferent , as serene as [she]3530-her appears in all [her]3530-her letters , while [the man [she]3530-her loved]3535-the man she loved was killing [himself]3535-the man she loved as certainly as if [he]3535-the man she loved were taking daily doses of a slow poison ? Love is vigilant , love is full of fears , and [Mme]484-alfieri . d'Albany was so little vigilant , so little troubled by fears , that when [this visibly dying man]3536-this visibly dying man , [this man who had prepared [his]3536-this visibly dying man epitaph , who had settled all [his]3536-this visibly dying man literary affairs , who had written the farewell letter to [[his]3536-this visibly dying man friend]1173-his friend]3537-this man who had prepared his epitaph , who had settled all his literary affairs , who had written the farewell letter to his friend , actually died , [she]3530-her would seem to have been thunder - stricken not merely by grief , but by amazement .

[The Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany was not [a selfish woman]3540-a selfish woman ; [she]527-the countess of albany had , apparently without complaining , sacrificed [her]527-the countess of albany social tastes , made [herself]527-the countess of albany [an old woman]3541-an old woman before [her]527-the countess of albany time , in acquiescence to [Alfieri]484-alfieri 's misanthropic and routinist self - engrossment ; [she]527-the countess of albany had been satisfied , or thought [herself]527-the countess of albany satisfied , with the cold , ceremonious adoration of [a man who divided [his]3536-this visibly dying man time between [his]3536-this visibly dying man studies , [his]3536-this visibly dying man horses]3542-a man who divided his time between his studies , his horses , and [his]3536-this visibly dying man intrigues with [other women]1555-other women ; but unselfish natures are often unselfish from their very thinness and coldness . [Alfieri]484-alfieri , heaven knows , had been selfish and self - engrossed ; but , perhaps because [he]484-alfieri was selfish and self - engrossed , because [he]484-alfieri was always listening to [his]484-alfieri own ideas , and nursing [his]484-alfieri own feelings , [Alfieri]484-alfieri had been passionate and loving ; and , as [we]3544-we have seen , while [he]484-alfieri seemed growing daily more fossilised , while [he]484-alfieri was at once engrossed with [his]484-alfieri own schemes of literary glory , and indifferently amusing [himself]484-alfieri by infidelities to [[his]484-alfieri lady]1719-his lady , [he]484-alfieri was then , even then , constantly haunted by the thought that , unless [he]484-alfieri [himself]484-alfieri were left behind in the terrors of widowhood , [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany would have to suffer those pangs which [he]484-alfieri felt that [he]484-alfieri [himself]484-alfieri could never endure .

[Alfieri]484-alfieri saw [the Countess]1995-the countess through the medium of [his]484-alfieri own character , and [he]484-alfieri proved mistaken . Perhaps the most terrible ironical retribution which could have fallen upon [his]484-alfieri strange egomania , would have been , had such a thing been possible , the revelation of how gratuitous had been that terrible vision of [Mme]484-alfieri . d'Albany 's life after [his]484-alfieri death ; the revelation of how little difference , after the first great grief , [his]484-alfieri loss had made in [her]1995-the countess life ; the revelation that , unnoticed , unconsciously , a successor had been prepared for [him]484-alfieri .

In a very melancholy letter , dated May 31 , 1804 , in which [Mme .]484-alfieri d'Albany expatiates to [[her]1995-the countess friend]2803-her friend [Canon Luti]471-canon luti upon the uselessness of [her]1995-the countess life , and [her]1995-the countess desire to end it , [I]0-i find this unobtrusive little sentence : " [Fabre]466-alfieri desires [his]466-alfieri compliments to [you]4085-you . [He]466-alfieri has been a great resource to [me]0-i in everything . "[0-i]

This sentence , [I]0-i think , explains what to [the enemies of [Mme]484-alfieri]3549-the enemies of mme . d'Albany has been a delightful scandal , and to [[her]1995-the countess admirers]3550-her admirers a melancholy mystery ; explains , reduces to mere very simple , conceivable , neither commendable nor shameful every - day prose , the fact that little by little the place left vacant by [Alfieri]484-alfieri was filled by [another man]1854-another man . [Italian writers]3552-italian writers , inheriting from [Giordani]215-giordani , even from [Foscolo]213-foscolo , a certain animosity against [a woman who , as soon as [Alfieri]484-alfieri was dead]3553-a woman who , as soon as alfieri was dead , became once more what nature had made [her]3553-a woman who , as soon as alfieri was dead , half French , with a great preference for French and French things - [Italian writers]3552-italian writers , [I]0-i say , have tried to turn the Fabre episode into something extremely disgraceful to [Mme]484-alfieri . d'Albany . [Massimo]489-massimo d'Azeglio , partly out of hatred to [the Countess]1995-the countess , who was rather severe and acrimonious upon [his]489-massimo youthful free - and - easiness , partly out of a desire to amuse [[his]489-massimo readers]3556-his readers , has introduced into [his]489-massimo autobiography an anecdote told [him]489-massimo by [Mme]484-alfieri . de Prié [the niece of [[Alfieri]484-alfieri 's famous Turin mistress]3558-alfieri 's famous turin mistress , and [the lady who took it upon [herself]3559-the lady who took it upon herself to send him a priest without consulting the countess to send [him]484-alfieri [a priest]931-a priest without consulting [the Countess]1995-the countess]3559-the lady who took it upon herself to send him a priest without consulting the countess , to the effect that [she]3559-the lady who took it upon herself to send him a priest without consulting the countess had watched [Fabre]466-alfieri making eyes , kissing [his]466-alfieri fingers , and generally exchanging signals with [Mme]484-alfieri . d'Albany at a party where [Alfieri]484-alfieri was present]3557-the niece of alfieri 's famous turin mistress , and the lady who took it upon herself to send him a priest without consulting the countess , to the effect that she had watched fabre making eyes , kissing his fingers , and generally exchanging signals with mme . d'albany at a party where alfieri was present . Let [those who are amused by this piece of gossip]3562-those who are amused by this piece of gossip believe it implicitly ; it does not appear to [me]0-i either amusing , or credible , or creditable to [the man who retailed it]3563-the man who retailed it . [The Florentine society of the early years of this century]3564-the florentine society of the early years of this century was , if [we]3565-we may trust the keen observation of [Stendhal]490-stendhal , almost as naïvely and openly profligate as that of [a South Sea Island village]3566-a south sea island village ; and such a society , which could talk of the things and in the way which it did , which could permit certain poetical compositions found highly characteristic by [Stendhal]490-stendhal to be publicly performed before [the ladies and gentlemen celebrated therein]3567-the ladies and gentlemen celebrated therein , such a society naturally enjoyed and believed a story like that retailed by d'Azeglio . But surely [we]3565-we may put it behind [us]3565-we , [we]3565-we who are [not Florentines of the year 1800]3568-not florentines of the year 1800 , and who can actually conceive that [a woman who had exchanged irreproachable submission to [a drunken husband]2768-a drunken husband , for legally unsanctioned , but open and faithful attachment for [a man like [Alfieri]484-alfieri]1951-a man like alfieri]3569-a woman who had exchanged irreproachable submission to a drunken husband , for legally unsanctioned , but open and faithful attachment for a man like alfieri , might at the age of fifty take a liking to [a man of thirty - five]3572-a man of thirty - five without that liking requiring a disgusting explanation . The clean explanation seems so much simpler and more consonant . [Fabre]466-alfieri had become [an intimate of [the house]769-the house]3573-an intimate of the house during [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's last years . [He]466-alfieri was French , [he]466-alfieri was [a painter]3575-a painter ; two high recommendations to [Mme]484-alfieri . d'Albany . [He]466-alfieri was , if [we]3565-we may trust [Paul Louis Courier]491-paul louis courier , who made [him]466-alfieri [the hero of a famous imaginary dialogue]3576-the hero of a famous imaginary dialogue , clever with a peculiarly French sort of cleverness ; [he]466-alfieri gave [the Countess]1995-the countess lessons in painting while [Alfieri]484-alfieri was poring over [his]484-alfieri work . The sudden death of [Alfieri]484-alfieri would bring [Fabre]466-alfieri into still closer relations with [Mme]484-alfieri . d'Albany , as [a friend of [the deceased]3579-the deceased]3578-a friend of the deceased , [the brother of [[his]466-alfieri physician]3581-his physician , and [the virtual fellow - countryman of [the Countess]1995-the countess]3582-the virtual fellow - countryman of the countess]3580-the brother of his physician , and the virtual fellow - countryman of the countess ; [he]466-alfieri would naturally be called upon to help in a hundred and one melancholy arrangements : [he]466-alfieri received [visitors]3584-visitors , answered letters , gave orders ; [he]466-alfieri probably laid [Alfieri]484-alfieri in [his]466-alfieri coffin . When all the bustle incident upon death had subsided , [Fabre]466-alfieri would remain [Mme]484-alfieri . [d'Albany 's most constant visitor]3585-d'albany 's most constant visitor . [He]466-alfieri , who had seen [Alfieri]484-alfieri at the very last , might be admitted when the door was closed to all others ; [he]466-alfieri could help to sort [the dead man]2507-the dead man 's papers ; [he]466-alfieri could , in [his]466-alfieri artistic capacity , discuss the plans for [[Alfieri]484-alfieri 's monument]3587-alfieri 's monument , write to [Canova]72-canova , correspond with [the dignitaries of [Santa Croce]493-santa croce]3588-the dignitaries of santa croce , and so forth ; come in contact with [the Countess]1995-the countess in those manifold pieces of business , in those long conversations , which seem , for a time , to keep [the dead one]3590-the dead one still in the company of [the living]3591-the living . There is nothing difficult to understand or shameful to relate in all this ; and [the friends of [the Countess]1995-the countess]3592-the friends of the countess , [delicate - minded women like [Mme]484-alfieri . [de Souza]426-mme , [puritanic - minded men like [Sismondi]466-alfieri]3595-puritanic - minded men like sismondi , misanthropic or scoffing people like [Foscolo]213-foscolo or [Paul Louis Courier]491-paul louis courier]3594-delicate - minded women like mme . de souza , puritanic - minded men like sismondi , misanthropic or scoffing people like foscolo or paul louis courier , found nothing at which to take umbrage , nothing to rage or laugh at , in this long intimacy between [a woman over fifty and [a man many years [her]3598-her junior]3597-a man many years her junior]3596-a woman over fifty and a man many years her junior ; [a man who lived at the other end of [Florence]9-florence , who if [I]0-i may trust traditions yet alive]3599-a man who lived at the other end of florence , who if i may trust traditions yet alive was supposed to be attached to [a woman well known to [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany]3600-a woman well known to mme . d'albany ; nor have [we]3601-we , [I]0-i think , any right to be less charitable than [they]3602-they .

[Louise]486-louise d'Albany , careless , like [most women of [her]486-louise day]3603-most women of her day , of social institutions , and particularly hostile to marriage , was certainly not [an impure woman]3604-an impure woman ; [her]486-louise whole life goes to prove this . But [Louise d'Albany]486-louise was [an indifferent woman]3605-an indifferent woman , and the extinction of all youthful passion and enthusiasm , the friction of a cynical world , made [her]486-louise daily more indifferent . [She]486-louise had been faithful to [Alfieri]466-alfieri , devotedly enduring one of the most unendurable of [companions]3606-companions , loving and admiring [him]466-alfieri while [he]466-alfieri was still alive . But once the pressure of that strong personality removed , the image of [Alfieri]466-alfieri appears to have been obliterated little by little from the soft wax of [her]486-louise character . [She]486-louise continued , nay instituted , a sort of cultus of [Alfieri]466-alfieri ; became , as [[his]466-alfieri beloved]2127-his beloved , [the priestess presiding over what had once been [[his]466-alfieri house]3609-his house , and was now [[his]466-alfieri temple]3610-his temple]3608-the priestess presiding over what had once been his house , and was now his temple . [The house on the Lung Arno]3425-the house on the lung arno remained the [Casa Alfieri]494-casa alfieri ; [the rooms which [he]466-alfieri had inhabited]3612-the rooms which he had inhabited were kept carefully untouched ; [his]466-alfieri books and papers were elaborated and preserved as [he]466-alfieri had left them ; [his]466-alfieri portraits were everywhere , and [visitors]3584-visitors , like [Foscolo]213-foscolo , [Courier]491-paul louis courier , [Sismondi]466-alfieri , and [the young Lamartine]3614-the young lamartine , were expected to inquire respectfully into the legend of the divinity , to ask to see [his]466-alfieri relics , as [the visitors of [a shrine]3616-a shrine]3615-the visitors of a shrine might be expected to enquire into the legend , to ask to see the relics , of [some great saint]3617-some great saint . [Mme . d'Albany]426-mme conscientiously devoted a portion of [her]426-mme time to seeing that [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's works were properly published , and that [[Alfieri]466-alfieri 's tomb in [Santa Croce]493-santa croce]3618-alfieri 's tomb in santa croce was properly executed . [She]426-mme was , as [I]0-i have said , [the priestess]3619-the priestess , [the divinely selected priestess , of the divinity]3620-the divinely selected priestess , of the divinity . But at the same time [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany gradually settled down quite comfortably and happily without [Alfieri]466-alfieri . After the first great grief was over a sense of relief may have arisen , a sense that after all " ' tis an ill wind that blows no good "[3620-the divinely selected priestess , of the divinity] ; that if [she]426-mme had lost [Alfieri]466-alfieri [she]426-mme had gained a degree of liberty , of independence , that [she]426-mme had acquired a possibility of being [herself]426-mme with all [her]426-mme tastes , the very existence of which [she]426-mme had forgotten while living under the shadow of [that strange and disagreeable great man]3621-that strange and disagreeable great man . A negative sense of compensation , of pleasure in the foreign society to which [she]426-mme could now devote [herself]426-mme ; of satisfaction in the miniature copy of [[her]426-mme former Parisian salon]3622-her former parisian salon which [she]426-mme could arrange in [[her]426-mme Florentine house]3623-her florentine house ; of comfort in a gently bustling , unconcerned , cheerful old age ; negative feelings which , perhaps as a result of [their]3624-their very repression , seem little by little to have turned to a positive feeling , a positive aversion for the past which [she]426-mme refused to regret , a positive dislike to the memory of [the man whom [she]426-mme could no longer love]3625-the man whom she could no longer love . Horrible things to say ; yet , [I]0-i fear , true . [A man such as [Alfieri]466-alfieri]3626-a man such as alfieri had permitted [himself]3626-a man such as alfieri to become , admirable in many respects , but intolerant , hard , arrogant , selfish , self - engrossed , can not really be loved ; [he]3626-a man such as alfieri may be endured as a result of long habit , [he]3626-a man such as alfieri may inflict [his]3626-a man such as alfieri personality without effort upon another ; but in order that this be the case that other must be singularly apathetic , indifferent , malleable ; and [apathetic , indifferent , and malleable people]3627-apathetic , indifferent , and malleable people , those who never resist [the living individual]3628-the living individual , rarely remember [the dead one]3590-the dead one . " [She]426-mme was , "[3630-one of the most conscientious and respectful of men] writes [one of the most conscientious and respectful of men]3630-one of the most conscientious and respectful of men , [the late Gino Capponi]214-gino capponi , " heavy in feature and form , and , if [I]3630-one of the most conscientious and respectful of men may say so , [her]426-mme mind , like [her]426-mme body , was thick - set .... Since several years [she]426-mme had ceased to love [Alfieri]466-alfieri . "[3630-one of the most conscientious and respectful of men]

[We]3631-we can not be indignant with [her]426-mme ; [she]426-mme had never pretended to be what [she]426-mme was not . A highly intellectual , literary mind , a pure temperament , a passive , rather characterless character , taking the impress of its surroundings ; passionate when [Alfieri]466-alfieri was passionate , depressed when [Alfieri]466-alfieri was depressed ; cheerful when [[Alfieri]466-alfieri 's successors]3632-alfieri 's successors , [Fabre]466-alfieri and [mankind]1604-mankind and [womankind]2746-womankind in general , were cheerful . To be angry with [such a woman]3635-such a woman would be ridiculous ; but , little as [we]3631-we may feel attached to the memory of [Alfieri]466-alfieri , [we]3631-we can not help saying to [ourselves]3631-we , " Thank [Heaven]495-heaven [he]466-alfieri never understood what [she]1995-the countess was ; thank [Heaven]495-heaven [he]466-alfieri never foresaw what [she]1995-the countess would be ! "[466-alfieri]

CHAPTER XIX .

SALON OF [THE COUNTESS]1995-the countess .

[A shadowy being]3637-a shadowy being , nay , a shadow cast in the unmistakable shape of another , so long as [Alfieri]466-alfieri was alive , [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany seems to gain consistency and form , to become [a substantive person]3639-a substantive person , only after [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's death .
