[This woman , whom , in the last ten years , [we]3631-we have seen consorting almost exclusively with [Italians]289-italians]3640-this woman , whom , in the last ten years , we have seen consorting almost exclusively with italians , and spending the greater proportion of [her]3640-this woman , whom , in the last ten years , we have seen consorting almost exclusively with italians days in solitary reading of Condillac , Lock , Kant , Mme . [de Genlis]496-de genlis , Lessing , [Milton]497-milton , everything and anything ; whose letters , exclusively as far as [I]0-i know them to [Italians of the middle classes]3641-italians of the middle classes , are full of fury against everything that is French ; [this woman , who has hitherto been a feeble replica of Alfieri]3642-this woman , who has hitherto been a feeble replica of alfieri , suddenly turns into [an extremely sociable , chatty woman of the world]3643-an extremely sociable , chatty woman of the world , and [a woman of the world who is , to all intents and purposes , French .

To be the rallying point of a very cosmopolitan , literary , but by no means unworldly society]3644-a woman of the world who is , to all intents and purposes , french . to be the rallying point of a very cosmopolitan , literary , but by no means unworldly society , seems suddenly to have become [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany 's mission ; and reading the letters copied from the Montpellier Archives , and published by [M. Saint René Taillandier]498-m. saint rené taillandier , one wonders how [this friend of Mme]3645-this friend of mme . [de Staël]426-mme , of [Sismondi]466-alfieri , of [Mme]426-mme . [de Souza]426-mme , [this hostess of [Moore]337-lamartine , of [Lamartine]337-lamartine , of [Lady Morgan]337-lamartine , of every sort of French , English , German , Russian , or polyglot creature of distinction that travelled through [Italy]3-italy in the early part of this century]337-lamartine , could ever have been [the beloved of [Alfieri]466-alfieri]3646-the beloved of alfieri , [the misanthropic correspondent of [a lot of Sienese professors]3648-a lot of sienese professors]3647-the misanthropic correspondent of a lot of sienese professors , [priests]1050-priests , and [shop - keepers]3650-shop - keepers .

The fact was that [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany could now become , so to speak , what [she]426-mme really was ; or , at least , show [herself]426-mme to be such . Worldly wise and a trifle cynical [she]426-mme had always been ; in the midst of the pages of literary review and political newspaper constituting [her]426-mme letters to [Mme]426-mme . [Mocenni]488-mme , [Canon Luti]471-canon luti and [[Alessandro Cerretani]472-alessandro cerretani of [Siena]6-siena]3651-alessandro cerretani of siena , there is a good deal of mere personal gossip , stories of [[married women]3652-married women 's lovers]3653-married women 's lovers , [[married men]3654-married men 's mistresses]3655-married men 's mistresses , domestic bickerings , c. , interspersed with very plain - spoken and according to [our]3656-our ideas slightly demoralised moralisings . It is evident that this was not [a woman to shrink from the reality of things]3657-a woman to shrink from the reality of things , to take [the world]573-the world in disgust , to expect too much of [[her]426-mme acquaintances]3659-her acquaintances . On the other hand these letters of the Alfieri period show [Mme]488-mme . d'Albany to have been decidedly [a good - natured and friendly woman]3660-a good - natured and friendly woman . [She]426-mme has the gift of getting [people]927-people to trust [her]426-mme with [their]927-people little annoyances and grievances ; [she]426-mme is constantly administering sympathy to [Mme]488-mme . [Mocenni]488-mme for the tiresomeness and stupidity and harshness of [[her]426-mme husband]790-her husband ; [she]426-mme keeps up a long correspondence , recommending books , correcting French exercises , exhorting to study and to virtue particularly to abstinence from gambling , encouraging , helping [Mme]488-mme . [Mocenni]488-mme 's boy Vittorio . [She]426-mme is clearly [a woman who enjoys hearing about other folk]3663-a woman who enjoys hearing about other folk 's concerns , enjoys taking an interest in [them]927-people , sympathising and , if possible , assisting [them]927-people .

These two qualities , a dose of cynical worldliness , sufficient to prevent all squeamishness and that coldness and harshness which springs from expecting [people]927-people to be better than [they]927-people are , and a dose of kindliness , helpfulness , pleasure in knowing the affairs and feelings and troubles of [others]1434-others ; these two qualities are , [I]0-i should think , the essentials for [a woman who would keep a salon in the old sense of the word]3666-a woman who would keep a salon in the old sense of the word , who would be the centre of [a large but decidedly select society]3667-a large but decidedly select society , [the friend and correspondent of many and various people possessed of more genius or more character]3668-the friend and correspondent of many and various people possessed of more genius or more character than [herself]426-mme . [Such a woman]3635-such a woman , thanks to [her]3635-such a woman easy - going knowledge of [the world]573-the world , and to [her]3635-such a woman cordial curiosity and helpfulness , is [the friend of [the most hostile people]3672-the most hostile people]3671-the friend of the most hostile people ; and [she]3635-such a woman is so completely satisfied with , and interested in , [the particular person with whom [she]3635-such a woman is talking or to whom [she]3635-such a woman is writing]3673-the particular person with whom she is talking or to whom she is writing , that [that particular person]3674-that particular person really believes [himself]3675-himself or [herself]3676-herself to be [[her]3635-such a woman chief friend]3677-her chief friend , and overlooks the scores of [other chief friends , viewed with exactly the same degree of interest , and treated with the same degree of cordiality all round]3678-other chief friends , viewed with exactly the same degree of interest , and treated with the same degree of cordiality all round . [The world]573-the world is apt to like [such women]3680-such women , as such women like it , and to say of [them]3680-such women that there must be an immense richness of character , an extraordinary power of bringing out the best qualities of [every individual]3681-every individual , in [a woman who can drive such complicated teams of friends]3682-a woman who can drive such complicated teams of friends . But is it not more probable that the secret of such success is poverty of personality rather than richness ; and that [so many people]3683-so many people receive a share of friendship , of sympathy , of comprehension , because [each]3684-each receives only very little ; because [the universal friend]3685-the universal friend is too obtuse to [mind]3686-mind [anybody]3687-anybody 's faults , and too obtuse , also , to mind [anybody]3687-anybody 's great virtues ? In short , do not [such women]3680-such women pay [people]927-people merely in the paper money of attention , which can be multiplied at pleasure , rather than in the gold coin of sympathy , of which the supply is extremely small ?

Be this as it may , [Mme]488-mme . d'Albany , after having been , in the earlier period of [her]488-mme life , essentially [the woman who had [one friend]3692-one friend , who let the wax of [her]488-mme nature be stamped in one clear die , became , in the twenty years which separate the death of [Alfieri]466-alfieri from [her]488-mme own]3691-the woman who had one friend , who let the wax of her nature be stamped in one clear die , became , in the twenty years which separate the death of alfieri from her own , pre - eminently [the woman with [many friends]3694-many friends]3693-the woman with many friends , a blurred personality in which [we]3695-we recognise traces of the mental effigy of [many and various people]3696-many and various people . [Mme]488-mme . d'Albany was , therefore , in superficial sympathy with nearly [everyone]1388-everyone , and in deep antagonism with [no one]1470-no one : [she]488-mme was the ideal of [the woman who keeps a literary and political salon]3699-the woman who keeps a literary and political salon . At that time especially , when [Italy]3-italy was visited only by [people of a certain social standing]3700-people of a certain social standing , society was carried on by a most complicated system of letters of introduction , and [everyone of any note]3701-everyone of any note brought a letter to [Mme]488-mme . d'Albany . " La grande lanterne magique passe tout par votre salon , "[466-alfieri] wrote [Sismondi]466-alfieri to [the Countess]1995-the countess ; and the metaphor could not be truer . [Writers]3703-writers and [artists]3004-artists , [beautiful women]3705-beautiful women , [diplomatists]1397-diplomatists , [journalists]3327-journalists , [pedants]3708-pedants , [men of science]3709-men of science , [women of fashion]1581-women of fashion , [Châteaubriand]423-châteaubriand and [Mme]488-mme . [de Staël]426-mme , [Lamartine]337-lamartine and [Paul Louis Courier]491-paul louis courier , [Mme]426-mme . [Récamier]499-récamier and [the Duchess of [Devonshire]182-devonshire]3711-the duchess of devonshire , [Canova]72-canova and [Foscolo]213-foscolo , and [Sismondi]466-alfieri and [Werner]500-werner , the whole intellectual world of [the Empire]590-the empire and the Restoration , all seem to be projected , figures now flitting past like shadows , now dwelling long , clear and coloured , upon the rather colourless and patternless background of [Mme]426-mme . [d'Albany 's house]3713-d'albany 's house ; nay , of [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany [herself]426-mme . [Such readers]3714-such readers as may wish to have [all these figures]3715-all these figures , remembered or forgotten , pointed out to [them]3715-all these figures , called by [their]3715-all these figures right names and titles , treated with the perfect impartiality of a valet de place expounding monuments , or of [a chamberlain announcing [the guests]3717-the guests at a levée]3716-a chamberlain announcing the guests at a levée , may refer to the two volumes of [Baron Alfred von Reumont]193-baron von reumont ; and [such readers]3714-such readers and [I]0-i hope [they]3714-such readers are more numerous as may wish to examine some of the nobler and more interesting of these projected shadows of [men]711-men and [women]547-women , may read with pleasure and profit the letters of [Sismondi]466-alfieri , [Bonstetten]280-bonstetten , [Mme]426-mme . [de Souza]426-mme and [Mme]426-mme . [de Staël]426-mme to [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany , and the interesting pages of criticism in which they have been imbedded by [M. St.-René Taillandier]501-m. st.-rené taillandier . With regard to [myself]0-i , [I]0-i feel that the time and space which have been given [me]0-i in order to analyse or reconstruct the curious type and curious individual called [Louise]486-louise d'Albany are both nearly exhausted ; and [I]0-i can therefore select to dwell upon , of [these many magic - lantern men]3722-these many magic - lantern men and [women]547-women , of [these friends of [the Countess]1995-the countess]3724-these friends of the countess , only two , because [they]3726-they seem to [me]0-i to exemplify [my]0-i remarks about the friendship of [a woman whose vocation it is to have [many friends]3694-many friends]3727-a woman whose vocation it is to have many friends . The two are [Sismondi]466-alfieri and [Foscolo]213-foscolo .

Two or three years after [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's death , somewhere about the year 1806 or 1807 , there was introduced to [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany a sort of half - Italian , half - French [Swiss]502-swiss , [a man young in years and singularly young]3729-a man young in years and singularly young - with the peculiar earnestness , gravity , purity which belongs sometimes to youth - in spirit , [Jean Charles Léonard Simonde de Sismondi]399-sismondi . Quietly idealistic , with one of [those northern , eminently Protestant minds which imagine the principle of good]3730-those northern , eminently protestant minds which imagine the principle of good to be more solemnly serious , the principle of evil more vainly negative , than is , alas , the case in [this world]962-this world - [M. de Sismondi]466-alfieri , full of the heroism of mediæval [Italy]3-italy which [he]466-alfieri was studying with a view to [his]466-alfieri great work , came to [the house of [Alfieri]466-alfieri]3732-the house of alfieri , to [the woman whom [Alfieri]466-alfieri had loved]3733-the woman whom alfieri had loved , as to [things most reverend and almost sacred]3734-things most reverend and almost sacred . [The Countess of Albany]196-alfieri received [him]466-alfieri very well ; and this good reception , the motherly cordiality of [this woman]1716-this woman with that light in [her]1716-this woman hazel eyes , that welcoming graciousness in the lines of [her]1716-this woman mouth , which [Lamartine]337-lamartine has charmingly described , with the " parole suave , manières sans apprêt , familiarité rassurante , "[1716-this woman] " which made one doubt whether [she]1716-this woman was descending to the level of [[her]1716-this woman visitor]4086-her visitor , or raising [him]466-alfieri up to [her]1716-this woman own , "[1716-this woman] - this reception by [this woman , who was , moreover , still surrounded by a halo of Alfieri]3736-this woman , who was , moreover , still surrounded by a halo of alfieri 's glory , fairly conquered the heart , the pure , warm , grave and truthful heart of [young Sismondi]466-alfieri . [He]466-alfieri saw [her]1716-this woman often , on [his]466-alfieri way between [Geneva]184-geneva , whither [he]466-alfieri was called by [his]466-alfieri family business and [his]466-alfieri lectures , and [Pescia]185-pescia , [[a little town]3737-a little town nestled among the olives of [the Lucchese Apennine]186-the lucchese apennine , where [he]466-alfieri was for ever sighing to join [[his]466-alfieri mother]1610-his mother , to resume [his]466-alfieri walks]3738-a little town nestled among the olives of the lucchese apennine , where he was for ever sighing to join his mother , to resume his walks , [his]466-alfieri readings with [this noble old woman]3740-this noble old woman . [Florence]9-florence , [the house on the Lung Arno]3425-the house on the lung arno , had an almost romantic fascination for [Sismondi]466-alfieri ; those passing visits , at intervals of months , when [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany would devote [herself]426-mme entirely to [the traveller]3742-the traveller , sit chatting , or rather [we]3743-we feel that listening to [the young man]2169-the young man 's enthusiastic talk about liberty , letters , and philanthropy , about [Alfieri]466-alfieri and [Mme]426-mme . [de Staël]426-mme , enabled [Sismondi]466-alfieri to make up for [himself]466-alfieri a sort of half - [imaginary Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri , to whom [he]466-alfieri poured out all [his]466-alfieri hopes and fears in innumerable letters , for whom [he]466-alfieri longed as alas ! [we]3743-we perhaps long only for the phantoms of [our]3743-we own creating]196-alfieri . That [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany was , after all , [a shallow woman]3745-a shallow woman ; that [she]426-mme adored [a mediocre [M. Fabre]466-alfieri to whom [Sismondi]466-alfieri invariably sent respectful messages and half disliked the memory of [Alfieri]466-alfieri]466-alfieri ; that [she]426-mme had called [Mme]426-mme . [de Staël]426-mme , [[Sismondi]466-alfieri 's goddess]3746-sismondi 's goddess , about whom [he]466-alfieri was for ever expatiating , " [a mad woman who always wants to inspire passions , and feels nothing]4087-a mad woman who always wants to inspire passions , and feels nothing , and makes [[her]426-mme readers]4088-her readers feel nothing "[426-mme] [I]0-i am quoting from an unpublished letter at [Siena]6-siena ; that [she]426-mme preferred despotism on the whole to liberty , and had no particular belief or interest in the heroic things of the present and future ; that [she]426-mme was [a lover of gossip and scandal]3747-a lover of gossip and scandal , sometimes as [Gino Capponi]214-gino capponi says hard and disagreeable ; that [she]426-mme inspired [some men]1638-some men , like d'Azeglio and [Giordani]215-giordani , with a positive repulsion as [a vulgar - minded , spiteful , meddlesome old thing]3749-a vulgar - minded , spiteful , meddlesome old thing ; that there should be any other Mme . d'Albany than the one of [his]466-alfieri noble fancy , than [the woman whose image fashioned by [himself]466-alfieri [he]466-alfieri loved to unite with the image of [[his]466-alfieri own sweet , serious , [shy , noble - minded mother]3752-shy , noble - minded mother]3751-his own sweet , serious , shy , noble - minded mother]3750-the woman whose image fashioned by himself he loved to unite with the image of his own sweet , serious , shy , noble - minded mother : all these things [M. [de Sismondi]466-alfieri , who never guessed [himself]3753-m. de sismondi , who never guessed himself to be otherwise than the most unpoetical and practical of men to be otherwise than the most unpoetical and practical of [men]711-men]3753-m. de sismondi , who never guessed himself to be otherwise than the most unpoetical and practical of men , never dreamed of . [So Sismondi]466-alfieri went on writing to [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany , pouring out [his]466-alfieri grief at [Mme]426-mme . [de Staël]426-mme 's persecutions , [his]466-alfieri schemes of general improvement , all the interests which filled [his]466-alfieri gentle , austere , and enthusiastic mind . 1814 came , and 1815 . [Sismondi]466-alfieri had always hated , with the hatred of [an Italian mediæval patriot]3755-an italian mediæval patriot , and the hatred of [an eighteenth - century philanthropist]3756-an eighteenth - century philanthropist , the despotism , the bureaucratic levelling , the great military slaughters of [Napoleon]503-napoleon ; but when [he]466-alfieri saw [Napoleon]503-napoleon succeeded by the inept and wicked governments of the Restoration , [his]466-alfieri heart seemed to burst . [A Swiss]3757-a swiss , scarcely acquainted with [France]35-france , the passion for the principles of liberty and good sense and progress which [France]35-france had represented , the passion for [France]35-france itself , burst out in [him]3757-a swiss with generous ardour . [This man]2278-this man suffered intensely at what to [him]3757-a swiss , as to [Byron]504-byron and to [Shelley]505-shelley [we]3759-we must recollect the introduction of the Revolt of [Islam]187-islam , seemed the battle between progress and retrogression ; and suffered all the more as [he]2278-this man was too pure and just - minded not to feel the impossibility of complete sympathy with either side . [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany answered [his]466-alfieri letters with Olympic serenity . What was it to [her]426-mme which got the upper hand ? [She]426-mme was by this time one of those placid mixtures of optimism and pessimism which do not expect good to triumph , simply because [they]3760-they do not care whether good does triumph . [Sismondi]466-alfieri , in [his]466-alfieri adoration of [her]426-mme , thought this might be the result of a superior magnanimity of character ; yet [he]466-alfieri kept conjuring [her]426-mme to take an interest in the tragedy which was taking place before [her]426-mme eyes . If [she]426-mme will take no interest , will not [Fabre]466-alfieri ? " Does [M. Fabre]466-alfieri not feel [himself]466-alfieri turning French again ? "[466-alfieri] writes [Sismondi]466-alfieri , and there is a pathetic insistency in the question . [Fabre]466-alfieri thought of [his]466-alfieri pictures , [his]466-alfieri collections of antiques , perhaps of [his]466-alfieri dinner ; of anything save [France]35-france and political events . [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany smiled serenely , and chaffed [Sismondi]466-alfieri a little for [his]466-alfieri political passions . [Sismondi]466-alfieri , of [all men the most loyal to the idea [he]466-alfieri had formed of [[his]466-alfieri friends]860-his friends]3761-all men the most loyal to the idea he had formed of his friends , seems never to have permitted [himself]466-alfieri to see [the real woman]3763-the real woman , the real abyss of indifference , beneath [his]466-alfieri ideal [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany . But there are few things more pathetic , [I]0-i think , than the letters of [this enthusiastic man]3764-this enthusiastic man to [this cold woman]3765-this cold woman ; than the belief of [Sismondi]466-alfieri - writing that the retrograde measures of which [he]466-alfieri reads in the papers give [him]466-alfieri fits of fever , that the post days on which [he]466-alfieri expects political news are days of frenzied expectation - in the moral fibre , the faculty for indignation , of [this pleasant , indifferent , cynical quasi - widow of Alfieri]3766-this pleasant , indifferent , cynical quasi - widow of alfieri .

The story of [the Countess]1995-the countess and [Foscolo]213-foscolo is an even sadder instance of those melancholy little psychological dramas which go on , unseen to [the world]573-the world , in [a man]1698-a man 's soul ; little dramas without outward events , without deaths or partings or such - like similar visible catastrophes , but the action of which is the slow murder of an affection , of an ideal , of a belief in the loyalty , sympathy , and comprehension of [another]3969-another . The character and history of [Ugo Foscolo]213-foscolo , like [Chénier]426-mme , [half a Greek in blood]3771-half a greek in blood , and [more than half a Greek]3772-more than half a greek in passionate love of beauty and indomitable love of liberty , are amongst the most interesting in Italian literature ; and [I]0-i regret that [I]0-i can say but little of them in [this place]3773-this place . Reviewing [his]213-foscolo brief life , [his]213-foscolo long career from the moment when , scarcely more than [a boy]1599-a boy , [he]213-foscolo had entered the service of liberty as [a soldier]3775-a soldier , [a political writer]3776-a political writer , and [a poet]1727-a poet , only to taste the bitterness of the betrayal of [Campo Formio]506-campo formio , [he]213-foscolo wrote , in 1823 , from [London]44-london , where [he]213-foscolo was slowly dying , to [[his]213-foscolo sister]1968-his sister [Rubina]507-rubina : " [I]213-foscolo am now nearly forty - six ; and [you]507-rubina , although younger than [myself]213-foscolo , can recollect how miserable , how unquiet and uncertain [our]4089-our lives have always been ever since [our]4089-our childhood . "[213-foscolo] [Poor , vain , passionate and proud]3779-poor , vain , passionate and proud , torn between the selfish impulses of an exactingly sensuous and imaginative nature , and the rigid sense of duty of a heroic and generous mind , [Ugo Foscolo]213-foscolo was one of [the earliest and most genuine victims of that sickness of disappointed hope and betrayed enthusiasm]3780-the earliest and most genuine victims of that sickness of disappointed hope and betrayed enthusiasm , of that Weltschmerz of which personal misfortunes seemed as but the least dreadful part , that came upon the noblest minds after the Revolution , and which [he]213-foscolo has painted , with great energy and truthfulness , in [his]213-foscolo early novel [Jacopo Ortis]508-jacopo ortis . [His]213-foscolo career broken by [his]213-foscolo determination never to come to terms with any sort of baseness , [his]213-foscolo happiness destroyed by political disappointment , literary feuds , and a number of love affairs into which [his]213-foscolo weaker , more passionate and vainer , yet not more ungenerous temper was for ever embroiling [him]213-foscolo , [Foscolo]213-foscolo came to [Florence]9-florence , ill and miserable , in the year 1812 . [The Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany , recognising in [him]213-foscolo a something - a mixture of independence , of passion , of vanity , of truthfulness , of pose - which resembled [Alfieri]466-alfieri in [his]466-alfieri earlier days though , as [she]527-the countess of albany was unable to see , a nobler [Alfieri]466-alfieri , wider - minded , warmer - hearted , born in [a nobler civilization]3782-a nobler civilization and destined to give to [Italy]3-italy a nobler example , the pattern for [her]527-the countess of albany Leopardi , than [Alfieri]466-alfieri had been able to give - [the Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]527-the countess of albany received [Foscolo]213-foscolo well . [His]213-foscolo letters are full of allusions to the hours which [he]213-foscolo spent seated at the little round table in [Mme]426-mme . [d'Albany 's drawing - room]3784-d'albany 's drawing - room , opposite to the " Muse "[213-foscolo] newly bought of [Canova]72-canova , narrating to [her]527-the countess of albany [his]213-foscolo many and tangled love affairs ; love affairs in which [he]213-foscolo left [his]213-foscolo heart on all the briars , and in which , however , by an instinct which shows the very nobleness of [his]213-foscolo nature , [he]213-foscolo seems to have been impelled rather towards women whom [he]213-foscolo must love sincerely and unhappily , than towards [Marchesa di Prié]324-marchesa di prié and [Lady Ligonier]323-lady ligonier , like [Alfieri]466-alfieri ; love affairs in which , alas , there was also a good dose of the vanity of [a poet]1727-a poet and [a notorious beau]3786-a notorious beau . [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany , as [we]3787-we have seen , loved gossip ; and , being [a kind , helpful woman]3788-a kind , helpful woman , [she]426-mme also sincerely liked becoming the confidant of [other folk]1437-other folk 's woes . [She]426-mme took a real affection for this strange [Foscolo]213-foscolo . [Foscolo]213-foscolo , in return , ill , sore of heart , solitary , gradually got to love [this gentle , sympathising Countess]3790-this gentle , sympathising countess with a sort of filial devotion , but a filial devotion into which there entered also somewhat of the feeling of [a wounded man]3791-a wounded man towards [[his]3791-a wounded man nurse]3792-his nurse , of the feeling of [a devout man towards [[his]3791-a wounded man Madonna]3794-his madonna]3793-a devout man towards his madonna .

[His]213-foscolo letters are full of this feeling : " [[My]213-foscolo friend]516-my friend and not [the friend of [my]213-foscolo good fortune]4091-the friend of my good fortune , "[213-foscolo] [he]213-foscolo writes to [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany in 1813 , " [I]213-foscolo seem to have left [home]1063-home , [mother]4093-mother , [friends]857-friends , and almost [the person dearest to [my]213-foscolo heart]4095-the person dearest to my heart in leaving [Florence]9-florence . "[213-foscolo] Again , " [I]213-foscolo had in [you]426-mme , [mia Signora]359-a signora maria pizzelli , [a friend]3924-a friend and [a mother]657-a mother ; [a person]2443-a person , in short , such as no name can express , but such as sufficed to console [me]213-foscolo in the miseries which are perhaps incurable and interminable . "[213-foscolo] [Her]426-mme letters are a real ray of sunlight in [his]213-foscolo gloomy life , they are ' so full of graciousness , and condescension and benevolence and love . [I]0-i venture to use this last word , because [I]0-i feel the sentiment which it expresses in [myself]0-i towards [you]3795-you . "[0-i]

[His]213-foscolo health , [his]213-foscolo work , [his]213-foscolo money - matters , [his]213-foscolo love - affairs , were all getting into a more and more lamentable condition , in which [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany 's sympathy came as a blessing , when the catastrophes of 1814 and 1815 , which to [Italy]3-italy meant the commencement of a state of degradation and misery much more intolerable and hopeless than any previous one , came and drowned the various bitternesses of poor [Foscolo]213-foscolo 's life in a sea of bitterness . " [Italy]3-italy , "[213-foscolo] wrote [Foscolo]213-foscolo to [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany in 1814 , " is a corpse ; and a corpse which must not be touched if the stench thereof is not to be made more horrible . And yet [I]213-foscolo see certain crazy creatures fantasticating ways of bringing [her]426-mme to life ; for [myself]213-foscolo , [I]213-foscolo should wish [her]426-mme to be buried with [myself]213-foscolo , and overwhelmed by [the seas]4099-the seas , or that [some new Phaeton]4100-some new phaeton should precipitate upon [her]426-mme the flaming heavens , so that the ashes should be scattered to the four winds , and that [the nations coming and to come]4101-the nations coming and to come should forget the infamy of [our]3796-our times . Amen . "[213-foscolo]

How strongly [we]3796-our feel in this outburst that , despite [his]213-foscolo despair , or perhaps on account of it , [Foscolo]213-foscolo is [himself]213-foscolo one of those " crazy creatures fantasticating ways of bringing [Italy]3-italy to life ! "[213-foscolo] But [the Countess]1995-the countess did not understand ; [she]1995-the countess could conceive liking [Bonaparte]509-bonaparte and serving [him]509-bonaparte , or liking the Restoration and serving it ; but to love [an abstract [Italy]3-italy which did not yet exist]3798-an abstract italy which did not yet exist , to hate [equally all those who deprived it of freedom , that was not within [her]1995-the countess comprehension]3799-equally all those who deprived it of freedom , that was not within her comprehension . And as [she]1995-the countess could not comprehend this feeling , the mainspring of [Foscolo]213-foscolo 's soul , so [she]1995-the countess could understand of [Foscolo]213-foscolo only the slighter , meaner things : [his]213-foscolo troubles and intrigues , [his]213-foscolo loves and quarrels . The moment came when the grief of miscomprehension was revealed to [poor Foscolo]213-foscolo ; when [he]213-foscolo saw how little [he]213-foscolo was understood by [this woman whom [he]213-foscolo loved as [a mother]657-a mother]3800-this woman whom he loved as a mother . [Foscolo]213-foscolo had refused , latterly , to serve [Napoleon]503-napoleon ; [he]213-foscolo refused , also , to serve [the Austrians]510-the austrians . Hated for [his]213-foscolo independent ways both by [the Bonapartists]511-the bonapartists and [the reactionists]3802-the reactionists , surrounded by [spies]3803-spies , [he]213-foscolo was forced to quit [Italy]3-italy never to return . [He]213-foscolo wrote to explain [his]213-foscolo motives to [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany . [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany wrote back in a way which showed that [she]426-mme believed the assertions of [[Foscolo]213-foscolo 's enemies]3804-foscolo 's enemies ; that [she]426-mme ascribed to cowardice , to meanness , to a base desire to make [himself]213-foscolo conspicuous , the self - inflicted exile which [he]213-foscolo had taken upon [him]213-foscolo : a letter which [the editor of [Foscolo]213-foscolo 's correspondence]3805-the editor of foscolo 's correspondence describes to [us]3806-us in one word - unworthy .

This letter came upon [Foscolo]213-foscolo like a thunder - clap . " So thus , "[213-foscolo] [he]213-foscolo wrote to [the Countess]1995-the countess in August 1815 , " generosity and justice are banished even from nobler souls . [Your]1995-the countess letter , [Signora Contessa]512-signora contessa , grieves [me]213-foscolo , and confers upon [me]213-foscolo , at the same time , two advantages : it diminishes suddenly the perpetual nostalgia which [I]213-foscolo have felt for [Florence]9-florence , and it affords [me]213-foscolo an occasion to try [my]213-foscolo strength of spirit .... [My]213-foscolo hatred for the tyranny with which [Bonaparte]509-bonaparte was oppressing [Italy]3-italy does not imply that [I]213-foscolo should love [the house of [Austria]174-austria]4102-the house of austria . The difference for [me]213-foscolo was that [I]213-foscolo hoped that [Bonaparte]509-bonaparte 's ambition might bring about , if not the independence of [Italy]3-italy , at least such magnanimous deeds as might raise [the Italians]3347-the italians ; whereas [the regular government of [Austria]174-austria]4104-the regular government of austria precludes all such hopes . [I]213-foscolo should be mad and infamous if [I]213-foscolo desired for [Italy]3-italy , which requires peace at any price , new disorders and slaughterings ; but [I]213-foscolo should consider [myself]213-foscolo madder still and more infamous if , having despised to serve [the foreigner who has fallen]4105-the foreigner who has fallen , [I]213-foscolo should accept to serve the foreigner who has succeeded .... But if [your]4106-your accusation of inconstancy is unjust , [your]4106-your accusation that [I]213-foscolo want to ' passer pour original ' is actually offensive and mocking . "[213-foscolo]

Later , in [his]3808-his solitary wanderings , [Foscolo]213-foscolo 's heart seems to have melted towards [[his]3808-his former friend]3809-his former friend ; [he]3808-his wrote [her]3809-his former friend one or two letters , conciliating , friendly , but how different from the former ones ! [The Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri , whom [he]3808-his had loved and trusted]196-alfieri , was dead ; [the woman who remained]3810-the woman who remained was dear to [him]3808-his as [a mere relic of that dead ideal]3811-a mere relic of that dead ideal .

Such is the story of [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany 's friendship for [two of the noblest spirits , [Sismondi]466-alfieri and [Foscolo]213-foscolo , of [their]3812-two of the noblest spirits , sismondi and foscolo , of their day day]3812-two of the noblest spirits , sismondi and foscolo , of their day ; [the noblest]3813-the noblest , the one in [his]3808-his pure austerity , the other in [his]3808-his magnanimous passionateness , that ever crossed the path of [the beloved of [Alfieri]466-alfieri]3646-the beloved of alfieri .

CHAPTER XX .

SANTA CROCE .

With [[her]426-mme other friends]3815-her other friends , who gave less of [their]3815-her other friends own heart and asked less of [hers]426-mme , [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany was more fortunate . [She]426-mme contrived to connect [herself]426-mme by correspondence with [the most eminent men]3816-the most eminent men and [women of the most different views and tempers]3817-women of the most different views and tempers ; [she]426-mme made [[her]426-mme salon]1927-her salon in [Florence]9-florence , as [M. St. René Taillandier]195-m. st. rené taillandier has observed , a sort of adjunct to [the cosmopolitan salon of [Mme]426-mme . de Staël at [Coppet]188-coppet]3819-the cosmopolitan salon of mme . de staël at coppet . [Her]426-mme efforts in so doing were crowned with the very highest success . In 1809 [Napoleon]503-napoleon requested [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany to leave [Florence]9-florence for [Paris]4-paris , where , [he]503-napoleon added with a mixture of brutality and sarcasm , [she]426-mme might indulge [her]426-mme love of art in [the new galleries of [the Louvre]3821-the louvre]3820-the new galleries of the louvre , and where [her]426-mme social talents could no longer spread dissatisfaction with [his]503-napoleon government , as was the case in [Italy]3-italy .

[The one year 's residence in [Paris]4-paris , which [Napoleon]503-napoleon 's jealous meddlesomeness forced upon [her]426-mme]3822-the one year 's residence in paris , which napoleon 's jealous meddlesomeness forced upon her , was , in itself , a very enjoyable time , spent with [the friends whom [she]426-mme had left in ' 93 , and with a whole host of new ones whom [she]426-mme had made since]3823-the friends whom she had left in ' 93 , and with a whole host of new ones whom she had made since . [She]426-mme returned to [Florence]9-florence with [a larger number of [devoted correspondents]3825-devoted correspondents]3824-a larger number of devoted correspondents than ever ; [[her]426-mme salon]1927-her salon became more and more brilliant ; and when , after [Waterloo]513-waterloo , the whole English world of politics , fashion , and letters poured on to [the Continent]3827-the continent , [[her]426-mme house]1717-her house became , as [Sismondi]466-alfieri said , the wall on which [all the most brilliant figures of the great magic lantern]3829-all the most brilliant figures of the great magic lantern were projected .

Thus , seeing [crowds of the most distinguished and delightful people]3830-crowds of the most distinguished and delightful people , receiving [piles of the most interesting and adoring letters , happy , self - satisfied , Mme . d'Albany]3831-piles of the most interesting and adoring letters , happy , self - satisfied , mme . d'albany grew into [an old woman]3541-an old woman . Every evening until ten , [the rooms of [the Casa Alfieri]3834-the casa alfieri]3833-the rooms of the casa alfieri were thrown open ; [the servants in [the Stuart liveries]3836-the stuart liveries]3835-the servants in the stuart liveries ushered in [the guests]3717-the guests , the tea was served in those famous services emblazoned with the royal arms of [England]13-england . [The Countess]1995-the countess had not yet abandoned [her]1995-the countess regal pretensions ; for all [her]1995-the countess condescending cordiality towards [the elect]3839-the elect , [she]1995-the countess could assume airs of social superiority which [some folk]3840-some folk scarcely brooked , and [she]1995-the countess was evidently pleased when , half in earnest , [Mme]426-mme . [de Staël]426-mme addressed [her]1995-the countess as " [[My]426-mme dear]4107-my dear Sovereign , "[426-mme] " [[My]1995-the countess dear Queen]4108-my dear queen , "[1995-the countess] and even when [that vulgar woman of genius]3841-that vulgar woman of genius , [Lady Morgan]337-lamartine , made a buffoonish scene about [the " dead usurper]4109-the " dead usurper , "[426-mme] on the death of [George III]301-george iii . But [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany [herself]1995-the countess was getting to look and talk less and less like [a queen]673-a queen , either [the Queen of [Great Britain]40-great britain]4027-the queen of great britain or [the Queen of Hearts]1166-the queen of hearts ; [she]1995-the countess was fat , squat , snub , dressed with an eternal red shawl now the property of [an intimate friend of [mine]3846-mine]3845-an intimate friend of mine , in a dress extremely suggestive of [an old house - keeper]3847-an old house - keeper . [She]1995-the countess was , when not doing [the queen]3022-the queen , cordial , cheerful in manner , loving to have [children]548-children about [her]1995-the countess , to spoil [them]548-children with cakes and see [them]548-children romp and dance ; free and easy , cynical , [Rabelaisian]514-rabelaisian , if [I]0-i may use the expression , as [such mongrel Frenchwomen]3850-such mongrel frenchwomen are apt to grow with years ; the nick - name which [she]1995-the countess gave to [a member of [a family]969-a family where the tradition of [her]1995-the countess and [her]1995-the countess ways still persists]3851-a member of a family where the tradition of her and her ways still persists , reveals a wealth of coarse fun which is rather strange in [a woman who was once [the Beatrice]3854-the beatrice or Laura of [a poet]1727-a poet]3853-a woman who was once the beatrice or laura of a poet . [She]1995-the countess was active , mentally and bodily , never giving up [her]1995-the countess multifarious reading , [her]1995-the countess letter - writing ; never foregoing [her]1995-the countess invariable morning walk , in a big bonnet and the legendary red shawl , down [the Lung Arno]177-the lung arno and into [the Cascine]171-the cascine .

Such was [Louise of Stolberg]233-louise , [Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]1122-countess of albany , widow of [Prince Charles Edward]204-charles edward , widow , in a sense , of [the poet [Vittorio Alfieri]196-alfieri]3857-the poet vittorio alfieri ; and such , at the age of seventy - two , did death overtake [her]1995-the countess , on the 29th January 1824 . [[Her]1995-the countess property]3858-her property [she]1995-the countess bequeathed to [Fabre]466-alfieri whom a false rumour had called [[her]1995-the countess husband]790-her husband ; and [Fabre]466-alfieri left it jointly to [[his]466-alfieri native town of [Montpellier]5-montpellier]3860-his native town of montpellier , and to [[his]466-alfieri friend]1173-his friend the [Cavaliere Emilio Santarelli]247-cavaliere emilio santarelli , who still lives and recollects [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany .

The famous epitaph , composed by [Alfieri]466-alfieri for [himself]466-alfieri , had been mangled by [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany and [those who helped [her]426-mme and [Canova]72-canova in devising [his]466-alfieri tomb]3862-those who helped her and canova in devising his tomb ; the companion epitaph , the one in which [Alfieri]466-alfieri described [the Countess]1995-the countess as buried next to [him]466-alfieri , was also mangled in its adaptation to [a tomb erected in [Santa Croce]493-santa croce , entirely separate from [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's]3864-a tomb erected in santa croce , entirely separate from alfieri 's . On [that monument of Mme]3865-that monument of mme . d'Albany , in [the chapel where moulder the frescoes of [Masolino]515-masolino]3866-the chapel where moulder the frescoes of masolino , there is not a word of that sentence of [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's about [the dead woman]3867-the dead woman having been to [him]466-alfieri dearer and more respected than any other human thing . [Mme]426-mme . d'Albany had changed into quite another being between 1803 and 1824 ; [the friend of [Sismondi]466-alfieri]3868-the friend of sismondi , of [Foscolo]213-foscolo , of [Mme]426-mme . [de Staël]426-mme , [the worldly friend of many friends]3869-the worldly friend of many friends , seemed to have no connection with [the lady who had wept for [Alfieri]466-alfieri in [the convent at [Rome]10-rome]3871-the convent at rome , who had borne with all [Alfieri]466-alfieri 's misanthropic furies after the Revolution , any more than with [the delicate intellectual girl whom [Charles Edward]204-charles edward had nearly done to death in [his]204-charles edward drunken jealousy]3872-the delicate intellectual girl whom charles edward had nearly done to death in his drunken jealousy]3870-the lady who had wept for alfieri in the convent at rome , who had borne with all alfieri 's misanthropic furies after the revolution , any more than with the delicate intellectual girl whom charles edward had nearly done to death in his drunken jealousy . So , on the whole , [Fabre]466-alfieri , and whosoever assisted [Fabre]466-alfieri , was right in concocting a new epitaph .

But to [us]3873-us , who have followed the career - whose lesson is that of the meanness which lurks in noble things , [the nobility which lurks in mean ones]3874-the nobility which lurks in mean ones - of [this woman]1716-this woman from [her]1716-this woman inauspicious wedding - day to the placid day of [her]1716-this woman death , to [us]3873-us [Louise of Stolberg]233-louise , [Countess of [Albany]196-alfieri]1122-countess of albany , [Queen of [Great Britain]1006-great britain]1005-queen of great britain , [France]35-france , and [Ireland]41-ireland , will remain , for all blame [we]3873-us may give [her]1716-this woman and [her]1716-this woman times , a figure to remember and reflect upon , principally because of those suppressed words of [her]1716-this woman epitaph : " A Victorio Alferio ultra res omnes dilecta , et quasi mortale numen ab ipso constanter habita et observata . "[1716-this woman]
